campaign.story:
BIG PROGRESSIVE IDEAS AND GORGEOUS, GONZO, GENRE COMICS
I'm Aubrey Sitterson and if you read my previous Kickstarted comic – Tyrell Cannon and my instant classic BEEF BROS – you know what I'm all about: Joining forces with the best artists around to use outrageous, bombastic concepts to explore and ruminate on world-changing, community-based ideas. That's why, when Chris Moreno (Zombie Dickheads, World War Hulk: Front Line) decided to follow up our beloved The Comic Book Story of Professional Wrestling, we developed Stoned Master, a blend of stoner comedy, kung fu action, and sun-drenched Los Angeles vibes chockablock with anti-gentrification rumination.
Stoned Master #1 is a 32-page, full-color comic book, the first of a planned five-part series cocreated by Chris and me, with letters by Taylor Esposito and logo by Tim Daniel. You can find out more below, but first and foremost…CHECK OUT HOW DOPE THIS THING LOOKS!
THC chocolate in your peanut butter
Blazed Fist vs Drunken Fist
Welcome to Chavez Heights
Honestly: What's better than this?
 Keep on scrolling to check out our rewards, including stickers, prints,  and original art and commissions by Chris!
GIMME THOSE DEETZ
Stoned Master is set in the fictional Los Angeles neighborhood of Chavez Heights, where the rapacious conglomerate RepCor is corporatizing and gentrifying everything in sight. And the only ones standing in their way? Burnout kung fu savant Frankie Wong, his drunken master, and his pals from the local cannabis dispensary. 
Imagine Kung Fu Hustle meets Pineapple Express. Or, for the old heads, Drunken Master meets Cheech & Chong. It's all the intense, artful fight scenes you expect from a martial arts epic, combined with gut-busting stoner comedy laughs, then fully baked in the Southern California sun.
While working together on The Comic Book Story of Professional Wrestling, Chris and I found ourselves jonesing for an opportunity to cut loose, free of the restrictions that come with nonfiction work. We wanted space and freedom for big, intense, outlandish action and hilarious visual comedy.
Stoned Master is our opportunity to show off, demonstrating all our strengths on a truly gonzo comic, all in service of actual good politics. With your help, we're going to make it happen, with any additional money raised spent how it rightfully should be: Paying the team more.
CHARACTER DESIGNS
As part of his efforts to make Stoned Master's Chavez Heights setting feel real, authentic, and lived in, Chris put in a ton of design work, creating characters that feel unique and visually distinct while remaining authentic and familiar.
REWARDS!
Slap it on your bong
Dare you to hang it up at work
Sample Chris Moreno commission
Sample Chris Moreno commission
WHAT IF YOU RAISE MORE MONEY?
$25,000: Everybody gets raises
In order to make Stoned Master happen, everyone's agreed to a lower rate; Aubrey isn’t taking a page rate at all! If we hit our first stretch goal, that changes, with Chris and Taylor getting raises and Aubrey getting a page rate.
$35,000: Stoned Master #2
The entire five-issue Stoned Master series is outlined and we yearn to make it happen. If we pull in enough cash on this campaign, we’ll be able to get a head start by funding the creative costs of issue #2!
$45,000: Everybody gets raises
Same as before, if we make $45,000, the entire team gets their increased rates on Stoned Master #2!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Aubrey's previous Kickstarter campaign – for the leftist superhero comic BEEF BROS – saw rewards delivered safely and on time to all backers. In addition, not only is Aubrey an experienced comic book writer, but he's also a former editor at Marvel (Punisher War Journal, Ghost Rider, etc.) and Image (The Walking Dead, Invincible), so he knows a thing or two about putting together great-looking books.

Chris is a seasoned, 20-year comic book and animation pro, well-versed in the world of self-publishing, having written, drawn, colored, lettered and published two printings of his comic Zombie Dickheads.

We have confirmed that our printer is operating at full capacity despite the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic. We have also researched multiple shipping options in order to have back-up delivery plans in place. While additional challenges may arise, we will always be communicative and upfront with our backers about the status of our project.

International backers: The COVID-19 pandemic has caused significant delays in international shipping and customs clearance. While we're happy to ship Stoned Master #1 to you, please know that we cannot guarantee a time for its arrival.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Stoned Master is happening. Chris Moreno and I are going to create the comic of our dreams, with big laughs, big action, and big ruminations on community-based politics. What's more, we're doing it the right way, delivering a premium product while keeping prices low and paying the folks involved fairly. But we couldn't have done any of it without you and your generous support. I continue to be blown away and so very grateful for this platform and opportunity to get my work in people's hands. Thank you for putting your money where your mouth is and backing gorgeous, gonzo, genre comics like Stoned Master.
WHAT'S NEXT?

updates.update_userinfo: FUNDED!!! Thank you, new art, what's next, and another rad Kickstarter to back!
updates.update_content:
With the support of hundreds of people just like you, doggone near 700 individual backers, Stoned Master has been funded! The pro-community kung fu comic is happening – there is absolutely no stopping us – but we've still got three days left in the campaign!
Just because the book's funded doesn't mean that I'm going to be shutting up about this thing. If you've seen the buzz, response, and demand to my previous Kickstartered book BEEF BROS, you know that come October, people are going to be on the hunt for extra copies of StonedMaster #1. So, please: Keep sharing our posts, keep telling people about the pro-community kung fu comic, and, if need be, add on a copy of Stoned Master for that friend you know will forget to back before Thursday.

updates.update_userinfo: ONE WEEK LEFT and we need your help!
updates.update_content:
Hey there! We've got one week left to go on the Stoned Master campaign and are currently about $3,200 shy of our goal. Below I show off some brand-new Chris Moreno art and tell you about another Kickstarter you must back, but first, some ways to help Stoned Master in its final week…
One of the things that really put us over the top on the BEEF BROS campaign were all of the kind, generous folks who ordered a double pack to share with a friend. If you know someone who would dig what we're doing on Stoned Master, considering upping your pledge to a Puff, Puff, Pass pack. Not only will it help us reach our goal and get the anti-gentrification kung fu comic made, but sharing is very much in keeping with the book's community-based politics!

updates.update_content:
We've passed the half-way point on the Stoned Master campaign, but we still need to raise a little more than $5,000 to make the anti-gentrification stoner kung fu comic a reality. Please keep talking the project up online, sharing our art drops, and, if you've got the dough to spare, consider upping your pledge to one of the Puff, Puff, Pass tiers so you have a copy to share with a pal! 
But we covered all that last time. I know what you're here for: New Chris Moreno art. It's time to meet some more residents of Chavez Heights!

updates.update_userinfo: Two weeks left; we NEED your help! Plus: Page #1 of Stoned Master, new character designs, recent coverage, and another Kickstarter you MUST back!
updates.update_content:
Alright, my fine-feathered friends, we are right here in the thick of our Stoned Master campaign with quite a ways to go. In order to get this thing across finish line, we're going to need your help. More on that in a minute though, because I can't wait a second longer…
CHECK OUT THE FIRST PAGE OF STONED MASTER #1!

updates.update_userinfo: Half-baked! We're 50% funded! Plus: NEW Stoned Master art, continuing coverage, another Kickstarter you MUST back, and favorite Cypress Hill songs!
updates.update_content:
Thank you for making Chris and my hazy dream come true, for giving us the freedom to create this unique melange of stoner comedy, Shaw Brothers kung fu movies, and community-based leftist politics. Stoned Master is a project that would have struggled to gain a foothold in the traditional comics market and we are so very fortunate to be able to connect directly with smart, interesting folks who appreciate and are excited about what we're building.
Early on in the Stoned Master development process, Chris did extensive, animation-style design work for  our cast. We've been sitting on these so we have new stuff to share throughout the campaign but what better way to celebrate hitting the half-way mark on our campaign than with some never-before-seen art!?

YOWZA! Stoned Master is more than 40% funded and rocketing toward its goal! By doing this book on Kickstarter, Chris and I are going to be able to make the stoner kung fu action comedy comic of all our hazy dreams, and it's thanks to you, the fine folks who will have been in on it from jump street!
That said, we've still got almost 60% of the way to go, so don't stop sharing Stoned Master on social media. And make sure tell all your friends, family, enemies and frenemies about it, whether they're cannabis enthusiasts, martial arts fans, or just people who love gorgeous and gonzo genre comics!

Not even the first day! We're only nine hours into this thing and we're already more than a quarter of the way funded! Thank you for being among the first to back this project and make Stoned Master a reality!
But even off to this fantastic start, we've still got a long ways to go. While we've got a ton of art to share and some other fun surprises for throughout the month, the most important part of a Kickstarter campaign is, of course, YOU, the backers!

BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY needs your help to print our new story, THE BOOK OF DEMONS (41 page story in a 48 page perfect bound book) and produce our NEW PLAGUE DOCTOR LAPEL PIN!
Here's our cover:

Who will love Boston Metaphysical Society?
Fans of Penny Dreadful, Girl Genius, Ruse, steampunk and gaslamp fantasy stories.
People who like to read paranormal, historical fiction, and/or alternate history.
If you like character-driven comics with a mix of paranormal and science fiction, then these are the comics for you!
THE STORY
When Erin, Caitlin’s mother, discovers her daughter can control a demon, she is outraged. In her mind, only a Great House has the right to such power, but who will listen to a poor Irish woman? House Lowell will. For Alice Lowell has inherited an old Puritan journal which describes how to find and enslave a demon, but she needs a psychic to do it. Kidnapping Caitlin is the first step in a plan to rid her husband’s House of debt. But with a demon to do their bidding, her ambitions will be limitless.
The Book of Demons can be read as a standalone, but it is a continuation of Ghosts and Demons.
First Three Pages:
NEW TO BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY?
If you are new to the series, the original six issue mini-series is about an ex-Pinkerton detective, a spirit photographer, and a genius scientist who battle supernatural forces in late 1800’s Boston. They  live in an alternate steampunk history where ghosts and demons are a normal part of life. Families known as the Great Houses control the economy of the Great States of America while the middle class and lower classes sole purpose are to serve the Great Houses.
The original trade paperback is available in several reward tiers.
WHAT'S IN THE TRADE?
I'm glad you asked. Not only does it include all six issues from the  original mini-series as well as the cover art, but it also contains a  ten page  short story called, Hunter-Killer,  and additional bonus pages. With art by Emily Hu and coloring by Gloria Caeli, the story is set at the beginning of the House Wars (my version of the American Civil War) and features the crew of a prototype airship.  I introduce three new characters: Gwen Warrick - Captain;  Emmet Rochester - Navigator; and Joaquin Medina - Engineer.
The complete sequential art version of Hunter-Killer will ONLY be available in the trade.
WHAT ELSE IS THERE?
Our three previous standalone sequels will be available as well. And they are:
THE SCOURGE OF THE MECHANICAL MEN 
STORY: Granville and Tesla are in a race for time to save Boston from a mysterious disease that turns human beings into machines.

THE SPIRIT OF REBELLION 
 STORY: Caitlin flees to Philadelphia only to discover a ghost, a rebellion, and perhaps, her destiny.

GHOSTS AND DEMONS 
 STORY:  A disturbing dream leads Caitlin and the team to face off with a new enemy.
THE BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY COLORING BOOK:
Twenty (20) gorgeous illustrations for you to relax  and color away to your heart's content. Includes illustrations of  Samuel, Granville, Caitlin, Tesla, Houdini, and more! It will be an 8  1/2 x 11 book and is suitable for all ages. Art by Alejandro Lee
OTHER REWARDS
In addition to THE BOOK OF DEMONS, we are offering the trade paperback, the anthology Boston Metaphysical Society: Prelude, the first novel set in this universe, Boston Metaphysical Society: A Storm of Secrets, plus a NEW PLAGUE DOCTOR LAPEL PIN. It is 1 inch in diameter and will be an antique bronze color. (Designed by Alejandro Lee.)
Lapel Pin Set
A set of SEVEN Boston Metaphysical pins (Plague Doctor, Bowler Hat, Teapot, Dirigible, Tesla, 1800's Box Camera, and Triquetra) in a lovely gift box with our logo are available as well. (As long as supplies last.)
BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY: A STORM OF SECRETS
The award winning novel, BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY: A STORM OF SECRETS, is a prequel to the original graphic novel though it can be read as a standalone. It takes place five years prior to the original series.
It was awarded a Silver Medal as well as The Write Companion Award for Best Overall TOP PICK - Adult, Children's and Young Adult categories in the 2019 Feathered Quill Book Awards.
Story: As the Great Houses of Boston jockey for power, an ex-Pinkerton detective, his psychic wife, and his father-in-law must contend with treachery, subterfuge, and a new supernatural threat, in this political and supernatural thriller set in an alternate-history Boston of 1890.
The award winning cover is by Luisa Preissler. Title Graphics by Anke Koopman.

And if you haven't read Boston Metaphysical Society: Prelude yet, then this would be the perfect time to get it. This anthology of short stories and novellas includes stories of how Granville and Samuel met and their first case together; what set Caitlin on her path; and how Samuel met his wife, Elizabeth Weldsmore Hunter. Several reward tiers  include it as either a pdf or print version.
The Underground - A Boston Metaphysical Society Short Story (Available as an Add-on for all tiers and is already included in the Granville Woods and All Things BMS tiers.) 
In The Underground,  Andrew O'Sullivan takes his young daughter, Caitlin, on a case that might reveal a past and a potential future neither of them expected. This is a prose story and is available in Epub or mobi formats. (Previously published in Last Stop on the #13.)
NEW REWARD TIER!
SPECIAL COMMISSION REWARD TIER (KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE)
Ever wanted to time travel? This will be the closest you’ll ever come when our fabulous artist Gwynn Tavares draws you into the illustration with the Granville and Alma (See image) in period costume. This will be an 11 x 17 inch poster on 80 lb. Classic Stripple. She’s only doing five, so jump on this now before they are gone.
 THE MONEY: 
SHIPPING:
Shipping last year was a challenge.  My stalwart shipping envelopes met their match at USPS, so this year I will be using the ULINE S-165 cardboard mailers (or their equivalent) along with boards and extra packing material for anything outside of California (and probably in California as well.) Those who order the Nothing But Books and All Things BMS will get the usual sturdy cardboard box as those have worked well in the past.
INTERNATIONAL SHIPPING: We were able to obtain discounted international postage for over 55 countries this year. I have passed on those savings to you depending on your shipping address. To extend these savings even further, for those who pledge to the Nothing But Books or the All Things BMS, and it is shipped to one of those 55 countries, we will be splitting up the rewards into two boxes in order for you to receive the discount. 
THE TEAM FOR THE SEQUELS:
Madeleine Holly-Rosing - Writer/Creator: A   TV, feature film, comic book writer, and novelist, Madeleine holds an   MFA in Screenwriting from UCLA where she won numerous awards as well as  the Sloan Fellowship. Madeleine has published a number of short stories, novellas, and a novel based on the BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY universe. Other comic projects include the short story, The Scout which is part of The 4th Monkey anthology, The Sanctuary (The Edgar Allan Poe Chronicles anthology), The Marriage Counselor (The Cthulhu is Hard to Spell anthology), The Glob (Night Wolf Vol. 1), Infinity Tree (Menagerie: Declassified) and the upcoming The Airship Pirate (The Rum Row anthology), and The Birth (Stan Yak Vampire Anthology).
Gwynn Tavares – Artist/Colorist: Gwynn started out her art career as a sculptor. After a few years working on   movie special effects, she decided to go into sequential art and was  the  artist for Amelia Sky. Majoring as in illustrator, Gwynn is also an  accomplished comedian and currently lives in France.
Troy Peteri – Letterer: Troy is a Los   Angeles based letterer whose credits include AMAZING SPIDER-MAN, IRON   MAN, and roughly 98% of all the comics from Top Cow Productions for the   last 6+ years. He also co-wrote and lettered ABATTOIR, a mini-series  for  Radical Comics.
THE TEAM FOR BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY TRADE PAPERBACK:
Madeleine Holly-Rosing, Writer/Creator. (See credits above.)
Emily Hu – Artist: Emily is a graduate from   the School of Visual Arts in New York City. She has been drawing ever   since she was little and it's been her lifelong dream to make it as a   comic book artist. Her main influences are Eduardo Risso, Becky  Cloonan,  and Ito Junji. She works freelance and has created covers for  BOOM!  BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY is her first comic book series. Emily  is  currently doing storyboards for Nickelodeon.
Gloria Caeli – Colorist: Based in Jakarta,   she has worked for Avicom Advertising and Stellar Labs. Her most recent   projects are BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY and VOODOO. She like anyone   else enjoys music, photography, travelling, and reads a lot of genre   related books.
Fahriza Kamaputra – Colorist:  Based in  Jakarta, Fahriza is a self-taught comics and concept artist.  He worked  as a colorist on VIENETTA AND THE STUPID ALIENS which led to  his work on  he webcomic ROKKI with Stellar Labs. His current work  includes Bob  Salley's, Salvagers and Shelter Division.
Shawn Aldridge (Letterer – Chapter 4) Shawn   Aldridge is a Portland based writer and letterer. He’s best known for   his awarding winning creator-owned sci-pulp series, VIC BOONE. He also   writes and co-created GoGetters from MonkeyBrain with artist  Christopher  Peterson. His work has also appeared in FUBAR, the NYT  bestselling  anthology series.
Troy Peteri – Letterer (Chapters 1-3, 5 and 6) (See credits above.)

The graphic novel was nominated for Best Comic/Graphic Novel at the 2014 Geekie Awards.
WHAT OTHER PEOPLE SAY
"Women and people of color take center stage in the Boston   Metaphysical Society comic, written by Madeline Holly-Rosing, with art   by Emily Hu. Inspired by fantasy and the art of storytelling,   Holly-Rosing uses her imagination to create a fantastic story that is   both well-written and fearless." - Valerie Complex (Fansided)
"If you have a taste for an intelligent, well written, elegantly   illustrated award winning independent book, you can't go wrong with   Boston Metaphysical Society!" - Alex Yarde (The Good Man Project)
"This very inventive series posits a totally believable Steampunk   world that is populated by appealing characters who act (and react) in   believable manners to the extraordinary events that swirl around them."  -  Robert Sodaro (Comic Reviewer at Examiner.com)
THE STORY BEHIND THE STORY
I love writing BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY.  Not only does it bring my  love of science fiction and history  together, (which by the way, equals  steampunk), the steampunk time  period allows me to address the themes  of classism, sexism, and racism  in America in a thoughtful and engaging  way. For at its very core,  BOSTON METAPHYSICAL SOCIETY is an American  story. And you can't tell an  American story without including women and  people of color.
It has been and always will be important to me to write characters  who, though they come from diverse backgrounds and have different  points  of view, are able to work together for the common good.
ADD-ONS
I have decided not to use the option of Kickstarter add-ons during this campaign, though I will be using Backerkit when I send out the surveys if you'd like to add anything to your pledge.
STRETCH GOALS

updates.update_userinfo: Progress Update Along with Audio Drama News, and more
updates.update_content:
Hello Awesome Backers:
Lots of things going on, but first...
Gwynn has gotten five more pages done which leaves 15 to go.  So we are getting there. We are still on track for an August delivery as everything else is in place. I'll be ordering the packaging soon so that is ready to go and then the prints next month.  But here are a couple of spoiler free panels to show off.

updates.update_userinfo: Production News, "Scourge" News and Other Updates
updates.update_content:
Hello Awesome Backers:
After a brief, but much needed vacation, I am back. We made a trip down to the San Diego area to see vaccinated friends, some cool animals at the Safari Park, and discovered a terrific cookie place called Sumptuous Cookies.  (And they were.)  Now to the important stuff...
Gwynn has turned in more pages. Here are a a couple of spoiler free panels. :) So we are getting there.

Hello Awesome Backers:
Gwynn is moving along, but it looks like she won't be done until the end of the month. (She's got a one year old boy who continuously moves all the pots and pans in the kitchen. hahaha)   This will not affect the August delivery date. If there are any changes, I will let you know ASAP. In the meantime, here's a sneak peek at more art.

updates.update_userinfo: Thank you! Thank you! Thank you!
updates.update_content:
Hello Awesome Backers:
I am simply overwhelmed and honored at the support the project has gotten. Thank you so much. It means the world to me.

Hello Awesome Backers:
With only three days left in the campaign, I am absolutely stunned.  I always plan well to have a successful campaign, but I never expected anything like this. Once again, thank you.
As I mentioned in the last update, Gwynn is a little behind on finishing the coloring on the pages but right now it looks like it should not delay the delivery date. My letterer (Troy) and pre-press guy (Jason) are on standby. :)   I will keep you informed.

Hello Awesome Backers:
I wanted to share some of the work Gwynn has been doing.

updates.update_userinfo: Audio Drama Casting Announcement and Stretch Goals
updates.update_content:
Hello Awesome Backers:
I'm humbled and honored at the support the project is getting. Thank you again for smashing through another stretch goal. I hadn't planned on anything after this one (#11), but let me ponder for a few days and see what I can come up with.
THE GHOST SHIP AUDIO DRAMA CASTING

Hello Awesome Backers: 
You are the most amazing backers ever. We are heading into Stretch Goal #11. Wow! I can't thank you enough. And you're getting so many goodies!!
By popular demand, I am adding a stretch goal of a print of the cover (without lettering).

updates.update_userinfo: Boston Metaphysical Society: The Ghost Ship Audio Drama Leads Reveal!
updates.update_content:
Hello Awesome Backers:
For those of you who've been with me for awhile, you know that we've been in pre-production for the first Boston Metaphysical audio drama called, The Ghost Ship. For those of you who haven't, it is an eight episode full -cast audio drama (about 30 minutes per episode) taking place during the the time period of the first six issue mini-series. And we have cast our leads! Yah!

campaign.story:
The Saturn Effect: Alpha #2 is a new 27 page installment in the TSE universe and the second in an eight part series! Backing this Kickstarter helps fund the printing for our already completed issues #1 and #2 of TSE: Alpha and the production of issue #3!  
Standard Cover of TSE: Alpha #2
Its been a few months since the events of TSE:Alpha, and now with tensions rising, our stellar siblings venture deeper into Mega Station Six to discover the mysteries hidden within, while familiar faces give us a look at the surface of Saturn's moon, Titan!
Page 15 of TSE:Alpha #2
The Saturn Effect is a growing connected sci-fi universe and webcomic created by Chris Moses, featuring multiple artists on different characters (find more at thesaturneffect.com). Set two years after the explosive conclusion of The Saturn Effect: Ajax, this installment in the universe continues the story of Alpha, as he and his sister Centauri deal with the consequences of war on their home, people and family.
Cover for our DELUXE Issue, featuring a VARIANT by Francesco Mazzoli with colors by Marco Turambar d'Alessandro
PAGE 1 of Alpha #2
PAGE 2 of TSE:Alpha #2
PAGE 3 of TSE:Alpha #2
Backers are helping fund the printing of the physical issue. Supporting this Kickstarter gives you access to the DIGITAL PDF of The Saturn Effect: Alpha #2, with copies being sent when this campaign ends. Other tiers include a PRINTED* physical issue, a DELUXE VARIANT* physical issue, and even joining the universe as an EXTRA*. 

Miss out on our previous campaign? Don't worry, we have multiple CATCHUP tiers that include not only The Saturn Effect: Alpha #1 (right), but also the 40 page DELUXE VARIANT (left) and "Martian Wars" poster!

Miss our first campaign? Find rewards from our previous Kickstarter in one of our catch up tiers!

Are you interested in ORIGINAL, SIGNED,  traditionally drawn TSE:ALPHA #2 pages by Francesco Mazzoli? Here are THREE available exclusively on this Kickstarter! Each includes an ALPHA CATCHUP Bundle.  Don't miss out! 
Page 8-9 is a two page spread from The Saturn Effect: Alpha #2
Page 17 from The Saturn Effect: Alpha #2
Page Fourteen of The Saturn Effect: Alpha #2
Vote for the cover of our next issue, The Saturn Effect: Alpha #3 by staying up to date on all polls and other TSE news at our Instagram and twitter!
Follow our artist Francesco Mazzoli, colorist Marco Turambar d'Alessandro, letterer Reed Hinckley-Barnes, logo designer Winston Gambro, music creator Winn "GODONTGO" Murray, video editor Nick Maillet, and creator Chris Moses!
Red Sea Comics is Chris Moses' new label for his creator owned work!
 Check out Red Sea Comics on Twitter and Instagram to stay up to date on our upcoming projects. Website COMING SOON!

Here's a look at one of the projects coming this summer, a Sci-Fi thriller titled The Boggart written by Chris Moses with art by Brian Azcurra, colors by Marissa Louisse and letters by Reed Hinckley-Barnes!
Meet Caleb when the Kickstarter for The Boggart goes live this Summer!

campaign.story:
Outlaws seeking redemption. Cowpolk seeking revenge. Horses. Everybody loves a good western, so let's give them a bunch to read.

Cover art by Jimmy Kucaj. Temporary lettering by Brentt Harshman (not final)
Off Into The Sunset is a 120+ Page anthology curated by Brentt Harshman collecting stories inspired by westerns. Whether the story is a straight up classic western or a spy story using narrative devices popularized by westerns, a western set on a distant planet or a couple of disgraced knights trying to redeem their names, this anthology has got it all. The book is in full color, though some teams have opted to tell their stories in black and white feeling it fit their tone better.

Concept art by Skylar Patridge for story with Brent Fisher and Liana Kangas
Concept and Character Art by Kenneth Laster
Snippet of a page by Randy Haldeman for his story with Mario Candelaria

 Art by Heather Vaughan for story with David Ashburn

Page of pencils for Last Canteen by Ben Humeniuk
Character designs by Jen Hickman for their story with Brittany Matter.

Pinup by J. Paul Schiek, teasing his story with Brentt Harshman

A page of art by Armando Zanker for his story with Eric Palicki

First page of pencils by Andy Michael for his story with Brentt Harshman

Two panels from Marcus Jimenez's story

A page by Christopher Alvarez for his story with DB Andry

The first page of Chris C Hernandez and Daniel Calvo's story

NEW ADD-ONS!!!

We are excited to announce two brand new add-ons to celebrate a FANTASTIC first half of the campaign. 

First, a deluxe digital bundle of comics by contributors to Off Into The Sunset. For $5, we will send you A TON of comics straight to your inbox on top of your order.

Secondly, we are PROUD to offer a LIMITED print by KELLY BRACK. For $20 extra, you get this gorgeous piece of work to frame and hang. Only 20 of these bad boys available!

ADD THESE NOW! 

New backers: you will be offered a chance to add on additional merchandise when you choose which tier you want to back at. 

Pre-existing Backers: you are able to MANAGE your pledge, which will allow you to choose new add-ons.

Do this ASAP, because I expect the Kelly Brack prints to sell out QUICKLY.
Curated by Brentt Harshman, Off Into The Sunset features stories by today's hottest and freshest talent.



We are seeking $20,000. Normally we'd just rob a train or a bank, but we're trying to find redemption. So, here we are, on Kickstarter. 
The budget will be put towards a page rate for the contributing teams, printing costs, shipping costs, taxes and fees, and a safety cushion in case we miscalculated anything. Anything left over, or if we happen to exceed our goal, will go towards upping the page rate for the teams involved in these stories. 
Aside from a few stories offered by friends (sampled below), the book is still in production. The goal is to have the book ready for print by June. We aim to have the books shipped and into your hands by mid-July.

updates.update_content:
Two weeks have passed and I haven't given an official update yet so here we go!

First off: THANK YOU SO MUCH! AGAIN! You all don't understand how much this means to my teams and me. We are so stoked you have taken a chance on us and we are even more stoked to get this book made and in your hands!

updates.update_userinfo: ...and so the two gunmen rode off into the sunset.
updates.update_content:
With a little over an hour left in the campaign, it's time to start wrapping things up on this side of things and get to work on the production side of things.

First and foremost, thank you all so much. Without the passion of the comics community, this anthology would not have gotten funded and I am incredibly humbled. When I first started planning out this book, I had little confidence in it. I thought we'd get to around $4,000 and start to fizzle out immediately. This wasn't the case. The first day blew my mind, then each and every day we slowly continued to climb the steep mountain towards $20,000. Then yesterday happened. I nearly cried so many happy tears at work but had to hold back because the health department was at my restaurant and I didn't want to change our grade due to tears in the food.

Well damn.

we are so close, with only so little time left. if you’ve been waiting to back, now’s the time.

keeping this short and sweet. we’ve only got 24 hours left to meet our $20k goal, and we are within spittin distance.

Three days remain.

Just $5k still to go.

Wow.

It's been quite the journey, cowboy, but we're almost there. 

Seven days. Holy cow. We are SO CLOSE, to the finish line AND our goal, but we've still got a few hills to climb. We are just shy of $14k, which means we are just over $6k away from our $20k goal. Damn. Blowing my mind, we have surpassed even my expectation. We have had new backers every single day, and that's inspiring. I truly believe we can get to our goals and make this book.

Wow. Life has been...insane, to say the least. I manage a restaurant in Los Angeles and, aside from starting to open up for indoors dining, we've also started serving breakfast. My work hours have been insane. On top of that, I also spent the last few days recovering from an INCREDIBLY sore back. Life's been insane, but what's even more insane is that WE ARE HALF-WAY THERE! Half-way funded and half-way through the campaign. Thank you, everybod who has seen this project and believed in it. We appreciate you, this book cannot be made without you, and people like you.

What an incredible launch. In 24 hours we have gotten to the 35% mark ($7k) with 200+ backers. It's been insane. So, for that, thank you so much. We are incredibly excited about this project and it's wonderful seeing that excitement from y'all as well. So, to celebrate, here's some fresh art:

campaign.story:
The first issue of Young Offenders! introduced readers to a world where the leading superheroes have disappeared and their misfit successors have risen out from under their shadow to replace them. 
Our readers met emo frontman/demon-from-Hell Victor, the invulnerable college dropout Colin, the type-A legacy Jane, the bubbly and armor-clad Elaine, and the magical mean girl Esperanza as they crashed onto the scene to prevent a nuclear meltdown in midtown. 
If you missed our issue one campaign, check out a massive, 16-page preview of our extra-sized first issue and select a reward tier or an add-on with a digital or print copy of #1!
Issue #1: Pages 9 through 13
Unbeknownst to our fledgling heroes, the death god Hun-Came, the architect behind the superhero disappearance, is sending his forces to destroy what he thinks is an unprotected Earth in issues #2 and #3 of Young Offenders! This campaign is aiming to fund these two issues in order to complete what we hope will be only the first arc of a much longer series. 
Page 36 of Young Offenders! #1
In issue two, it's time for this make-shift team to figure out where they stand before the attack reaches earth. We'll see the urban vigilante and knife aficionado Jane teaching that spoiled rich boy Colin how to actually throw a punch, Victor stepping into the role of reluctant "team dad" even as his own personal life and music career is in danger of falling apart, and Elaine and Esperanza unexpectedly bonding as investigating a "routine" power outage puts all of them right in the villainous Hun-Came's crosshairs.
Issue #2, page 2
Issue three is where everything explodes after the shocking events of issue two. Villains will be confronted, reality will be altered, and our self-involved young adults... might actually take a big step into growing into their more realized selves.
Along the way, each issue will have a back-up dedicated to exploring the background of one of our central characters. Issue two will feature a back-up focused on armored super-teen Elaine aka Whiz Kid, and issue three will have a back-up focused on that master of caustic arts, Esperanza aka Bruja!
Issue #2, Page 3
Creative Team!
Writer Mark O. Stack is a Chicano comics writer based in New Jersey who has been self-publishing comics since 2016. His work includes editing and writing the lead feature for the inclusive superhero comics magazine Weekend Warrior Comics (successfully funded on Kickstarter!) and scripting the critically acclaimed graphic novella The Scent of May Rain, the latter of which Scott Snyder (Undiscovered Country, Dark Nights: Death Metal) praised for Stack's "ability to create a whole superhero mythology." He is currently writing an unannounced middle-grade graphic novel. 
Issue #2, page 4
 Artist Mike Becker is a cartoonist based in Philadelphia. After graduating from the Savannah College of Art and Design with an MFA in sequential art, Mike has been working as an independent illustrator since 2016, and recently began self-publishing his creator owned superhero webcomic, Empyrex Adventures on Instagram (@Empyrex_Adventures).
H.E.R.C. on page 30 of #1, and page 1 of #2
Letterer and designer Jodie Troutman is a comics creator based in Arizona. She's best known for literary goofs like Lit Brick and The Gospel of Carol. You can find her on Twitter @LongTallJodie and her comics at troutcave.net.
The Whiz Kid back-up in #2 is being drawn by Savannah College of Art & Design alumni Sydney Anderson!
And the Bruja back-up in #3 is being drawn by Emily Ree (Anarchy Dreamers, Marshmallow Horns) and co-written by our own Jodie Troutman!
Rewards!
 $5 Issue One Digital: Missed out on our first campaign? Back here to get the 52-page first issue as a PDF!
 $10 Issues #1-3 Arc: For this incredibly low cost, you'll receive PDFs of all three issues in the first arc of Young Offenders! 
 $15 Digital Archive: This digital comics bundle features more comics set within the universe of Young Offenders! including a new, unreleased origin for Jane's father, The Lark! Over 150 pages of a superhero shared universe with titles like The Scent of May Rain, Herakles, Weekend Warrior Comics #1, Joey in the Wilderness, and The Lark's Song. Cartoonist Lane Lloyd has also generously donated digital copies of their zany, sci-fi cult hit God Puncher vol. 1!
 $20 Issue #2 + 3 in Print: Already have your print copy of #1? Pledge here to secure print copies of #2 and #3 to finish the arc!
 $30 Issues #1-3 in Print: Missed out on the first campaign? Back at this level to secure print copies of the entire first arc.
 $35 Art Prints: Receive issues two and three in print as well as two exclusive prints created for this campaign created by back-up artists Sydney Anderson and Emily Ree. We will be providing illustration prompts for backers to vote on at the end of the first week for the final concept for the prints! 
 $200 Original Art: Own a piece of Young Offenders! by pledging at this level to claim a page of original art from issue one. When pledging at this level, please message the campaign with three pages in order of preference. 
 NEW DELUXE REWARD PACKAGE
We've added two exclusive deluxe packages that come with all previous rewards as well as something BIG: Create Your Own Young Offender!
Our most deluxe tier package will allow you to work directly with Mike Becker and Mark O. Stack to create your own teen superhero character. You'll be able to provide Mike with your character's name and description, and he'll sketch various design possibilities. After up to three rounds of notes, you'll finalize the design with Mike and you'll get to work with Mark to create a one-page origin/introduction for your new hero!
Mike Becker's early Demon Boy sketches
When you're happy with the script, Mike will draw the page traditionally and finish it digitally. You'll receive the original art for the page, sign an agreement stating your ownership of the character, and receive a high resolution file of the completed (colors and letters) page for your own personal or professional use.
If you'd like, we can also include the final page in Young Offenders! #3 and discuss a future appearance in a later issue with your consultation on the writing of the character. Ultimately, this character will be entirely yours! The Create Your Own Young Offender! is limited to two backers at the $1000 level.
Mike with a page of original art from Young Offenders! #1
Creating a character that a backer will own entirely is a lot of work, but you've seen how much work we've put into this book from Mike's design work to the characterization we both strive for so we think the cost of this tier (which comes with all our other amazing rewards) will be worth it to anyone who selects it. This is a chance to create something that you'll be proud of and, if you want, spin-off into your own comic!
Add-On's!
Print copies of The Scent of May Rain, Weekend Warrior Comics #1, and Young Offenders #1.
In addition to the rewards offered above, you can also add-on a limited number of items after you select your pledge: 
print copies of issues one through three! 
print copies of The Scent of May Rain, praised by superstar comics writer Scott Snyder (Nocterra, Batman): "The Scent of May Rain is a stunning debut. A book that both celebrates and subverts the hero genre to create a daring, confident, and heartfelt meditation on history, identity and self realization. A stirring and exquisite call for a better tomorrow." 
The Scent of May Rain preview by Kaylee Rowena
print copies of the comics magazine Weekend Warrior Comics #1! Featuring stories by Ned Barnett, Colt Hoskins, Francesca Lyn, and more!
exclusive art prints by guest artists Sydney Anderson and Emily Ree! The final concepts for these will be voted on by backers!
and we have 15 remaining prints leftover from our previous campaign from illustrator extraordinaire Kira Okamoto!
8.5'' x 11'' print by Kira Okamoto
Select Praise for Young Offenders! 
"Young Offenders! is a heck of a comic. Becker’s action is kinetic. Meanwhile, Stack’s character work is striking. It is utterly expansive and vibrant — alive beyond the immediate confines of page and panel and book." - AIPT.com 
"[I]f you like superheroes, especially teen ones, you really ought to check out Young Offenders!" - Ted Brandt, Crowded 
 "YOUNG OFFENDERS CAPTURES THE JOY OF DISCOVERING SUPERHEROES." - Urbane Turtle 
Funding
Our goal for this Kickstarter is larger than the first one because we are looking to fund the creation of two issues at once so that we can complete the first arc more quickly and get it to our readers without an unnecessarily long wait between issues. All the scripts are written, so now we just need the funds to make sure Mike has the space to comfortably complete the work on these two issues.
Our goal of $10,000 is largely made up of production costs (art, lettering, design, etc.) as well as printing and shipping these books to our backers.
Stretch Goals!
 $12,000: Print copies of the ongoing spin-off web serial, The Lark: Birthday Wishes by Colt Hoskins and Mark O. Stack, will be collected in print and made available to backers as an add-on as well as added to the Digital Archive tier.
$15,000: TO BE ANNOUNCED
Shipping Schedule!
To clarify the release schedule of these issues, all PDF copies of Young Offenders #1 along with the Digital Archive will be sent out to backers immediately once the campaign is funded and charges have cleared. PDFs of issues two and three will be sent out to backers as they are completed in July and September, respectively. 
To keep shipping costs down for our backers, we are planning to mail out the print copies of all issues together once #3 has been printed (with a goal of shipping no later than November), but backers can message us about paying an additional shipping charge to receive print copies of #2 (and whatever additional books/items they've selected) once they are finalized.
I have personally run three successful Kickstarter campaigns in the last two years with very fast fulfillments. My latest campaign to reprint The Scent of May Rain was printed and shipped to backers within weeks of me receiving the Kickstarter funds. Although the production of these two issues means this campaign will take longer to fulfill than the first one, we feel comfortable in promising a successful fulfillment of your rewards.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I am happy to report that I have fulfilled all three of my previously successful Kickstarter campaigns with many comments from backers indicating that they were surprised and excited about how quickly we were able to put our books in the mail. As such, I feel confident about our ability to hit the delivery dates we've set-up for issue two and for issue three. 

If there are any issues with printing or the postal service that delay production and/or shipping, we will be quick to update all of you about the issue and provide updated timelines.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
I will be brief but full of information: We did it! Over 400 of you came together to help Mike, Jodie, and I get this off the ground and finish the first arc of our book. Even better, you're helping us pay some talented friends to join us for some prints and back-up stories to make each issue an even fuller experience.
Do check your email for anything from Kickstarter. There is always the potential that Kickstarter may not have been able to process your charge, so if you're nervous or not sure then it's best to check to see if that's gone through.

Hello!
There really isn't enough we can say to thank you for helping us raise our goal and more, so we'll have to settle for putting our heart and soul into finishing these books and sending them out to all of you. Our physical rewards are almost gone at this point, so if you were hoping to upgrade or add-on some books this is the last call for that. Other than that, we'd appreciate any help you can provide in sharing our campaign one last time because we want to make sure as many folks as possible have the opportunity to jump-on while there's still time.

I didn't want to announce it too early in case there was a big cancellation or two, but here on day 5 we are fully funded!
I know I say "thank you" in every update, but I really do sincerely have to thank every single one of you all for the incredible amount of support you've shown Mike, Jodie, and I on this campaign. We take that support seriously and are going to work really hard to make the best books imaginable for you and ensure that you receive exactly what you were promised.

Hello all!
We are rapidly approaching the finish line here in terms of funding and days left for our campaign. We have less than a week now before our campaign ends in the early hours of May 5th, and we have less than $1000 to go.
It feels incredible to be approaching this incredible goal with all of your support. To those of you who have upgraded your pledges in the last week, I greatly appreciate that. Demand has also meant that we've added more #1-3 print bundles and more Weekend Warrior Comics bundles, so if you know anyone who was hoping to get print copies instead of digital then this should hopefully make them happy.

As you've just read in the headline, this campaign is now down to single digit days on Kickstarter with a little more than a week left. At 85% funding, we now need a little less than $1,500 to fund. We are INCREDIBLY close. Essentially, we just need a few more really good days to get us there and to confirm that you will be getting these books in your hands/inboxes. 
The final couple days of a campaign can get pretty wild with a rush of last minute backers, but we'd rather not depend on that! So, every share or direct recommendation of the campaign that you make to someone will have a direct effect on getting us to our goal before we get to those final nail-biting hours!

Hello backers! Yesterday was an incredible day for our campaign. You must be getting sick of me thanking all of you for the incredible support you've shown, but it's no joke that every single share and pledge from you all has brought us this far and will help us reach our funding by May 5th.
If you've read the first issue, you may have seen Mike Becker's design notes and how he draws cute, "chibi" versions of the characters to use as quick costume reference. Who knows, maybe we'll find a way to do a future issue in this super-cute style?

You read that correctly, we are now 75% funded with plenty of time ahead of us in the third week of our campaign. Our print bundles for issues #1-3 are dwindling with only 30 available currently. If you're a digital backer who was considering upgrading to print, that window of availability continues to shrink. However, there are still print copies of #1, The Scent of May Rain, and more available as add-ons.
Thank you once again for every pledge and every share of the campaign. You've all brought us so far, and we're excited to be looking at smashing our goal, funding on May 5th, and working to put these books in your hands/inboxes.

campaign.story:
BONUS STRETCH GOAL: Portfolio Pod
Adds an special envelope to all tiers (aside from the Digital Pod) which will have the exclusive prints by Palmer, Shalvey, self, as well as John Paul Leon's black and white cover artwork for TIME BEFORE TIME #1, and a further selection of artists.
Ever been curious how a creator owned comic is made? Well here's a chance to see all the nuts and bolts of how one is put together...
 My name is Declan Shalvey, an award winning artist/writer from Ireland. I've been a freelance artist for over 10 years working for publishers such as Marvel and DC Comics on characters such as Moon Knight, Wolverine, Batman, Hulk and many more. I have also developed creator owned projects at Image comics, on books such as Injection, Savage Town and Bog Bodies.

TIME BEFORE TIME is my latest creator owned series, debuting May 12th. The series begins in the year 2140, and to escape that world with no future, many turn to the  Syndicate, a criminal organization who, for the right price, will  smuggle you back in time to a better life. After working for the  Syndicate for years, out main characters Tatsuo and Oscar decide to steal one of their  boss’s time machines—but soon find that the one thing you can’t run from  is your past.

This series is a new ongoing image series from myself and the creative team behind the recent and excellent WRITE IT IN BLOOD graphic novel. The Final Order Cutoff (FOC) to order #1 is soon; April 19th. To celebrate this new project, I'm doing something a little different... I want to pull back the curtain on the creation of an original series, for process junkies everywhere.      
 TIME BEFORE TIME: Process Edition is a 48 page process book, about making the new Image series, revealing the creative process behind developing the first issue of the series.  This is not the Image comic book that will be in comic stores; this is a book about how the comic was made. It's a rare opportunity to see all the raw elements of a comic develop into a finished piece of work.
Why Kickstarter? Well, this is an experiment for me, I've often been told that I should make some process projects though I haven't been sure how to release them. I also felt a companion process book would be a great way to dig deep into process material in a way that wouldn't be possible in a regular comic or trade collection. I've never launched a project on Kickstater before (though I've backed too many to remember!) but with a new Image series, I felt it would be an unique opportunity to put out a book like this and establish a platform to do more in the future. 
 Process Edition interior pages

Our TIME BEFORE TIME: Process Edition backers get access to...     

-Interviews with creators
-Co-writing conversation, with Declan Shalvey and Rory McConville
-Art process, by Joe Palmer (including sketches, layouts)
-Script to art comparisons, with commentary by creators.
-Cover process, by Declan Shalvey

Book designed by TIME BEFORE TIME, DECORUM and IMAGE+ designer Sasha Head
Rewards include limited edition prints, stickers, trading cards and opportunities to get signed books/ sketches from Declan Shalvey and even an original piece of TIME BEFORE TIME artwork, made specifically for this campaign.
TIME BEFORE TIME trading card set (six in set)
Exclusive TBT Kickstarter print by Joe Palmer
Exclusive TBT Kickstarter print by Declan Shalvey
Exclusive TBT original artwork by Declan Shalvey
'Syndicate' sticker
There's more! As a special reward, for the first 150 who pledge at the Collector tier, they will receive a special numbered Collector Edition of the book, which contains all that is in the standard book but with added materialincluding… 

-A full colour upgrade .
-Added page count totaling 60 pages.
-Added section on colouring with Chris O'Halloran.
-Added section on lettering, with Hassan Otsmane-Elhaou.
-A special gold foil cover, signed by Declan Shalvey.

 Process Edition 'Collector/foil' upgrade -limited to 150 copies 
 Collector Edition interiors (w/colour upgrade)
 Declan Shalvey is an award winning artist/writer from Ireland who has worked with all the the top publishers in the comics industry. He is best known for his acclaimed run on MOON KNIGHT for Marvel Comics, revamping the character for a new audience and soon to be seen in its own Disney+ TV series.
Shalvey has worked on hit titles and characters such as IMMORTAL HULK, BATMAN, DEADPOOL VS OLD MAN LOGAN, and WOLVERINE. He as also developed creator owned projects such as INJECTION and BOG BODIES from Image Comics. Twitter/Instagram
Rory McConville is  an Irish writer living in London. His work includes TIME BEFORE TIME  and WRITE IT IN BLOOD for Image Comics, as well as several series for  2000 AD, including JUDGE DREDD and DEPARTMENT K. Twitter
Joe Palmer is a comic book artist living and working in London, UK. He drew the original graphic novel WRITE IT IN BLOOD, published by Image Comics. Joe’s latest project is TIME BEFORE TIME, also with Image Comics. Twitter/Instagram
Chris O’Halloran is an Irish comic book colorist living in Cork. He's worked on  books for Marvel, DC, Image and others including ICE CREAM MAN, SCARENTHOOD, IMMORTAL HULK and WRITE IT IN BLOOD. Twitter/Instagram
Hassan Otsmane-Elhaou is a British-Algerian letterer who has worked on comics like  WRITE IT IN BLOOD, X-O MANOWAR, and FIRST KNIFE. He's also the editor of  the Eisner-winning PANELxPANEL magazine, and voice behind the STRIP PANEL NAKED series. Twitter
Heather Antos is an award-winning comic book editor and writer most known for her work on Marvel's  STAR WARS and DEADPOOL lines,  as well as one of the co-creators of GWENPOOL. Now, you can find her editing various titles at Image, Valiant, and Humanoids. Twitter/Instagram
Sasha E Head  is a branding and editorial graphic designer who works in  comics and video games. She is best known for her art direction and design work on Image Comics’ monthly publication IMAGE+ as well as her work on  Jonathan Hickman & Mike Huddleston’s series DECORUM. She is not a  time traveler, and even if she was she wouldn't admit it here. Twitter/Instagram
We have some really great stretch goals beyond the original funding goal, so there's more rewards available the more support the project gets.
TIME BEFORE TIME: Process Edition will be a great insight into the making of an exciting new series, with some exclusive perks from artist/writer Declan Shalvey.

Shipping will cost a flat fee of €10 to anywhere in the world. Keeping in mind various Brexit and lockdown complications (possible printer delays, traveling to fulfillment location for signatures, etc), our target for delivery of the book is end of July.

campaign.story:
Bear witness to the to the ultimate culture clash in KILLEROO: SEMPER FI. 
When American soldiers are tasked with re-establishing contact with a black site nestled deep in the heart of the Kakadu National Park in Australia, soldier and outback myth will face off in the ultimate game of cat and mouse. The bodies will mount, loyalties will be tested and no one will come out of the bush unscathed.
Creative duo Matthew Soall (Weird Crap in Australia Vol. 1) and Ignacio Di Meglio (Hyper Epics: The Ace, Body and Soule, The Last Battle, Graphic Mundi: Covid Chronicles and Critical Role sizzle reel: Strength) offers a forty-eight page, full-colour comic telling one complete story. Matthew has incorporated real-world locations informed by research conducted for the Weird Crap in Australia podcast to give the book a conspiratorial flare, while Ignacio breathes new life into the Australian bush and presents KILLEROO like you have never seen him before.
There's also a definite influence of the classic film PREDATOR, which is one of our favourite films.
KILLEROO: SEMPER FI will reward long-time readers with a brand new adventure, while introducing new readers to Australia's favourite indie comic marsupial in all his brutal glory.


Not only do we have a great cover for the book by Ignacio, but we're very lucky to have an awesome alternate cover by one of my mentors, Jason Badower (fresh off his run on JOKER/HARLEY: CRIMINAL SANITY from DC Comics!) - how cool is that!

Ignacio has made a solid start on the book, having drawn the first 5 pages and several key battle sequences already. He has also adapted his style for this book, adopting a heavy blacks and texture style with a strong colour palette. Take a look:

If you've never heard of Killeroo before, he is an Australian comics character, created by myself (Darren Close) way back in 1995. 
I have since published over a dozen comic books about him, working with some of the best writers and artists in Australia and abroad.
He is a kangaroo/human hybrid created by the Australian military in a secret facility back in the 1970s. Bred to be the ultimate soldier for the harsh Australian outback, for a war that never happened. Since he escaped that facility (and termination), he has formed a bond with the Aboriginal community, and is often found fighting for them and the environment against the destructive encroachment of industry and corporations.
To the general public, he is a myth - something akin to Bigfoot or the Loch Ness monster. This is because few of those who encounter him live to tell about it.


We're looking to finance a brand new 48-page full colour comic book.
Getting an artist of Ignacio's calibre for a project like this isn't easy, and can't really be done without some assistance to pay his page rates. So while he was gracious enough to produce the sample pages you can see here, payment is needed to complete the rest of the book. That's why this project has a larger goal than I've sought for previous campaigns, to make sure both the artist (and the writer) are properly compensated for the work they've done.
I've also structured the campaign so that they will receive a significant percentage of the funds raised if we exceed our target. So the more funds I can generate, the better the deal for them as creators. Because they deserve it.





We've partnered with some other great kickstarter campaigns running right now, which means if you back both this campaign and theirs, you get some extra goodies!

Dustin Brunell's GREED

Ben Slabak's AHMOSE Book 1 
Our second double-backer print comes with the newly launched GORILLA MY DREAMS campaign from Big Tim Stiles. This one gets you two DIFFERENT prints - a colour one by Ignacio, and a B&W piece by Samir Simao!

Add-ons are a new feature to Kickstarter, and they work by enabling you to choose some extra items to add to your pledge, after you've selected the reward you want. 
You can add other Killeroo comic books, t-shirts, and even slabbed and graded editions of this comic. Take a look at the full selection below:
DIGITAL ADD-ONS:
PHYSICAL ADD-ONS:

 One of the signature components of my Kickstarter campaigns is the extra goodies you get, for the more funding generated! So if you help to spread the word about this campaign, you'll reap the extra rewards!
 There's a bunch more physical rewards to be unlocked over the next few weeks! 


MATTHEW SOALL / WRITER
Matthew is a co-host of the Weird Crap in Australia podcast and co-author of the companion novels Weird Crap in Australia Vol.1 and Vol. 2 (Vol. 2 releasing in September 2021). Raised on a healthy diet of aliens, superheroes, and serial killers, he developed an undying passion for all things pop-culture, paranormal and macabre.
Matt currently lives in Queanbeyan, New South Wales, writing, working, and producing podcasts with his creative partner and wife, Holly Soall, while executive cat producers Talia and Joker constantly mock him for procrastinating.

IGNACIO DI MEGLIO / ARTIST
Ignacio Di Meglio has been a freelance cartoonist for more than a decade and has been drawing and telling stories for as long as he can remember. He has made comics, illustrations, and character designs for a variety of projects. You can find him on twitter as @ignaciodimeglio or near the sea waiting for Cthulhu to wake up.
DARREN CLOSE / EDITOR & PUBLISHER
Darren has been around the Australian comics scene for over 20 years, best known for his iconic KILLEROO comic book series – having published over two dozen books and selling thousands of copies in several countries. He has also produced several autobiographical stories to critical acclaim, his Ledger Award-nominated STRUGGLE book was named Best Original Comic Book of 2015 by ComicOz.
HOLLY SOALL / SCRIPT EDITOR
Butcher by day, author by night, Holly spends her days off writing, playing in her garden and watching superhero cartoons. Holly lives with her husband Matthew and her cats Talia al-Kitty and The Joker, in a two-bedroom flat crammed with comics, video games, books and movie memorabilia.
Holly is the researcher and co-host on the Weird Crap in Australia podcast, which releases every Monday on all good podcasting platforms. 


The Kickstarter Campaign: 30 Days (April 1 - April 30)
Remaining 30 pages completed (May 1 - September 1)
Shipping Survey Goes Out (September)
Book Goes to Printer: (mid-September)
Digital Rewards Released: (mid-September)
Shipping & Delivery to Australian Backers (October)
Expected delivery to International Backers - (late October)


Nothing is more important than getting your goods to you in perfect condition!
We've been making comics and doing mail orders for decades, so we make sure to make our packaging just about bullet-proof. Not only do we bag and board our books, but we also make use of bubble-wrap, hard cardboard backing and waterproof envelopes.
The shipping costs are a little more expensive because we also insist on parcel tracking, so we can make sure that your books are delivered as quickly and safely as possible.

For those who are looking for a more technical outlook on where their money is going when backing this project, here is a pie graph and percentage breakdown. The second graph shows how funds generated after reaching target goal will be distributed.


This is the third Kickstarter campaign I've run, the first being just a few months ago, which was frankly a HUGE success - hitting almost $17k in total, a staggering 676% of the $2500 I was asking for.
Not only that, but it took less than two months for everyone to receive their kickstarter pledges and rewards. And when I say rewards, there was a LOT of swag thanks to all the unlocked stretch goals!
But don't take my word for it, hear it from Corey Wyer who backed it:
The second Kickstarter campaign I ran was a full colour edition of the Killeroo origin story. While a smaller campaign, it still reached a total of over $6.2k in total, being 249% of the target goal.
I've just completed fulfilment for that second campaign last month, getting books to backers several weeks earlier than I had originally planned.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is the third Kickstarter campaign that I have run, and I have been self-publishing comic books for over 20 years - so I know what I'm doing. My first kickstarter was run in September, and within 2 months it was fully printed and delivered to every backer in Australia - ahead of my original schedule.

This Kickstarter I am asking for a larger target than before, as I need to cover the upfront payment for the writer and artist this time around. I won't see any money myself until the target goal has been surpassed, so I'm not looking to make this a big money-making exercise - I just want to get the book printed and into the hands of Killeroo fans. There's also a generous royalty payment built into the campaign, so once it surpasses the target goal, an extra 50% will go to the creators onboard.

I've also included enough to cover the Kickstarter fees and any other transactional fees and charges.

Lastly, I have made sure that all shipping costs include individual item tracking, to ensure that when the book leaves my hands, this will make sure that it gets into yours as soon as possible.

Thank you!

campaign.story:
".…I  love Vera Greentea’s writing... Her writing has a Neil Gaiman quality,  storytelling infused with a playful whimsy overlying a deeper sadness  that begs for a resolution..." -Newsarama
If you're a fan of cult Halloween classics like Coraline or The Nightmare Before Christmas, you will fall in love with the hauntingly lovely Nenetl of the Forgotten Spirits.
This graphic novel is a Limited Edition Exclusive and it will collect all 4 completed issues + extra art in a beautiful hardcover book, with an all-new cover by our precious and talented Laura Müller. The book will be 8in x 11in (quite a bit larger than the original issues), 92 full-color pages printed on a lithograph, and if the stretch goal is achieved, it will sport a UV spot lamination on the cover! After this Kickstarter is finished and the books are sold out, Second Edition will have fewer special features, so if you're a collector this Kickstarter is the only way to get this edition of Nenetl of the Forgotten Spirits!
Nenetl of the Forgotten Spirits is a spirited horror story about a ghost searching for her family during the festival of the Day of the Dead, while dodging ambitious young exorcists. Vera Greentea (Grimoire Noir, My Parallel Life) and artist Laura Müller create an autumn-friendly tale of skulls and hope.
Every year, Mexican families gather to celebrate and welcome back the souls of the dead. They decorate graveyards with marigolds and introduce their beloved spirits to their children. But when the dead ones are forgotten, their spirits are never seen again. Until one early morning on the Day of the Dead, the shroud between our worlds were opened long enough to let one forgotten spirit out…
When the lost forgotten soul of Nena discovers that she is out in the Living Realm, she makes it her mission to find a single living person who might remember her and invite her to the festival of the Day of the Dead every year. But things aren't so simple, and while she has a full day to find that person (the span of the festival), she is also hunted by several ambitious exorcists who know that she shouldn't be in the Living Realm. 
a page from Nenetl of the Forgotten Spirits
Vera Greentea writes spooky fantasies for kids and grown-ups. She's best known for GRIMOIRE NOIR (a YALSA Great Graphic Novel of 2020) and her Victorianpunk series Recipes for the Dead. You can find her comics at her website greenteapublishing.com.
Laura Müller (aka Laumii) is a fulltime concept artist from Germany with a passion for visual development and children's books. She is currently developing her gorgeous work on the German fairy tale MOTHER HULDA. You can find more of her art at https://www.artstation.com/laumii/profile. 
Our lively Kickstarter campaign will be up from March to April, during which time  we hope to collect enough money to pay Laura for her marvelous comics and cover work, print the book and ship it to you cheery Halloween and spooky fans, as well as the usual heres-and-theres (aka Kickstarter fees, buying  packaging supplies, all relevant merchandise, ISBN &  barcodes, etc.). This is going to be Greentea Publishing's first Hardcover graphic novel, of beautiful quality in full-color and large font format. We are spending everything we make on this beautiful book! As always, we will certainly and proudly be using an American printer to save on any damages to the environment. 
While we are concentrating on making the most beautiful book we can, we are adding some adorable extras that will be only available with this Kickstarter!
Everyone who orders the hardcover will also receive 2 special gifts; a beautiful Greentea Publishing/Nenetl bookmark and a Kickstarter exclusive Ex Libris sticker, onto which you can write your name and stick to the book. This way, unlike our dear little Nena, your book will never be lost or forgotten.
A Note for Acknowledgements: If you've been acknowledged in one of the previous issues of Nenetl, there will be a page for "those who have helped us along the way.". A separate page will be added for All-New Acknowledged!
We are also going to start with a Stretch Goal: 
At $17,500, we will add a spot lamination to the title of every book!
Thank you for loving Nenetl and giving her the opportunity to shine in a hardcover book! We are so pleased to bring this book to life and absolutely are grateful for your support!
-V & L 

All art in the video is by Laura Müller. Music used in the video is called No Hay Choristas by the band Un Festin Sagital.
More reviews for Nenetl of the Forgotten Spirits
"The first issue, just  out, is a nice, deceptively gentle entree into what promises to be a  proper kick-in-the-teeth bit of horror about the Mexican Day of the  Dead." -Cory Doctorow, Boing Boing
"Nenetl of the Forgotten  Spirits is an incredibly original independent book. Don’t let its  self-published status fool you; this book is as good as any published by  a larger press, and has a ton of heart behind it..." -Hidden Gems:  Panels on Pages

"...Nenetl of the Forgotten Spirits fits right in  with independents like Yi Soon Shin, the works coming out of India that  focus on the Hindu Gods, and some of the more interesting comic books  coming out of Denmark and Finland. There is a large tradition to uphold  here, and Nenetl of the Forgotten Spirits does so brilliantly." -Comics  Forge
"...Cute characters interact in a world of magic tinged with  just a little darkness, capturing the playfulness of Halloween... I  admire anybody that can create this kind of dark material in a package  that children can also enjoy, and there’s something decadent and creepy  about Nenetl of the Forgotten Spirits." -Starbust Magazine

"...Laura  and Vera have also really worked on a stylistic flair to her characters  who are individual, quirky and have a dash of cheekiness in each panel.  It’s got sequential motion that’s ever whirling through from panel to  panel. Just darn cute as well." -downthetubes
"...I absolutely  loved the artwork in this book, which reminded me of an excellently  animated film and really immerses the reader in a world of magical  realism." -Whatcha Reading?

updates.update_userinfo: Nenetl of the Forgotten Spirits: Quick Update
updates.update_content:
My dearest sugarskulls, 
We're at the quietest part of the campaign - the part where I've ordered everything and wait *_patiently_* as boxes and boxes fill up my little office area (behind my dining table). I have bubble wrap in a stack up to the ceiling, boxes of boxes in which everything will be shipped, and large box that has the stickers, bookmarks, and magnets perched on a chair. The only thing I'm waiting for still... the books. They are expected to come about 2 and a half weeks from now -- we haven't had any delays, that's just how long it takes -- but I've looking out for the mailperson myself, just in case they come early... I mean, you never know. Well, rationally I know, but still! I'm so excited to see them with the special spot cover!

updates.update_userinfo: Nenetl of the Forgotten Spirits: Surveys!
updates.update_content:
My kind sugary friends,
It's been a delightful couple of weeks as I've been working on getting the supplies together - the boxes, the shipping supplies, the orders in for the adorable extras (which I can't wait to show you photos of soon!). I finally got the go ahead from Kickstarter that everything went through today, and I've immediately sent out the surveys. The soonest we get the acknowledgments, the soonest we can order the final piece of the puzzle - the book itself! So, if you're one of the lovely ones that paid for the acknowledgment tier, please send your survey in as soon as you can, preferably by this weekend! Then, I'll immediately be able to order our books for everyone!

updates.update_userinfo: Nenetl of the Forgotten Spirits: Funded!
updates.update_content:
Dearest sugarpunks,
We did it! 
The book is funded straight into existence and I cannot wait to share the luminous, lovely story of our mischievous spirit Nena! Thank you one and all for your incredibly generous support, sweet comments and messages, and for spreading the smokey signals to others - it means so much to me to see Nenetl thrive. This story means a whole hell of a lot to me; I wrote it when I was in a much darker place and Nena helped turn my dusky world towards a pinker dawn. I hope her cheerful manner and colorful tale helps others as well, and at the very least brightens up your libraries!

campaign.story:
From Mat Groom, the co-writer of Marvel Comics' hit ULTRAMAN comics, and artist Erica D’Urso (CAPTAIN MARVEL and XENA: WARRIOR PRINCESS) comes INFERNO GIRL RED, an all-new original graphic novel that combines the high school super-heroic drama of INTO THE SPIDER-VERSE with the dynamic storytelling and world-building of Japanese tokusatsu superheroes, and the intrigue and relationship drama of British boarding school fiction.
Art by Erica D’Urso and Igor Monti
We all need something to believe in.  Especially Cássia Costa.
An ancient cult and their army of demons have stolen Cássia’s home, Apex City.  When a magical dragon bracelet rockets into her life and affixes itself to her arm, Cássia’s the only person equipped to stop the cult from offering the entire city to their dark lord.
There's just one catch...
Inferno Girl Red by Nicola Scott (w/ Annette Kwok), left, and Valeria Favoccia, right
The magical bracelet is powered by belief, and Cássia — an intensely pragmatic, rational girl – doesn’t have much to spare. She’ll have to find something to kindle her faith, though, and fast —because she has a secret legacy to live up to. Because her mother's life is on the line. And because Apex City needs Inferno Girl Red.
Hi! My name's Mat Groom. And this story, INFERNO GIRL RED, is one I’ve been working on for about three years now. I’ve always thought it was worthwhile, but I was never certain it would work… until I met Erica D’Urso. Erica is just wickedly talented. You can see that in her work on JAMES BOND, CAPTAIN MARVEL and XENA: WARRIOR PRINCESS. But it was her energy, her tremendous passion, that made me believe. Erica loves Cássia, and Cássia’s world… and that love infuses every part of this project. There’s nobody I would rather be co-creating this world with.

Inferno Girl Red Character Design
Together with colorist Igor Monti (who has a ultra-modern and vibrant style you'll recognise if you read MEGA MAN: FULLY CHARGED), letterer Becca Carey (a real star-in-the-making) and design agency For The People (a Top 10 Global Agency, according to D&AD), Erica and I are so excited to bring you this all-new 100-page superhero graphic novel.
INFERNO GIRL RED Creative Team
Kyle Higgins is editing this book. Kyle and I have been friends for half a decade, at this point. He has mentored me, in many ways (he edited my first comics series SELF/MADE), and more recently we’ve worked as a writing team on ULTRAMAN for Marvel Comics. We share a passion for the Japanese tokusatsu genre (which was a big influence here, along with British boarding school dramas and American superhero comics). And there’s little coincidence that Cássia was first introduced to the world in the back of the first issue of Kyle’s series, RADIANT BLACK. In fact, the connections between RADIANT BLACK and INFERNO GIRL RED may run deeper than you think…
Cássia’s not shy– but bouncing around from city-to-city as her Mom bounced from job-to-job meant it was hard to make friends... and any friends she did make disappeared pretty quickly once they found out who Cássia’s mother was. So instead of socialising, she focused on learning– showing a particular aptitude for science.

Cássia Costa Character Design
 
                     Now Cássia has a chance for a fresh start in Apex City. Her impressive test scores have earned her an invitation to the world-famous entrepreneur Doctor Janine Caro’s prestigious boarding school for promising young minds. There, Cássia starts to settle in. She starts to make friends. She starts to see a future for herself.
But when a magical bracelet blasts through a window while Cássia is studying late one night, everything changes. Cássia's quickly drawn into a strange war that she previously only heard about from her mother... 
Concept Art – The Griffin and Other Manifestations of Darkness
Concept Art – Cássia's Mom, and Other Mentors
Concept Art – New Friends

Ready to experience some of the story? Check out these five preview pages: 
Erica is a native Italian illustrator and comics creator, who has worked with some of the biggest characters and brands in all of fiction-- including IAN FLEMING’S JAMES BOND and XENA: WARRIOR PRINCES for Dynamite Entertainment, as well as THE LIFE OF CAPTAIN MARVEL for Marvel Comics.
Mat is a writer from Sydney, Australia. He's the co-creator and writer of SELF/MADE from Image Comics, is a co-writer on the ULTRAMAN series for Marvel Comics, and written for DC Comics projects including the CRIMES OF PASSION anthology and the TALES FROM THE DARK MULTIVERSE series.
Igor Monti is a colorist from Treviso, Italy, known for this ultra-modern and vivid style. His recent hits include MIGHTY MORPHIN POWER RANGERS and MEGA MAN: FULLY CHARGED, both from Boom! Studios.
Kyle Higgins is a #1 New York Times Best Selling author whose past work includes RADIANT BLACK, MIGHTY MORPHIN POWER RANGERS, NIGHTWING, BATMAN ETERNAL, ULTRAMAN, THE WINTER SOLDIER, HADRIAN’S WALL and THE DEAD HAND. Kyle made his debut as a comics editor in 2018, with SELF/MADE from Image Comics.
Becca is a letterer, designer and illustrator with a penchant for the handmade approach. Her lettering work ranges from household name characters (WONDER WOMAN, BATGIRL and HARLEY QUINN for DC Comics) to creator-owned sensations including RADIANT BLACK from Image Comics.
For The People is an Australian design, strategy and storytelling agency. In 2019, they became the first Australian agency ever to crack the top 10 in D&AD’s global ‘Design Agency of the Year’ annual review, sitting alongside the in-house design teams of Apple and the New York Times Magazine, as well as multinational industry giants like Jones Knowles Ritchie and Serviceplan Group.
 You may have noticed that Image Comics logo on our header. In the event that we're funded (and only in the event that we're funded), Image Comics has agreed to publish INFERNO GIRL RED in comic shops and book store markets.  But that will be a softcover. (It bears repeating, this book will only be made if we're funded.)
This Kickstarter campaign is the only place to get INFERNO GIRL RED as an oversized, deluxe format hardcover (7 x 11 inches) with an exclusive, Kickstarter-only cover and Kickstarter-edition-exclusive concept art. 
This edition will feature 100 pages of story (concept art and informational pages are additional to this page count).
