Drayton Hayes was a heavyweight boxer who was a number one contender for the belt when his career was abruptly sabotaged. He hit skid row, but was starting to make a comeback when he was kidnapped by a bizarre troupe of scoundrels calling themselves the Vaude-Villains. The mysterious mobsters convinced Drayton to join them, and he underwent a transformation which turned him into a super-powered murderous clown named Punchline!  The character was an instant fan-favorite after his debut in issue #1 of Tap Dance Killer (April of 2018.) 
Punchline is about to meet the main superhero from our universe, Apama, for the ultimate throwdown. Then we're introducing a new nemesis from beyond the grave that will dual Punchline to the death for his very soul. 
Punchline and the Vaude-Villains is a series that turns on a dime from horror to comedy, and from the super-heroic to the dark and supernatural. No knowledge of previous stories is required to enjoy this series. (Although... there are rewards that bundle all of our previous stories.)

Survey will give you option to have them signed or not.
This collector's edition is only offered through Kickstarter. 
48 pages, full color, glossy paper.
Main cover by series artist Donny Hadiwidjaja 
Variant cover by David Abrevaya 
Planned as a five issue series
Collector's edition extras include layouts, pencils & script pages
Why Kickstarter?
Even though our work is distributed nationally through Diamond Comics, without comic convention income, the numbers just don't make financial sense.  We made the tough decision to wait until the cons started happening again for new releases. And we waited and waited... and it's time to try something new. 

Kickstarter has been great for us in the past, so we're trying a new model to get stories out to our beloved readers while offering a KILLER deal to people who are new to the Hero Tomorrow Comics shared universe.  
Preview Pages

THE PLAN
This issue is fully illustrated, and over half-colored. The lettering is around 80% complete. I expect to be ready to go to press by the time the campaign ends, and rewards will ship within a month of the campaign's completion.

campaign.story:
Glitter Vipers is a new original graphic novel from myself (Joe Glass), Katie Fleming, Kelly Fitzpatrick, Lucas Gattoni and Ted Brandt, and featuring a cover by James Gifford. It tells the story of an LGBTQ+ street gang, the titular Glitter Vipers, that take to the streets of Manchester, UK to fight back against a rising tide of bigotry and prejudice against their community. You can find out more about it here.
The book featured on Kickstarter in July in a wildly successful campaign, that sees the book coming soon to Kickstarter backers and then general release later this year. 
The Glitter Vipers cover by James Gifford
However, one thing we didn't do when running that campaign was create one item that many seemed interested in: an enamel pin. 
Now, working with Made by Cooper, we have come up with a special design for an enamel pin for anyone who is excited about the book and wants to show off their Glitter Vipers pride, or even just enamel pin collectors wanting something snazzy a fabulous!
The Glitter Vipers Pin Design
Featuring a slightly simplified version of the Glitter Vipers logo, the pin will have a rainbow chrome effect metal base, and feature green enamel and white glittered enamel elements, to create something shiny, glittery and fabulous!
We're making this campaign small and straightforward, with rewards tiers limited to just the pin and the pin and the book, with thanks and digital copy tiers too. The campaign is a low goal amount as it is simply to cover the production costs of making this additional item to go into the bank of Glitter Vipers related items. 
NOTE: if you backed Glitter Vipers in the original campaign, and then back this campaign, your book and pin will arrive separately. As the pin will take longer production time than is required to finish the book, the book will ship first.

mockup for illustrative purposes

You did what?
The day after Michael Cohen went to prison, I looked him up on the Bureau of Prisons prisoner locator and started sending him postcards.  For the entire year he was in prison, I sent him postcards where I talked about the weather, being free to go outside whenever I liked, how nice New York was in the Spring, and sometimes snarked at him for how bad things were going in the country - but the one thing I always included were movie and TV spoilers, knowing he probably didn't have access to new movies and premium TV shows (everything from HBO to Netflix to Amazon Prime.)  And I decided to put them all together in a book for you to see.
Truth be told, I took pictures of the cards before I even decided I'd collect them into a book for you fine folks.  When I showed them to Sean Von Gorman, my longtime friend in comics, he decided we should probably imagine how Michael was probably reacting to the spoilers, hence the artist renderings.  This added a whole new element of humor to the idea for the book, and schadenfreude, in general.
So, obviously, spoiler alerts abound for everyone (except Michael Cohen.)
sample page from the book
In retrospect, maybe I did him a favor by spoiling the God-awful rushed ending of Game of Thrones.
Why this?  
For years, I did prisoner support for folks arrested for political activism, and what I learned is this:  by far the main drawbacks of US prison life are the boredom and the loneliness; and I learned mail is cherished as a lifeline to the outside world.  So I figured there was a better than average chance Mike was reading my cards, despite the spoilers.
What do you have against Michael Cohen?
I know he's trying to clean up his reputation now that he's been caught, but Michael Cohen is a big part of why we are where we are now in the United States.  I land on the political spectrum somewhere around "polar opposite of Donald Trump", and I saw Cohen lie, cheat, and bully his way for Trump during the 2016 campaign cycle.  He's no friend of ours - but because his attempts to throw Trump under the bus were admirable (and backfired spectacularly) I went a gentle-trolling route, rather than invoking the churning cauldron of anger in my gut I have for this administration.
sample page from the book
This is so dumb.
I know.  But it helped me cope a little with what's going on in the country, and I think it's more dumb fun than just dumb.  In fact, I think it's a lot of fun.  I hope you agree.
Who are you people?
I'm a comic book writer and animal rescuer based out of NYC.  Sean is a comic book artist, also from NYC, and Matt Krotzer is a graphic designer and comic letterer who lives out in Amish country in PA.
I've run several successful Kickstarters both solo and as collaborations with others - between us all, we've run and fulfilled over 10 book Kickstarters, so pledge with confidence.
sample page from the book
What can I get?!  I want to spoil myself (and/or others!)
image for example purpose only - everyone's "Sad Michael Cohen" art will be a one-of-a-kind imagining, original piece of art.
What'll the money be used for?
The money will be used for paying everyone who worked on the book, like artists, editors, and designers - plus printing, shipping, and more.  It's all broken down below in the chart.
* Thanks to Stella Marrs (stellamarrs.com) for allowing me to use her postcards in this project, and to Bensound (bensound.com) for the royalty-free background music for the video.

A killer that sews the eyelids of victims shut stalks a small town...
However, when one of the victims actually survives, a mystery begins to unravel that not only shakes the foundation of the town, but may also have apocalyptic consequences.
DON'T EVER BLINK is a 5-issue limited horror comic book series about a woman who survives a harrowing and horrific ordeal, the massacre of her fiance and his family while at a family get-together, but not without her also being scarred for life in more than one way; Tinsley Marissa Grace is found alive but her eyelids have been sewn together -- a calling card of a killer that has eluded the local authorities for years, a killer that they thought was long gone.
What's the story?
Only a few years ago, Detective Rendall Robinson and his partner Detective Vicki Lopez were the officers tracking down a serial killer. The killer murdered sixteen people, euthanizing them, all found with their eyelids sewn shut, and was never caught. The murders were random and seemingly held no pattern which baffled the detectives, the police, and everyone in the town. And then, out of nowhere and with no provocation, it ended. But not without a cult following beginning for the killer...
DON'T EVER BLINK is the return of the killer, a second-coming, and Detective Robinson and Detective Lopez are back on the case and are determined to catch the killer this time around, and their best chance of doing so is the only person to ever survive... Tinsley Marissa Grace. 
Who will like this?
Horror comic book fans.
Horror/slasher/thriller movie fans
B-movie enthusiasts
Before you back DON'T EVER BLINK, check out some of the rewards that we have to offer. We offer shipping to anywhere in the world, but shipping costs are separate from the reward costs. 
Look at the Evidence
Take a look at the first few pages of DON'T EVER BLINK Issue 1. Get the feel for the evidence yourself first:
Stay with us on this horrifically mysterious ride, a five-issue series that promises to be deliciously devilish as the truth unravels and questions about the killer, Tinsley, the detectives, and the small town are answered.

campaign.story:
PLAY

 During the 2020 Covid-19 crisis, the comics community saw our beloved retailers struggling to keep their shops going. From "shelter-in-place" orders to economic uncertainty, business owners were left without much support. Not only has the pandemic negatively impacted their livelihood, but it's compromised what all of us need these days: a safe space. 
For many, comic book stores are a place of acceptance, joy, and discovery. This is particularly important for people of marginalized genders who might not have access to other inclusive places with like-minded individuals, which means it's specifically important to provide assistance to comic book stores owned, operated, and staffed by women and people of marginalized genders.
That's where INSIDER ART came in. Developed by Shelly Bond, INSIDER ART assembled 150 women and non-binary comics creators from around the world. This 270-page digital anthology raised over $5K on Gumroad, with all of the proceeds benefiting 28 retailers who reached out for support. And now with your help, we want to bring a softcover version of the book to everyone. 
While the digital version of INSIDER ART will remain exclusively on Gumroad, we've had many requests for a softcover for people who prefer a paperback reading experience. With your help, we'll be able to provide this astounding 4-color compendium for print-lovers to enjoy and as a bonus, pay the 150 creatives who generously donated their time and talents.
"...a joyous celebration of graphic narrative in a multiplicity of forms...much of the appeal of INSIDER ART is in rooting through its eclectic treasure chest of graphic gems...INSIDER ART could be considered one of the key releases of 2020." 
 —Andy Oliver, Broken Frontier
Chock-full of comics, crafts, and cats, INSIDER ART was designed to entertain readers of all ages who are stuck indoors or just in search of new creative outlets. When your four walls have become too familiar, you can open a book and be welcomed into ours.
In our house, you will find eight different rooms:  basement, bedroom, kitchen, attic, bathroom, craft room, living room, and garage. Each room is filled with comics, prose, and projects individually curated by a team of eight editors designed to inspire readers and remind everyone why being inside isn't so bad.
 From recipes for comfort food and quarantine bread...
...to attic treasures and a brief history of Garage Rock, INSIDER ART is guaranteed to conquer the tedium of the great indoors.

Check out our different rewards options including a special Librarian/Retailer Deal and our LOOT BAG featuring cat vinyl stickers, pins/badges and postcards! 
Our target goal of $25K will cover the printing and fulfillment of:

Our main goal: on Gumroad, we sought to help preserve the diverse and inclusive spaces of comics shops run by women and marginalized genders. In this case, while obliterating all obstacles including a worldwide quarantine and an impossible deadline. Viva Comics!"

 Torn from the pages of the smash-hit comic-book Metalshark Bro comes Ninja Nuns: Bad Habits Die Hard, the hard-hitting, action-packed, ninja adventure! 
Kickstarter Exclusive Cover art by Dan Franco

 After Metalshark Bro hit the shelves in 2018, the audience wanted to know: WHO ARE THE NINJA NUNS! MSB fans from all over the world clamored for more stories, more adventures staring the Church's swift arm of justice that protected the flock from the gathering wolves!   
So Metalshark Bro co-creators Kevin Cuffe and Bob Frantz put their heads together and cooked up a few ideas for short stories. The duo invited Metalshark Bro editor Chas! Pangburn (who is a great writer) to submit a story and wa-la! The dudes had 30 some odd pages of Ninja Nun Stories broken into 4 short stories. Scripts are cool but ART is better! Kevin, Chas, and Bob contacted a few of their favorite artists and BAM! They got themselves a comic book.
Now that you know a bit about the backstory, we can tell you about the book. Ninja Nuns: Bad Habits Die Hard will feature a Kickstarter exclusive cover By Dann Franco and will only be made available via this campaign. This version of the book will not be made available in comic book shops. 
Each book will be signed and numbered by co-creator and writer Bob Frantz.

campaign.story:
My name is Rafer Roberts. You may (or may not) know me from such comics as GRUMBLE (from Albatross Funnybooks), MODERN FANTASY (from Dark Horse Comics), HARBINGER or ARCHER AND ARMSTRONG (from Valiant Entertainment), or the internet-famous THANOS AND DARKSEID: CARPOOL BUDDIES OF DOOM. But, right now, I'm here to tell you about NIGHTMARE THE RAT.
NIGHTMARE THE RAT is a mischievous little monster who preys upon the populace of Hell City by stealing their teeth. I began drawing his comics in 2010 and released a collection in 2014. Since then, I've been working diligently to complete Nightmare's tale. That day has finally arrived.
This Kickstarter is meant to raise the funds to publish the second, and final, NIGHTMARE THE RAT collection. 
NIGHTMARE THE RAT - The NEW collection!
About the collection:
NIGHTMARE THE RAT is an homage to early 1900s comics and the collected editions reflect that influence. This 32-page collection will be printed oversized (10.5"x16") on good old-fashioned newsprint with bonus comics and a sketchbook. It's the same format as the first collection, so they'll look great together! 
Put them side-by-side! They look great together!
This second collection completes Nightmare's tale, concluding with a finale that might be the most messed-up thing I've ever drawn. It is creepy and hilarious and unlike any other comic you have ever read.
Seriously. What the hell is this about?
Nightmare the Rat is a demon who steals people's teeth, forcibly sometimes.
His nemesis is a tiny owl named Morningbreath who poops in people's mouths.
The mayor and his goon squad are always trying to take Nightmare down!
Also, there's a cult and some kind of apocalyptic prophecy???
You can currently read most of Nightmare's adventures online, however, the collected editions are the intended reading experience. 
What kind of rewards are there?
Beyond the collection itself, we are also offering...
Enamel Pins! 
1" enamel pin, complete with collector card!
Mini-Prints! 
NINE postcard-sized prints! By Kelly Williams, Giles Crawford, Jason Axtell, John Shine, Matt Dembicki, Steve Becker, Brett Uren, Jacob Warrenfeltz, and Chris Maranac!
Sketch-covers! 
I have a ton of blank covers to draw on. Let me draw something for YOU!
Original art! 
Nightmare the Rat "daily" strips. 2 strips per 14x17" page!
The cover illustration!? Wow!
How far along is this project?
All  of the comics are drawn and ready to go. I still need to put together the back cover, but that'll go quick. By the time this campaign ends, all I'll have left to do is send the files to the  printer.
How will this money be used?
I'm the only creator involved with NIGHTMARE THE RAT, and I don't expect to make much off of this. All of the money raised will go towards printing the newspaper collection and shipping out your rewards. Anything extra will go into printing more copies and possible stretch rewards. (More info on stretch goals and rewards  is forthcoming.)

This will be the fourth Kickstarter project that I've run, and (knock on wood) looks like it will be the simplest.

campaign.story:
Planet Comics is a new, 40+ page, full-color, oversized comic anthology that pays homage to the original 1940s pulp magazine.
Issue #1 regular cover by Pietro
From 1940 through 1953, Fiction House published the first comic dedicated exclusively to science fiction: Planet Comics! This anthology title featured futuristic stories of heroic adventurers with a mid-century aesthetic, and it is well-loved to this day, often for its lush, high-quality, imaginative covers. Just look at this winner from issue 71: 
Planet Comics #71 from 1953
Hey everyone! My name’s Jeff McClelland, and I write comics like The Tick and the 2019 Kickstarter-funded Black Terror: Social Insecurity. With this new iteration of Planet Comics, I’d like to tell fun, imaginative stories under a sci-fi umbrella. To that end, I’ve asked some of my friends to help out and I’m really happy with the result. If you agree, then I hope you’ll help us send this issue to print! If the campaign for this first issue is successful, I’d like to publish a total of four issues on a (roughly) quarterly schedule.
As an added throwback, this issue will be presented in an oversized, magazine format, leaving lots of room for wide landscapes and immersive action!
The book
So what’ll be included in this first issue? First, we’ve got “The Bulwark”, from myself and artist Andrea Schiavone. This story will be the book’s continuing feature, told in serialized chapters along the way. Here’s a quick preview!
The Bulwark preview
The Bulwark preview
Next up is “The Old Man and the Agean Sea” from my good friend and frequent collaborator, writer/artist Jeff McComsey (Honcho; Grendel, Kentucky). Jeff brings an aesthetic to this tale that is somehow both foreboding and warm, and this complete story features some of his best work yet.
The Old Man and the Agean Sea preview
Then we’ve got “The Night Tanya Tucker Uncancelled Earth” from Jennie Wood (Flutter; A Boy Like Me) and Duane Redhead (2000AD; The Tick), both wonderful, creative people. I’m thrilled that Planet Comics will be the venue for their first collaboration, and this complete story is so wild – I can’t wait for everyone to see it all! 
The Night Tanya Tucker Uncancelled Earth preview
Also included is an article by Diana Krueger on one of the pioneers of the original Planet Comics: Lily Renée! Diana highlights the life and times of Renée, one of the most prominent female artists from the mid-century run.
I’ve got a few more (secret!) plans to add some pages to the book if we get past our initial goal!
REWARDS
It's a space ship!
The biggest reward for this campaign is, of course, the book. Whether you go in for a physical copy or electronic, I hope you’ll feel that your pledge is well spent on these new sci-fi tales.
This first issue comes with two covers: a regular cover with art by Pietro, and a Kickstarter-exclusive variant cover by Matthew Dow Smith! You can order just the regular cover, or both at the same time.  
Planet Comics #1 Kickstarter exclusive cover by Matthew Dow Smith
In addition, everyone who pledges at the $8 level or above will get a copy of an electronic “making of” publication, with a behind-the-scenes look at the creation of this issue. You’ll also get your name printed in a “thank you” section at the end of the book, and you'll get an electronic copy of an original Planet Comics issue from the 1940s!
There are a few additional, limited, physical rewards that you can get in this campaign. The first is a neat vinyl sticker of this updated Planet Comics logo, designed by Alan Gallo!
I’m also offering up prints of Matthew Dow Smith’s variant cover image, sans logos or other text.
And you'll have a chance to get one of the last few copies of Black Terror: Social Insecurity and maybe a few other books I've written!
The Black Terror: Social Insecurity
*Also! The first 30 backers - at any physical level - will receive a signed copy of The Tick 2020 FCBD Special!* 
Free to the first 30 physical backers!
THE CAMPAIGN GOAL
My first goal with this campaign is to be able to pay the creators a decent rate for their work. After that, I hope to offset some of the printing and shipping costs that otherwise might be prohibitive.
If this campaign exceeds its initial goal, all of the extra funds will be funneled directly back into the book, adding pages and helping us get started with issue #2!
Follow me online!
If you’re looking for more content, progress reports or just to see pictures of my dog, you can always follow me online by clicking the images below:

campaign.story:
What Is It? 
Hitting the streets of Manchester and bashing back against the haters
 Glitter Vipers is the 60 page story of Manchester drag queen Bi Phallicia and her friends who find themselves victims of an awful hate crime and decide that they are going to fight back. So they strap up, hit the streets and are ready to fight back against bigotry with a sequin baseball bat and some bad ass righteous fury! 
The fabulous Bi Phallicia
Follow the most fabulous street gang in the world as they patrol the Gay Village, step up to bigoted politicians and bash down the bashers. And in the midst of it all, they discover there's a conspiracy behind it all!
They're sick of being seen as victims! Sick of having crimes against them ignored! The Glitter Vipers are here to fight back!
The story is a brisk 60 pages, with a few behind the scenes extras thrown in too to give you a great little package in a glitter grindhouse revenge fantasy!
The gang's all here! Art by Katie Fleming
Who Are the Glitter Vipers?
 Bi Phallicia  - Bi Phallicia, real name Jason Filson, is a Manchester drag queen of some repute, who as well as her weekly shows runs a support group for those that have been victims of abuse, bigotry or hate crimes. Unfortunately, she finds herself becoming not just the organiser but also one of the members. She takes on the lead in the Glitter Vipers gang when they decide to fight back. 
Jesus Moretti - Jesus is a Colombian immigrant living in Manchester, UK and close friends with Bi and her group. He's dating Anton Bakunin. He's a broader, tougher looking man who came to the UK to live a more open and free life as a gay man. 
Anton Bakunin - Anton had a rough upbringing, finding it a lot harder to hide who he is as a gay man. An Eastern European immigrant who fled his home where being gay can result in being 'vanished', Anton came to the UK to try and find peace. Unfortunately, homophobia isn't just something that happens 'somewhere else'. 
Melissa 'Mel' Carter - Mel is a garage worker in Manchester, and is dating Bri. They are attendees of the support group after the pair were attacked by homophobes on a tram.  Mel is very tough, and has been harbouring a lot of anger over the surprise attack they suffered, and is eager to make sure nothing like it ever happens again.
 Bryony 'Bri' Stonehouse - Manchester born and bred, Bri has been dating Mel for nearly two years now. She also felt more anger than anything else after they were attacked, but she abhors violence entirely. Instead, Bri uses her smarts and community spirit to build the community support group stronger than ever before. 
Callum 'Cal' Wilkes - Cal came out much later in life, as his life in a biker gang didn't feel like the safest place to be openly gay. In fact, it turned out he was right when he did get outed to his gang and he wound up kicked out and alone. Struggling at first to find his tribe after this rejection, Cal is now a regular of Manchester's leather scene and brings his gruff, take-no-guff attitude to the local queer community. 
Queenie Iwobi - Queenie is a trans woman from a Nigerian family, she moved from her home in London to Manchester for council work years ago. Now, she takes part in the support group as a way of managing the daily micro-aggressions she faces as a proud trans WOC in this world, and to help support others like her. Also not a fan of violence, she joins Bri at the homebase, creating a helpful, safe space for the community and using her skills as a community support worker. 
Albert 'Alby' Prince - a 16 year old trans masc kid, Alby has been sneaking out to the gay scene for a while to find a safe space to be their authentic self, away from their home where they are not out. Alby became a big fan of Bi's shows, and Bi took them under her wing so she could make sure Alby was having a safe experience. Alby prefers he/him or they/them pronouns, but is not yet out to their family.
Page of inks by Katie Fleming
Content Warning
We are aware that the topic of hate crimes, bigotry and assault are sensitive topics, that we as a queer community often face far too often. Sensitive to this, the book will contain content warnings so that readers can be aware going in what to expect. 
We are also aware that it can be annoying to be seen as just the victims all the time. And while there can be a lot of emotions that are discussed after these kind of things, one emotion is often overlooked or swept-under-the-rug: anger. 
Page of inks by Katie Fleming
Sometimes when we see these things happen, or when they happen to us, there can be a strong sense of justified anger, and we look at that through the medium of revenge fantasy grindhouse action and explore what sense of resolution or satisfaction can be found there. 
All the while telling an entertaining, thoughtful action story in a very modern world. We'll have fun, but won't be making fun. 
Who's It For?
Have you ever seen the news and just felt so angry? Then you, for sure. 
But seriously, I think anyone who has felt that kind of strong reaction to things that happen in the world, whether it be a story of injustice they've seen in the news, or an article of a hate-fuelled attack, or worse, have had personal experience with that; I think anyone who relates to that will find something to relate to in Glitter Vipers. 
Queenie Iwobi by Katie Fleming
Anyone who has stood up to or is aware of organised hate, systemic violence and bigotry in this world can maybe find something in Glitter Vipers that speaks to them. We've all felt angry: this is about our right to that rage, and finding an outlet for it.
We all get told that we should not let that anger rise, that we don't have the right to our anger or how lashing out is wrong, but see the same things happen again and again. Glitter Vipers will explore that anger, it's justification and how it too can have a role in recovery, for good or ill.
Generally suitable for teens aged 16 years of age or older, the book has some light use of course language, violence, and as mentioned, sensitive topics around bigotry, hate crimes and assault. If you are buying for someone else, please do bare that in mind. 
Cover by James Gifford
Who's Making It?
One thing that we wanted to achieve with this book was the keep the whole creative team as queer identifying people. It's an LGBTQIA+ focused story, so it only felt right to have it be made by LGBTQIA+ people. 
The team is as follows:-
Joe Glass - Writer
 Joe Glass - Joe is the writer and co-creator of popular LGBTQ+ superhero adventure series, The Pride, now a successful ComiXology Originals series. He's also the writer of Acceptable Losses, a mature, political thriller with a dark edge. Most recently, he's worked with RuPaul's Drag Race star Manila Luzon on a countdown Instagram comic for her single, Robbed! Joe lives in South Wales with his family, and a petulant cat named Oliver. You can find his website here. 
Katie Fleming - Art
 Katie Fleming - Katie Fleming is a queer artist from Dublin, Ireland.  She began creating comics with her Partner with their LGBTQ+ comic '100 Times' and '100 More Times'.  since then she's worked on numerous anthologies and comics, such as 'Heart of Steal', 'The Black Rubric' and the webcomic, 'Ship Wrecked'. Glitter Vipers is her first graphic novel and she's super excited. When she's not making comics she's spending her time as a Werewolf. Her work can be found here. 
 Kelly Fitzpatrick - Kelly Fitzpatrick is known for her work on books such as: Bitch Planet, Supergirl: Being Super, Wonder Woman: Tempest Tossed, Shade the Changing Girl, DC: Bombshells, Archie, and Josie and the Pussycats. Nominated for the esteemed Hugo awards, she is also a past nominee for Autostraddle, Ghastly & Prism awards and has worked on titles nominated for the GLAAD and the Harvey awards. Her client list is available on her website and includes such prestigious publishers as DC Comics, Archie Comics & Dark Horse Comics. 
Lucas Gattoni - Letters
 Lucas Gattoni - Lucas Gattoni is a seasoned graphic designer and typesetter now pursuing his dream job of comic book lettering. He has lettered GLAAD nominated Liebestrasse for ComiXology Originals, Twin Worlds for Action Lab, Eskimo Kisses for Scout Comics and is currently lettering the Spanish version of Sonic The Hedgehog for IDW. He lives in his home country of Argentina with his husband and their three unnamed goldfish (oops, make that two now). His website is here.
Ted Brandt - Editor
 Ted Brandt - Ted Brandt is best known as an inker, working with his partner Ro on the Eisner- and GLAAD-nominated CROWDED from Image Comics. He likes long walks on the beach, and eating too much pizza. Ted is using his editorial hat on Glitter Vipers to help make the book the best it can be. 
James Gifford - Cover Artist
 James Gifford - James Gifford is a cis gay illustrator and storyboard artist who lives in London. He's a wayward pirate, plundering whatever illustration jobs he runs ashore on, never resting in one spot for long. A lone creative, a side-spitting gunslinger. The moment you think you have him pinned, he slips through your fingers like smoke. He's earned coin from Cartoon Network and Marvel comics and is currently creating content for Dungeons and Dragons in his spare time. You'll chip your teeth on his tough exterior, but deep down his heart is gold. His website is here. 
Spire Eaton - Spire is a graphic designer, artist, animator and comic creator based in Florida. He designed the Glitter Vipers logo for the book. That fabulousness is all down to him! You can check out his work here.
How Far Along Is It?
At time of launching the campaign, the book is entirely written, final inks are done for about roughly 20% of the book, with a further dozen pages ahead prepped too, and colours and cover work is starting in conjunction as the rest of the pages are drawn.
Alby Prince by Katie Fleming
We estimate that by the end of the campaign the book will be half way or more complete, and have allowed a roomy space of months between campaign end and delivery in an effort to ensure prompt delivery of the finished product. 
By following and/or backing the campaign, we will keep you updated with new pages and art as they happen, so you'll be the first to see more as it comes!
 How is the Money Spent?
A Breakdown of How the Goal Amount is Split
The majority of the goal amount is to pay for the art production of Glitter Vipers: this includes the drawing/inking, the colours and the design elements of putting the book together. 
The next biggest elements are the printing costs (currently based on a modest-to-large print run) and the shipping costs of sending copies out to those who back for physical reward tiers. Costs of shipping have been worked out based on impending Royal Mail price changes taking effect on July 1st 2020. Due to COVID-19 and changes in legislation for USPS in America, international shipping will be rising significantly, but we are baring this in mind in the planned goal amount and postage prices. 
The smallest element is to go on extra rewards elements, like the stickers. 
As such, the greatest overall chunk of the the goal amount we are asking for is to cover the production cost and to make sure our art team get a good, speedy payment for their hard work. 
Sample colours by Kelly Fitzpatrick
What Can I Get?
Well, naturally we are looking to provide both digital and print options of the book as reward tiers. In this day and age, there's no excuse to not offer both options to backers, so both will be readily available. 
There is also a tier to get multiple copies of the book, at a discounted price! This is primarily for comic stores that would like to support and stock the book, but also libraries and heck, if a group of friends all want to support but are on a budget, or you think you know a group of friends or family who'd all be interested in a copy, you can back at that level to get multiple copies at discount. This level is limited.  
There are options to get signed copies of the book, signed by writer Joe Glass, but again these are limited due to the time and energy taken in signing a lot of books can take.
We also have Glitter Vipers stickers available, so you can grab reward tiers with those included. 
Sample of the Embroidered Patch
Or, why not grab an embroidered Glitter Vipers patch! This is a very limited reward tier, so once it's gone, it's gone. Get it while you can! 
Plus, there's just the positive energy of knowing you've supported a great, queer focused comic project by queer creators, and that's worth everything, right! 
Finally, we have been sure to include the price of postage so when you back, you'll know exactly how much it will be in total. We've based the postage prices on the updated Royal Mail pricing coming into effect on July 1st, 2020, based on the planned sizing of the book and estimated weight.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Sometimes life gets in the way, and unforeseen obstacles pop up causing a delay in getting the products shipped in time. In this campaign, we have estimated a lot of time for completion and printing, so all things being equal there shouldn't be a delay to the books going out, but as ever, it is an estimate. 

Likewise, as far as postage goes, we have sourced good, strong, tough packaging that should withstand any handling from delivery services. Similarly, we have taken into account the new postal rates for sending to the United States from the UK, and have priced accordingly. This does mean International postage costs are higher, but with the changes in USPS and increases in general post costs due to COVID-19, it is worked out to be as fair and cheap as possible, while still maintaining a relatively speedy and well-handled delivery. 

The biggest challenge is the goal amount: while it can seem large, the goal is what it is to allow for making sure the team are all paid fairly for the books production, the printing of a good sized print run and shipping. The biggest help to overcome this challenge is to share and spread the word of the campaign, so for all of you deciding to support, we hope you can help us in spreading the word too.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Risks and challenges

updates.update_userinfo: NEW ANTHOLOGY! Dead Beats 2 now on Kickstarter
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone,
Thank you so much for backing MAYBE SOMEDAY. If you've enjoyed our anthologies, we've got a new one funding on Kickstarter right now!
DEAD BEATS 2: LONDON CALLING is the sequel to the original Ringo-Award nominated Dead Beats we published a couple of years ago. This one promises to be just as much fun and it's filled with amazing creators. I'd go on more about it, but you can find all the information on the campaign page, so head on over:

Hello everyone,
Hope you've all had a pleasant start to 2021 and enjoyed reading Maybe Someday.
Wanted to let you know that nominations have opened for the 2021 Ringo Awards.
It's open to both fans and pros alike, so spread the word and go nominate some of your favorite creators and projects from 2020.

Hi Everyone,
Just a quick note before the weekend to let you know that we've been working hard to mail out everyone's rewards. It takes a while to get through them all, so I thank you for your patience. It's been extra challenging with the pandemic and the issues with the post office.
Most everything will be shipped by the end of November, which was my goal. The only rewards that will be remaining by then will be international and the signed bookplates. Those have been making the rounds with the creators and should be back to me soon.

Well, at least that's a wrap on the campaign. We still get to go make the book, which is the fun part!
A huge thanks to all of you for supporting the campaign. I promise you won't be disappointed with the final result. This will be our best anthology yet and we'll keep you updated along the way.
And if you're looking for another active Kickstarter campaign to fill that void now that Maybe Someday is done, may I recommend a great looking project by one of our contributors, Joe Glass.

campaign.story:
Chip Mosher and Peter Krause invite you to Kickstart BLACKING OUT – A Tale of Fire and Murder in Southern California presented as a Deluxe Oversized Hardcover Graphic Novel.
BLACKING OUT follows a drunk ex-cop looking for redemption as he attempts to solve a murder during the Southern California fire season. 
(Case wrap with Tom Muller logo & art direction and art by Peter Krause)
Comics industry veteran and writer Chip Mosher and legendary artist Peter Krause (The Power of Shazam!, Irredeemable) present BLACKING OUT, a 56-page graphic novel presented in a deluxe oversized hardcover in the European album tradition. BLACKING OUT also showcases the amazing talents of colorist Giulia Brusco (Scalped, Django Unchained), letterer Ed Dukeshire (Buffy the Vampire Slayer, Mighty Morphin Power Rangers), and designer Tom Muller (X-Men) .
 Kickstarter rewards include a print Lobby Card set from acclaimed artists Francesco Francavilla, Eduardo Risso, Jamal Igle, Emma Ríos, Mirka Andolfo, Jacob Phillips, Dan Panosian, Ryan Kelly, Patric Reynolds, Elise McCall, and Peter Krause. 
Bottom line for backers: 
The graphic novel is complete and the Kickstarter is looking to raise the last bit of funds needed for printing to get this book in your hands. That said, a digital version of the book will be sent to you as soon as possible once the Kickstarter is funded and complete!  Every tier with a reward will get the book! With the exception of the retailer tier, every tier over 40 bucks will get the printed signed and numbered book with the main Lobby Card set and the digital bundle. Higher priced tiers get more!  Yes, we have more goodies. So keep scrolling  and don't miss out!
Table of Contents:
     What's The Story...?  
     Why The Oversized Hardcover Format?
     Digital Rewards
     Lobby Cards 
     Stretch Goals
     A Word About Shipping
     Creative Team
 What's The Story...? 
PLAY

(Chip and Peter discuss Peter's contribution in detail during this special video shot a month after the main one, as Pete was not able to make it to Los Angeles.)
 Disgraced ex-cop, Conrad, seeks redemption by unraveling an unsolved murder during Southern California's fire season. Connie follows a lone clue—a discarded crucifix—to unravel the death of Karen Littleton, whose body was found amid a blaze that scorched 10,000 acres. The search leads Connie to clash with the victim's father and prime suspect, Robert Littleton, as well as hostile former colleagues on the local police force. All the while, Conrad combats his consuming alcoholism and fading faculties.
We're confident that you'll love this book as much as we do. But why take our word for it? 
 “Blacking Out is as dark as the smoky California skies that fill its pages. And like smoke, this noir clings to you. Redemptive, surprising, & bleak.” - Brian Azzarello, 100 Bullets, Moonshine 
 “A tasty comics noir for your lockdown reading. A fast-paced page turner that really delivers.” - Derf Backderf, My Friend Dahmer, Kent State 
 “A compelling story that moves like a rocket and artwork that’s stunning. When is award season, again?” - Mark Waid, Kingdom Come, Irredeemable 
 “Start with the inky atmospheric drawings. Take the narrative familiars: bad cop seeking redemption, small town with big secrets, people wanting what they can’t have. Toss them in the spin cycle.” - Betsy Willeford
Why the oversized hardcover format?
(Case cover proof direct from the printer. Check out the spot gloss! SoCal foliage in the background not included.)

Having the privilege to attend the Angoulême International Comics Festival in France this past decade, writer and co-creator Chip Mosher has not only fallen in love with the oversized European hardcover format (~12.5" x 9.5"), but also the creative aesthetic of what the French call bande dessinée or BD. Whereas American comics release on a monthly basis and demand tight deadlines, the standard 48 page BD album is drawn over 6 months or longer, allowing the creators to spread their wings and put their best work forward. 
 “Blacking Out is a hard drinking, hard boiled mystery with a finale that lands like a ton of bricks—do not miss it.”  - Gerry Duggan, Dead Eyes, Deadpool, Marauders 
With this approach in mind, co-creator and artist Peter Krause worked on BLACKING OUT over several years, toiling over each page to create a tight 56-page graphic novel. (Note: Chip needed some extra pages, so not keeping it to the standard French 48-page standard is his fault! - Pete.) Working "Marvel-style" (the writer providing the artist a script with no panel breakdowns), Peter was able to exercise complete artistic control over the pacing of the story, a rarity in American comics. Chip then followed with a final lettering draft after Peter finished drawing all of the pages. This creative process ensured a deep collaboration between writer and artist... true co-creators in every sense.
 "Blacking Out is a taut, nasty thriller about people you don't want to know, but will love watching. The slow burn (pun intended) leads to a gut punch that will leave you reeling. Well-done.” -Marc Andreyko, Supergirl, Manhunter, Torso 
Ed Dukeshire then lettered the project with Scalped alumnus Giulia Brusco providing colors. Finally, Tom Muller designed the logo and the cover, working directly with Peter. In the spirit of the project, each contributor was guaranteed as much time needed to provide their best work.
In total, the team spent more than three full years creating this graphic novel. No expense was spared, no shortcuts were taken. This graphic novel was crafted without compromise; an unrushed, immaculately sculpted book with few peers. 
( Letterer Ed Dukeshire crafted hand-drawn, custom balloons and manipulated fonts for word mood and emphasis.)
 “Hardcore characters in search for what they can’t name on a road they shouldn’t travel. A gut punch of crime fiction by Mosher and Krause.” -Gary Phillips, The Be-Bop Barbarians 
(Giulia Brusco's amazing color work on one of Chip and Peter's favorite pages.)
 "A rural crime tale with more twists and turns than a backcountry road.” - Ed Brisson, Sheltered, Old Man Logan 
(Tom Muller's distressed logo for the graphic novel.)
 “The writing is sharp like a razor, the sort of sharp that you don’t feel when it cuts you. It’s only when you see the blood begin to pool that you realize that you’re reading a really good book.” - Shannon Wheeler, Too Much Coffee Man, The New Yorker 
Digital Rewards
With the book completed, a PDF of BLACKING OUT will be immediately available to those who backed tiers including a digital copy of the book; all backers who receive any digital reward will immediately be able to read BLACKING OUT as soon as the Kickstarter is funded and complete.
(Cover for PDF version of BLACKING OUT ready to send to backers once the Kickstarter ends.)
There are two additional digital items available: the Blacking Out Photo Reference PDF and a PDF of Chip's previous graphic novel, Left On Mission, co-created and drawn by Francesco Francavilla.
While writing BLACKING OUT, Chip Mosher took numerous pictures to serve as inspiration for the book. Traveling around Southern California, Chip took pictures of active forest fires in and outside Los Angeles and he then created collages of places that he imagined would serve as the setting for BLACKING OUT. This PDF served as inspiration for the art and coloring of the final work.
(Photo collage by Chip Mosher for inspiration in the making of BLACKING OUT.)
As a special bonus, Chip Mosher’s previous graphic novel with co-creator Francesco Francavilla, Left On Mission —which debuted in 2008, and is currently OOP — is included digitally within certain most tiers. Left On Mission recently reverted to co-creators Chip and Francesco, who are excited to get this critically acclaimed, but little seen, work in the hands of more people. 
(Title page for LEFT ON MISSION co-created by Chip Mosher & Francesco Francavilla. Colors by Martin Thomas. Letters by Marshall Dillon.)
Chip and Peter wish to thank Francesco for letting them include Left On Mission as part of this Kickstarter.
The Lobby Cards
The BLACKING OUT Kickstarter allows Chip and Peter to celebrate the traditions of film noir by offering 12 cinematic lobby cards from today's most acclaimed artists, with a special card drawn by Peter himself. Lobby cards are miniature movie posters used to promote films in the lobbies of theaters in Hollywood's golden era. Noir films historically offered some of the most vivid imagery of the medium, inspiring this reward tier. Chip and Peter reached out to some of today's greatest comic artists to provide their interpretations of scenes within BLACKING OUT. These artists include:
 Francesco Francavilla (Afterlife with Archie), Eduardo Risso (Moonshine), Mirka Andolfo (Mercy), Dan Panosian (Slots), Emma Ríos (Pretty Deadly), Jacob Phillips (That Texas Blood), Patric Reynolds (The Mask), Ryan Kelly (Saucer Country), Jamal Igle (The Wrong Earth), Elise McCall (Spy Island) and Peter Krause. 
 Our lobby cards will be a smidge smaller than the book (~12.5" x 9.5").
UPDATE: Since hitting $29K we've added an additional card by Peter Krause, inspired by Robert Fawcett. See below.
(Lobby Card by Francesco Francavilla)
(Lobby Card by Eduardo Risso)
(Lobby Card by Jamal Igle. Colors by Jacob Phillips)
(Lobby Card by Emma Ríos)
(Lobby Card by Mirka Andolfo)
(Lobby Card by Jacob Phillips)
(Lobby Card by Dan Panosian)
(Lobby Card by Ryan Kelly. Colors by Jacob Phillips)
(Lobby Card by Patric Reynolds. Colors by Jacob Phillips)
(Lobby Card by Elise McCall. Colors by Jacob Phillips)
(UNLOCKED $29K Stretch Goal additional "Robert Fawcett inspired" Lobby Card by Peter Krause)
(The "rarest" Lobby Card by Peter Krause with colors by Jacob Phillips! Only available to those pledging "NAKED" LOBBY CARDS + 1” $200 tier and the "LIVE AND NAKED" $300 tier.)
Each lobby card will be printed on card stock and sized to ship within the book to ensure delivery in perfect condition. Additionally, backers can opt for a tier of "naked" versions of the lobby cards, sans any kind of BLACKING OUT branding. This tier includes a special card drawn by Peter Krause and colored by Jacob Phillips.
Stretch Goals
We originally wrote: "Maybe we can add some bells and whistles to the book, but for now, we’re happy to let this smolder." And it has. So as a special thanks, we're adding these Stretch Goals:
STRETCH GOALS: Every backer of the $40 and up will receive these rewards once they are unlocked!
 UNLOCKED: $29K - Digital Wallpaper + Robert Fawcett inspired Lobby Card by Peter Krause.  
 UNLOCKED: $30K—Bookmark Ribbon
 UNLOCKED: $32K—Gilded Pages
 UNLOCKED: $35K—Sticker of Francesco Francavilla's Lobby Card. Gonna be smoking hot!
(STRETCH GOAL: $35K - Sticker of Francesco Francavilla's Lobby Card Art, undressed or as we say NAKED!)
 UNLOCKED: $40K—First Exploratory Piece drawn by Peter Krause & Colored by Jacob Phillips (See below). Those getting the "Naked" tier will get this undressed version too!
$50K – Pin of the Blacking Out logo (See below).
$60K – Pin of the Blacking Out logo—black-light edition (See below).
  (STRETCH GOAL: $40K - First Exploratory Piece drawn by Peter Krause & Colored by Jacob Phillips. Those getting the "Naked" tier will also this undressed version.)
Blacking Out Pins - Regular (top ) & black-light edition (bottom)
 “Blacking Out is not a romance.” - Kim Krizan, Before Sunrise 
A Word about Shipping
We've cut this to the bone for a HC oversize book that is relatively heavy. (See size comparison below.) We are planning to ship media mail domestically and USPS First Class for all international. We look to provide each backer with a shipping confirmation email with tracking. 
(Check it out! Standard US comic/trade size vs BD album. It goes without saying... this book is going to be massively cool!)
The Creative Team
 Chip Mosher
Chip Mosher currently serves as Head of Content for comiXology, overseeing the comiXology Originals line of exclusive content. In its first year, comiXology Originals garnered an Eisner Award for Harvey Kurtzman’s Marley’s Ghost. For the past 9 years at comiXology, Mosher has worn a variety of hats in the marketing, communications, and business development departments. Previously, Mosher ran BOOM! Studios’ marketing department, helping catapult the company into a top 10 direct market publisher.  During his tenure, Mosher brought home BOOM!'s first Eisner win by acquiring and editing Shannon Wheeler's cartoon collection I Thought You Would Be Funnier. In 2007, Mosher co-created the comic book Left On Mission with Francesco Francavilla.
Peter Krause
Peter Krause has worked as an artist in comics for over 30 years. Past credits include Power of Shazam!, Metropolis S.C.U., and Star Trek: The Next Generation—all for DC Comics. His work with writer Mark Waid on Irredeemable (BOOM! Studios) and Daredevil: Road Warrior (Marvel Comics) garnered several Eisner nominations.  Most recently, he helped reimagine the Archie gang as teens during World War ll in Archie: 1941, and drew the adventures of two disparate superhero universes in Dragonfly and Dragonman for Ahoy Comics.
 Giulia Brusco
Giulia Brusco is Italian and lives in London. She has colored comic books since 2000, working on titles such as Scalped, Django Unchained, and The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo. 
 Ed Dukeshire
Ed Dukeshire is the founder of Digital Webbing and co-creator of Fist of Justice. He's a Harvey nominated letterer currently working for BOOM! Studios and indie creators.
 Tom Muller
Tom Muller's work across graphic, digital, brand, and product design is informed by Modernist principles infused with a contemporary design sensibility that blurs the boundaries between creative disciplines—delivering design that is relevant, resonates, and inspires its audience—winning him global recognition as an industry leader in his field.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The book is done and we only need a small amount of money from the Kickstarter campaign to go to print. We are printing overseas so the biggest risk here is a delay with international overseas printing due to Covid-19. With the book complete, printed proofs in hand, this is a very low risk project. Once the Kickstarter is complete, digital copies of the book will be sent to backers. Chip Mosher, who is running this Kickstarter, is a seasoned vet of the comic industry and also assisted his wife, Kim Krizan, in completing her Kickstarter in 2013. Covid-19 is the biggest risk here and how it may or may not inhibit physical production and shipping times. But this will get done, come hell or high water.

campaign.story:
Hi! My name is Jeff McComsey and I am a cartoonist asking for your help to self publish my next graphic novel: WIPE OUT.  
 WIPE OUT is a 150 page black and white original sci-fi graphic novel.  I think of it as a 21st century DR. STRANGELOVE Or How I learned To Relax and Love the Bomb directed by Michael Bay. 
WIPE OUT Or The Taking of Object Nine Three Two
The story:
 Object Nine Three Two is on a collision course with Earth. We have eight years before this massive rock slams into this planet ending life as we know it. 
    A low profile mission to intercept and redirect the object is launched in 2023. Major Tom Edmund captains the small international crew sent deep into space.
 Everything proceeds to plan. The crew rendezvous with Object Nine Three Two and begin waiting for the window whereby they'll hip check the rock into Jupiter's gravity and send it off into the solar system never to darken Earth's door again.
 Before that happens Major Tom sends a message back to Earth; He's killed his crew and is in sole control of the means to redirect this asteroid ...or not.
Major Tom says he has one demand for all world leaders and if it's not met to his satisfaction he'll let this rock destroy Earth.
The demand; -World peace.
SPECS: 
 MOTHER RUSSIA: Silent Interlude
It's impossible for me to kickstart something without involving some sort of mini comic. MOTHER RUSSIA: SILENT INTERLUDE is a wordless 20 page mini comic homage to Larry Hama's GI JOE #21 Silent Interlude. 
Comes with all print rewards! 
 The synopsis: 
Hell freezes over and the gang decide to stretch their legs. Shenanigans ensue. 
 REWARDS!! 
To get to the goal I've got a bunch of different custom and original art rewards as well as books I've previously illustrated.  
 Thanks for looking!

Hey All!
I'm working on the last act of WIPE OUT, I apologize for the radio silence, I've been deep in that part of illustrating a graphic novel where one disappears in a cloud of eraser dust for a year. 

It's going very well, I love the work, but always ends up taking a bit longer than I want to admit.  The scale of the end of the story is bigger than a lot of of what I illustrate, so doing all that justice has taken up more time than I thought.

Hey all!
Work on Wipe Out rages on. 
I originally had hoped to have everything wrapped up by about this time, but I'm not quite there yet.  I would say closer to mid-Summer for completion of everything.

Hey all!

Just dropping a line to let you know production on WIPE OUT is rolling along! 
Currently We're still on target for a February release. I'll be sending out surveys and stuff much closer to January, just as a heads up! Next month, I'll be sharing some of the ship designs with you via updates, so keep an eye out for those!

campaign.story:
2019 marks the 10th anniversary of the Tara Normal webcomic, and to celebrate I’ve collected the complete series into a beautiful, 152 page full-color book.
 STRETCH GOALS ARE HERE: Any physical reward levels $25 and up get all of the stretch goals we unlock. The $20 Early Bird Reward Level also gets these stretch goals.

Tara Normal is a paranormal detective who solves supernatural mysteries with the help of her potato chip loving, interdimensional traveling, best friend – Shadowman.
Tara Normal: The Complete Webcomic Series includes 5 of the most thrilling cases of Tara's investigative career. From creepy talking dolls to adorable zombie dogs, Tara bravely battles every bizarre challenge that comes her way. 
 There's even an alternate timeline version of herself: "Evil" Tara Normal!
Inspired by all the spooky movies I watched growing up in the 1980's on Up All Night with Rhonda Shear, Commander USA's Groovie Movies and USA's Saturday Nightmares, Tara Normal features creepy stories but told with tons of humor and colorful art. Our hero isn't afraid of the monsters hiding under her bed.
The spirit of Tara Normal is that anything can - and does -happen in this book. If I thought of it, I put it in there.
That’s why Tara encounters such fun characters as Baby Cthulhu, Painbow Fright, the Goatman, Frankenstein Lawyer, a cemetery filled with the zombie versions of 80’s celebrities, and a 70 foot tall Teddy Roosevelt…who carries a trident and lives under the Baltimore Harbor. 
You can preview more art pages from the book at my website.
There are a ton of unique rewards and experiences available including a Jason Hawes autograph reward package, the first ever Tara Normal necklace (designed by Lunar Star Collections), Tara Normal shirts and much, much more.
Here are some of the great rewards we are offering.


You are also able to add-on any item you like to your reward level. Example: Do you want a Tara Normal necklace in addition to your book? Add $20.
I've set up stretch goals that can transform this book into a 200 page compendium boasting a huge special features section that includes the first Tara Normal 5 page pitch comic, a giant art gallery and the Tara comic strips as seen in TAPS Paramagazine, the official publication of the show Ghost Hunters on SyFy. In these humorous comics strips, Tara ghost hunts with paranormal reality stars such as Jason Hawes, Grant Wilson, Steve Gonsalves, Dave Tango, Amy Bruni and Adam Berry from the shows Ghost Nation, Ghost Hunters and Kindred Spirits.

I couldn’t create my book - and have copies to sell at the shows to new readers -without your help. Through the past 3 successful Kickstarter campaigns, you’ve helped me continue creating and drawing original, independent comic book stories.
Thank you for celebrating 10 years of Tara Normal with me.

campaign.story:
Night Hunters is a dystopian cyber punk comic created by Alexis Ziritt ( Space Riders, Tarantula) and Dave Baker (Fuck Off Squad, Action Hospital) and published by Floating World Comics (Revenger, All Time Comics). 
Night Hunters is a four issue mini-series. And unlike many kickstarters who are self-publishing, this book has already found a publisher: Floating World. They have agreed to publish, distribute, and market the book, however, there's one hitch. Comics is hard. And drawing a four issue mini-series is a full time job. Unfortunately, Floating World isn't in a position to pay advance page rates at this time. So, we need your help. Dave and Alexis are chomping at the bit to make this bizarre cyberpunk comic. However, we need to raise enough money to make Alexis' page rate. 
That's where you come in. 
Synopsis: 
In Gran Caracas the only way to get ahead in life is to become a police officer. You want to live in one of the state-controlled high-rises? Become a cop. Want to own property? Become a cop. Want to run for public office? Become a cop. 
 In the year 2131, Venezuela is a post-apocalyptic military state, governed by a ruling class of brutal elite and their enforcers: the police force. We follow childhood best friends, and ostensibly adoptive brothers, Julian and Ezekiel as they attempt to navigate the seedy underbelly of this cyberpunk dystopia.
The boys have been raised as street urchins by Julian’s father, Juan, who refuses to enlist and become an officer. They scavenge trash and steal, endlessly attempting to squeeze something from nothing. Gran Caracas is plagued by corruption and greed. This hits our characters the hardest when, during a routine police drug raid, a riot breaks out destroying their make-shift home.
Their lives will never be the same. Julian is almost killed in the riot. Juan takes his son's body to a trans-humanist doctor and pleads with him to give his boy a cyborg body. The doctor agrees, however there's a catch. The planned obsolesce of many of his vital organs means he's perpetually trapped in an upgrade-or-die indentured servitude existence.
 In order to make enough money to support himself and his now-largely-cyborg father, Julian enlists in the police force where he's convinced he'll be able to make enough money to leave Gran Caracas. 
Obviously that never happened. Julian worked his way up through the force and was eventually recruited into Gran Caraca's newest cyborg paramilitary division Project: Night Hunters. They've been tasked with cleaning up the gangs who are trafficking Yopo through Venezuela. After a shootout, Julian discovers that the leader of the gang is none other than... Ezekiel. 
From this point on, Julian and Ezekiel live parallel lives. Julian enlists in the police force, both to make enough money to finance both his and his father’s cyborg implants, and to, in his mind, stop this cycle from happening again to someone else. Ezekiel, however, ends up falling in with the fiercely anti-cyborg gangs who run Gran Caracas’ underbelly by trafficking in Yopo. He works his way up through the hierarchy until he becomes one of the main bosses

Sample Pages: 
Night Hunters Cover by Alexis Ziritt and Vanesa Del Rey
By backing this kickstarter you'll be able to enable us to make this crazy book that most other publishers were to scared to publish. Anti-authoritarian genre stories about the real effect of living in a police state? That sounds... risky, right? Floating World believes in taking chances and publishing interesting works from creators who are pushing the boundaries of what comics can be. And this book checks all those boxes. 
By helping us reach our goal you'll be insuring that a completely unique and idiosyncratic work is produced with zero compromise.

campaign.story:
Task Force Rad Squad is the underground hit comic book series by Caleb Goellner and Buster Moody for fans of action-packed, funny, overly drawn dynamic comics! People who like things like tokusatsu, sentai, kaiju, cats, sleeping, yelling, push-ups, talking birthday cakes, and space potion- this is for you!
Task Force Rad Squad: The Collected Edition features all six Task Force Rad Squad single issues, the 8-page Task Force Rad Squad Presents Cakestor Cawmix #1 mini-comic, the 1-page "Spin Zoned" bonus comic, plus scads of Buster's bonus concept art. All told, this thing will pack 200 pages! HOLY $#*&!
Do you like Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles? Mighty Morphin Power Rangers? 90's Image Comics? Do you like [Adult Swim] and irreverent humor? If the answer to any of these questions is yes, then Task Force Rad Squad is the thing you've always wanted but never knew about!
Earth's teenage protectors have vanquished evil and are settling into sleep mode... until their new mentor inadvertently unleashes a fresh batch of foes, forcing them to engage evil once again as Task Force Rad Squad!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Here's some pages!
In May of 2013, we self-published the first issue of our tokusatsu/'90s superhero comics homage Task Force Squad, featuring flats by Ludwig Olimba and Colors by Ryan Hill. It was a debut that spiritually answered the question, "What if the creators of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles had been born in 1985 and been inspired by the Power Rangers instead of (or in addition to) Frank Miller's Daredevil?"
Then we made five more issues. Comic book news sites even liked them.
Along the way, Buster and I have been fortunate enough to work on many of the comics that inspired Task Force Rad Squad, including Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, Sonic the Hedgehog, Mighty Morphin Power Rangers, Godzilla, and a bunch of others. Life is wild.
But only, like, seven people and my mom have read any of Task Force Rad Squad because I'm a terrible self-publisher! So we're fixing that on Kickstarter with the help of the fine folks at Make That Thing!  
"TASK FORCE RAD SQUAD looks and reads like an 8th grader’s notebook that was dipped in toxic waste and struck by lightning. It is AWESOME."
- Chris Burnham (Batman, Die!Die!Die!, Nameless)
"Take equal parts after school TV programming, rock band politics, and psychedelic hallucinogens and you’re only halfway to approaching the technicolor awesomeness that is TASK FORCE RAD SQUAD. Goellner and Moody have Voltron-ed their skills to form a book capable of taking down even the most cynical, jaded readers.”
- Christopher Sebela (Crowded, Test, House Amok)
"TASK FORCE RAD SQUAD is hilarious, bizarre, and made of 100% butt-kicking radditude.”
- Sam Humphries (Dial H for Hero, Harley Quinn, Goliath Girls)
and...
Portraits by Buster Moody
Buster Moody is a comic creator, animator, video editor, beat-maker, human being, and more. He's illustrated for IDW's Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles series and Godzilla in Hell, and other awesome comics. He's currently producing: LAZER STORM: Giant Slayers.
Caleb Goellner is an Eisner Award-winning pug dad who has written for IDW’s Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles and Sonic the Hedgehog series, plus Boom! Studios’ Mighty Morphin Power Rangers. He also draws comics like Mermaid: Evolution, Ice Cream Warriors, Mer-Pugs, and Birch Squatch: The Last Bigfoot. 
~$16K: Printing, design, and production costs.
~ $5-6K: Shipping/packaging/fulfillment fees. We ship domestic AND international!
~ $1-2K: Kickstarter fees, card fees, and buffer.
$???: Buster and I make some money. Holy smokes, finally. Thank you. Thank you. Thank god for you, the wind beneath our cartoonist wings.

updates.update_content:
Hey everyone,
Buster and I want to sincerely thank you for your support through 30-days of promotional emails, social media posts, and about 3,000 memes.
Huge shout out to everyone in the comics and wider entertainment press for covering the Kickstarter and our comic in general! Also: Thank you for your scores of social media likes, RTs, and otherwise shares on this project's behalf. We appreciate how busy everyone is, and how much noise you've got to cut through to get eyes on things.
Rad Squad may not have met its $25K goal (printing a 200-page TPB at scale is a whole thing, isn't it?), but considering how sideways things went internally at Kickstarter just days before our scheduled launch, coupled with some other jazz, I think we still proved that a bunch of cool people want to see the TPB collected and are willing to pay for it. For two creators who’ve been grinding away at weird indie comics while doing work-for-hire their entire careers, that’s a truly validating, rad thing to see no matter what else is going on in the world.
Thank you! Thank you! Thank you!
PS. If you want to follow the future of Rad Squad (like, if we can print TPBs for spring 2020 comic conventions or w/e), you can follow Buster and me on social here:

Rockabilly-infused vaudeville mixed with Quentin Tarantino's Death Proof and shot out of a circus cannon, DEATH TRAP follows Ollie and her quest for revenge on the father-murdering bastards of Davenport Amusements.  Together with her adopted circus sideshow freak family, she's got the pedal to the metal in her haunted muscle car and nothing but vengeance in her headlights. 
Sure, DEATH TRAP is loaded with fun, freaks, and paranormal grindhouse action, but at its heart the book is about trying to make problematic and distant parents proud of you, something I know way too much about.
Grab the "Trade Waiter" tier for the whole 96 page graphic novel, or an exclusive issue 1 if you like floppy comics! 
 Matt Miner (words) - GWAR, Poser, Liberator, All We Ever Wanted

 Josh Jensen (colors) - GWAR, Lab Raider, House of Fear, Doctor Crowe

"Death Trap is an intense, muscle-car powered freakshow, jam-packed with enough insanity and action to make any comic reader happy." - Rich Douek, Road of Bones, Wailing Blade, Gutter Magic

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Matt Miner has 5 successful Kickstarter projects under his belt, all funded and fulfilled to backers. So while the biggest risk to most projects is flaky Kickstarter creators who don't know what they're doing, that's not the case here.

Printing and distribution is a challenge for a lot of peoples' projects, but that's not the case here, either. Death Trap has a great veteran publisher ready to take the book on so long as we fund creative costs through the Kickstarter!

We are incredibly comfortable with the Kickstarter platform and what it takes to deliver to our supporters and we have a long track record of success to prove it.

updates.update_userinfo: We came so close, but it's not over yet.
updates.update_content:
Hey everyone,
First:  Thank you to the 349 backers who believed in DEATH TRAP and wanted to see this book happen.  We love you, we appreciate you, and although we're bummed for us, we're more bummed to let you, the backers down.  
I want to also thank every member of the DEATH TRAP team, for all the extra work they put in on this thing.  I don't know if anyone noticed, but the reward slug design was SUPER nice and meant to harken back to a sideshow-poster feel.  That was all Matt Krotzer's doing, and it was hours and hours of work for him.  Those character designs and the main images we used in the campaign as well as the little icons that broke up the sections on the main page - that was all of extra work for and .  Also a special thanks to for the amazing chase variant cover, and , who made that incredible Kickstarter teaser video - her music combined with her video artistry combined for something really special.  The team utterly rocked it and together we made a campaign page to be proud of.

Hey watchers - if you haven't backed, please do!
Hey backers - thanks for your support!  Want to add extra copies or another reward on to your pledge?  Email me at mattminerxvx@gmail.com and we can do that!

We have some ground to cover, but today's pledges have been heavy, and we could actually pull this off!   Holy smokes!

campaign.story:
Hi, I’m Jeff McComsey!
I am a cartoonist making comics for the past 12 years. In the past you helped me print a mess of these Thumb Books for a lot of cartoonists, designers, students... and, well I ran out of them.  Thusly I'm here to do it again!
WHERE IT ALL STARTED:
Like most cartoonists and comic artists, I did my thumbnails on loose paper and I would inevitably lose them in the sea of paper in my studio. My initial solution was an improvised thumbnail template stapled together. I’ve been refining Thumb Book over the years and this will be the third official printing.
SPECS:
The THUMB BOOK is 4”x 5.5”and is currently 60 pages.  
-Designed to be a pocket sized sketch book with a template on each page that corresponds to the layout of a standard comic page. Originally created to help me keep all my preliminary work in one spot, I also like them because I can grab a script, pencil, Thumb Book and hit a coffee shop if I need a change of scenery.
WHAT'S NEW:
SEQUENTIAL ART TEACHERS:
In addition to working in comics, I am also an adjunct at Pennsylvania College of Art and Design. In this coming Fall semester I’ll be teaching a Sequential Art class and I want to incorporate these sketchbooks into the curriculum. If this campaign is successful, I’ll be providing all 20 students with THUMB BOOKS.
-If you teach a sequential art/comics based art class and think these books could be helpful for your students, please shoot me a message.
Pics from my original Thumb Book design before incorporating the grid.
HOW I USE THEM:
Once I have a script in hand I do small breakdowns four up on the Thumb Book page. After that each breakdown gets taken to a full (Thumb Book) page layout. I try and make those thumbnails as tight as possible. I then scan those thumbnails and enlarge them to begin the penciling stage.
BREAKDOWNS
Once I have a script in hand I do small breakdowns four up on the Thumb Book page. Here I'm mostly focusing on leaving enough room for lettering and making sure speaking order is reflected in layout.
THUMBNAILS
After that each breakdown gets taken to a full (Thumb Book) page layout. I try and make those thumbnails as tight as possible. I then scan those thumbnails and enlarge them to begin the penciling stage.
SCANS
Once I scan in my thumbs and make a spread out of them, I'll share them with editorial or any other creative partners on the project. This also let's me look at stories as a whole and see if I'm repeating a layout too much.
There are more than a few steps between these two, but I like to figure everything out compositionally in my Thumb Book before hand.
REWARDS:
In addition to offering the Thumb Books I'm cracking open my original art vault for rewards. Original art reward backers will receive THREE pages of original 11x17 original art. I'll be pulling from SMEDLEY, HONCHO, SON OF HITLER, FLUTTER and a few other shorts.
I'll also be offering a limited Post-It note commissions!

campaign.story:
Cursed to become zombies whenever they play their music, the members of the punk band Toe Tag Riot use their "zombie powers" ethically, only murderizing and eating bigots, homophobes, transphobes, sexists, and racists.  
  Toe Tag Riot formed in the 2000s, devoured and digested scores of Nazi skinheads, sexist dudebros, and even the Westboro Baptist Church (see volume 1 for that tale!), then broke up, to the dismay of their legions of fans.  But now they're back with a reunion tour sure to be even bloodier, funnier and a little more queer than ever before!
  And yes, fan-favorite guest stars Teddy Mercury, and Andy Hurley from Fall Out Boy, are back!
 Return of the Toe Tag Riot is a digital-first 4-issue series, collected to physical trade paperback.
Issues 1-4 covers and the classic punk albums they're homages to. Issue 1 cover by Jonathan Brandon Sawyer and Josh Jensen, others by Sean Von Gorman, Gab Contreras, and Tim Daniel
Pinup by Bobby Timony to be included in issue 1 and the TPB
Matt Miner (GWAR: Orgasmageddon, Lab Raider)
Sean Von Gorman (This Nightmare Kills Fascists, Love is Love)
Gab Contreras (All We Ever Wanted: Stories of a Better World, 2000 AD)
Taylor Esposito (Red Hood and the Outlaws, Fresh Romance)

Kickstarter video features a sample of "EAT YOUR FACE," the new Toe Tag Riot* single that's been burning up the charts ever since the band reunited!

* IRL recorded by TTR's buddy Rene Rosa - full version available along with the band's previous hit "Toe Tag Riot" on the cassette single reward tier.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Let's be real: Kickstarters are a beast, and there are always going to be challenges, but between Matt and Sean, we've run 6 successful Kickstarter projects in the past —so we know where the pitfalls are, we know how to hustle and how to promote, and we feel absolutely confident we can bang this out and make a very very cool book in the process.

There is a great publisher onboard to publish Return of the Toe Tag Riot, as long as we can pay the art and creative costs with the successful Kickstarter.
