updates.update_userinfo: Only 5 days left on DEATH TRAP! Don't miss out!
updates.update_content:
Hey all, I thank anyone who still reads these updates and please know that I love you.  Building a career in comics, when you're an opinionated loudmouth with something to say, is especially tough.  It means I have to reach out to you folks, and sometimes, like today, I have to reach out for maybe the third time?  I'm not sure.
What I do know is that DEATH TRAP is in the home stretch, but we only have 5 days left.  Please check it out?  Please pledge.  I swear to you, this is a beautifully illustrated book with a ton of heart, a lot of bananas fun, and just enough of my point of view that you'll be like "Ah, he snuck that in there, nice."

updates.update_userinfo: Hey TTR 2 backers! I launched a new Kickstarter - DEATH TRAP! It's f'n bananas!
updates.update_content:
Hey backers,
While we wait for the world to be less "nightmare a day" to relaunch Return of the Toe Tag Riot, might I direct you to a new comic project I just launched called DEATH TRAP?  I swear, this is right up your alley, TTR fans, and it's so. damn. much. fun.
And, thanks to everyone who sent well wishes re: my Dad.  He's OK and, in his mid 70s he's decided to get married again.  Life is weird and I guess he realized he's not immortal and he better put a ring on it before it's too late.  :)

updates.update_userinfo: An update, a delay, an explanation and apology - TOE TAG RIOT will be back another time.
updates.update_content:
Friends, 
Matt here.  I want to thank you all for backing this project and believing in the vision - wanting TOE TAG RIOT to return in this new age of awfulness to lay waste to (and make fun of) the absolute scum of the Earth.
But, we're needing to cancel the project for now, and we'll bring it back another time.  Some of you may know, but for those who don't:  My Dad was taken to the hospital about a week and a half ago, and my head has not been in the game for promotion, press, and the like.  I've not been able to focus on much aside from immediate deadlines, my dogs and the rescue, and the overwhelming worry and stress over what's going on with my Dad.

Hello everyone!
First of all, THANK YOU! We are well past the first day of the campaign and we are THRILLED and MOVED with the response from Toe Tag Riot fans who have welcomed us back to bring you more of the same!
Matt and I would like to take a moment to thank all 69 of your reading this. That's right, 69 people have committed their hard earned cash into helping Matt and I make another comic where a Zombie Punk Rock Band eat the worst humanity has to offer. What an fitting milestone to commemorate!

campaign.story:
Welcome to Dead Beats!
"..if you're looking for new or used vinyl, cassettes, CDs, gear, or merch, Dead Beats has the best selection in town. Of course, everything we sell has a story and our friendly Shoppe Keeper is happy to tell you all about it. All sales final..."
Dead Beats cover by Lisa Sterle (Long Lost, Submerged) featuring The Shoppe Keeper
THE BOOK
Dead Beats is a 160-page full-color anthology of music-themed horror comics centered around the curiosities for sale at one peculiar record store by its enigmatic Shoppe Keeper. Edited by Joseph Corallo (Oh S#!t, It's Kim & Kim, Mine!) and Eric Palicki (This Nightmare Kills Fascists, All We Ever Wanted), Dead Beats features more than twenty comics stories and more than forty up-and-coming creators and industry veterans, as well as cover art and interstitial narrative illustrations by Lisa Sterle (Long Lost, Submerged).
From the Dead Beats introduction, illustrated by Lisa Sterle
From the Dead Beats Introduction, illustrated by Lisa Sterle
From "Vanishing." Illustrations by Sally Cantirino from a script by Matthew Erman.
From "The Cursed Saxophone of Skasferatu." Illustrations by Dan Buksa from a script by Matthew Summo.
THE STRETCH GOALS
Because we hit our initial funding goal well ahead of schedule, the staff here at Dead Beats is proud to announce our stretch goals! Just don't tell the Shoppe Keeper. She hates it when we give stuff away for free!
$30,000: Premium Cover Stock with Spot Gloss
$35,000: Two Mini-Prints Added to All Physical Book Backers and Up (Lisa Sterle’s cover image and Jen Hickman’s image)
$40,000: EXCLUSIVE Kickstarter Edition available ONLY to backers. It will have its own logo color and a “Kickstarter Exclusive” stamp (Not Available in the Direct Market)
THE CREATORS
DEAD BEATS features a broad range of voices from new and established talent selected from across the medium. Notably, the book includes a reunion of Doom Patrol alums Rachel Pollack and Richard Case, working together for the first time in more than 25 years! 
Rachel Pollack and Richard Case (Doom Patrol)
Brent Schoonover (Howling Commandos) and Cameron DeOrdio (Josie & The Pussycats)
Jen Hickman (Moth & Whisper) and Joe Corallo (She Said Destroy)
Matthew Erman (Long Lost) and Sally Cantirino (The Last Song)
Eva Cabrera (Kim & Kim) and Kwanza Osajyefo (Black)
Eric Palicki (No Angel) and Liana Kangas (Black AF: Devil's Dye)
Steenz and Ivy Noelle Weir (Archival Quality)
Rafer Roberts (Grumble) and Daniel Kibblesmith (Santa's Husband)
Vita Ayala (The Wilds, Submerged) and Raymond Salvador
Marie Enger (Fhtagn & Loathing) and Danny Lore (The Queen of Bad Dreams)
Eli Powell (InferNoct) and Mark Bouchard (Everything is Going Wrong)
Sweeney Boo (Eat and Love Yourself) and Nadia Shammas (Care Bears)
Chris Peterson (Grindhouse) and Tony Patrick (X'ed)
Ayşegül Sınav (Loved and Lost) and Tyler Chin-Tanner (Broken Frontier)
ALSO FEATURING: Ren "Renfamous" Cooper * Caroline Autopsy * Alexis Sara * Christine Hipp * Tres Dean * Kyler Clodfelter * Christof Bogacs * Giles Crawford * Matthew Summo * Dan Buksa * Regine Sawyer * Y. Sanders * Sabs Cooper * Claudia Aguirre * Magdalene Visaggio * AND MORE!
REWARDS
A wide variety of rewards are available to backers of the DEAD BEATS campaign, including the book itself, tees, physical and digital bundles of material from A WAVE BLUE WORLD's extensive catalog, and more. In addition, all backers at the $5 tier and higher will find their name printed in the 'THANK YOU' section of the book!

A WAVE BLUE WORLD
Founded in 2005 by Tyler & Wendy Chin-Tanner, AWBW is an independent publisher of high quality graphic novels, anthologies and art books with a focus on originality and cultural relevance.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The most common challenges for an anthology is to get all the creator work in time, but considering this is our 6th anthology we've Kickstarted and all the previous anthologies came together beautifully and were delivered on time, we feel we have a pretty strong track record.

campaign.story:
Black Terror: Social Insecurity is a new, 90+ page graphic novel that asks the question: "What happens when superheroes get old?"
just added!
A few years ago, my friend Rafer Roberts and I created the short story Black Terror: Wednesday at the Diner about public domain Golden Age superheroes meeting up for brunch in their retirement. I enjoyed the story and the characters so much that I decided to create a whole book about them. And so was born Social Insecurity, continuing the story of these (mostly) forgotten superheroes as they near the age of 100.
If the name "Black Terror" sounds familiar, it's because he was first published in the January, 1941 issue of Exciting Comics from Nedor Comics; for a time, he was a very popular character, but like many of his contemporaries, the Black Terror soon faded into obscurity (and the public domain) after the end of World War II. Other companies, like Eclipse, Image and Dynamite have since published this character in one form or another, often trying to reinterpret him in modern ways.
This book, though, follows the Black Terror as if he had aged in real time since his 1941 debut! No longer an active superhero, The Black Terror and his fellow heroes face old age as they each near their own personal centennials. Accompanying our title character are other public domain heroes such as the Silver Streak, the Fighting Yank, the Mentalist from Mars and Mr. Q!
Small press publishing can be both time consuming as well as expensive, so I'm here on Kickstarter asking for your help to push us all across the finish line with our book. In addition to the book itself, we're offering some great rewards, which I'll detail below, along with links, previews and a look at our creative team!
Thanks for checking us out! If you enjoy superheroes, comedy, and stories about really old people, I hope you'll pledge and help us reach our goal!
THE BOOK:
Social Insecurity will run at least 90 pages long - longer if some stretch goals are met! It collects the "Wednesday at the Diner" short story with Rafer Roberts, and it includes a brand new, full-length story with artist Ryan Howe. There'll also be several pinups by different creators and "making of" material to round out the volume, all with a brand new cover from Rafer Roberts.
 Click the image below to read the original "Wednesday at the Diner" short story: 
Click the image below to read a preview of the full-length "Social Insecurity" story:
 THE REWARDS:
Hopefully, the biggest reward for this campaign is, well, the book itself. But we've also put together some really neat extras, too!
The pin: a 1.5" soft enamel pin with featuring the classic Black Terror, with art by Dani G.!
The stickers: a set of two grumpy superheroes on 4x6 vinyl stickers, with art by Mark Welser!
The print: an 8x11 art print on sturdy stock, with art by Duane Redhead!
The bookplate: get a personalized bookplate for the inside of your book, signed by the creators of the book and with an original sketch (of your favorite Golden Age hero) by Ryan Howe!
Be in the book: get drawn into the book as a character by artist Ryan Howe! If you choose this option, we'll be in contact to get reference photos.
Stretch goals: I've got a few stretch goals planned in case we exceed the original $3000 goal. First and foremost, I'll make the book longer by adding new stories and other material! More info on these to come!
THE CREATORS:
THE CAMPAIGN GOAL:
My first goal with this campaign is to be able to pay the artists on the book a decent page rate so they can, you know, eat and stuff. After that, I hope to offset some of the printing and shipping costs that otherwise might be prohibitive.
If this campaign ends up exceeding the $3,000 goal, all of the extra funds will be funneled directly back into the book, adding pages and stories to bulk up and add value to the comic!

If you're looking for more content, progress reports and to keep up, you can always follow me online by clicking the images below:
Thanks for looking!

updates.update_content:
Hey folks – I hope that this message finds you all well during these interesting times! I wanted to reach out with news of my new book that I’ve just launched here on Kickstarter. It’s called Planet Comics, and I hope you’ll check it out!
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/jeffmcclelland/planet-comics
Planet Comics is a 40+ page oversized comic that pays tribute to the original 1940s pulp sci-fi adventure book. I’m developing and editing the book, and I also wrote the lead story (funny how that works), “The Bulwark”, a serialized adventure through space, time and the mind as our lead character tries to figure out how Earth’s greatest hero had a hand in the end of the world! It’s got art by Here’s the first page!

Hello everyone – this is just a quick note to say that all of the rewards have shipped! (There’s actually one package where I’m waiting on address confirmation, but other than that, we’re golden.) All of the domestic rewards actually shipped in mid-July; the international packages took a bit longer. But as of this week, they’re all out there in the wild.
If you’re an international backer, it may take a few weeks for your items to actually be delivered, so if you haven’t received your items yet, give it a little more time before worrying too much. If you’re a domestic backer and haven’t received your items, well, perhaps it is time to worry a bit, as I’d image you should have gotten your package by now. But don’t worry TOO much – send me a message and I’ll do what I can to track your individual shipment. I do have tracking for all of the packages, though those receipts are all conveniently crumpled up in a drawer that I’d have to sort thought, proving once again that the road to Hell is paved with both good intentions and post office receipts.

One of the weird things about being friends with other comic creators is that I get to see pictures of comics in shipping boxes more often than you might think likely. I get it, we’re all proud of our work and get excited when our books arrive, but it’s still funny that we all have the same reaction – open up the box and take a picture! With that said, here’s a picture of our Black Terror book after it arrived from the printer!

THE GOOD FIGHT is a comics anthology taking a peaceful stand against racism and bigotry.
Originally a reaction to the events in Charlottesville, Virginia, where white nationalists protested the removal of Confederate statues, and to the ensuing attacks, which resulted in several injuries and the death of Heather Heyer, THE GOOD FIGHT has since evolved into a more timeless commentary on the ongoing struggle against hate. Because hate itself will adapt to survive.
The all-star roster of writers, artists, colorists, letterers and editors involved in THE GOOD FIGHT have graciously donated their time and creative energy to the project, resulting in more than 40 full color stories across a broad spectrum of genres.

updates.update_content:
Hello Good Fighters!
I wanted to reach out to all of you with a simple message. 
It's been a heck of a year, or rather 3+ years. We've gone through so much civil unrest and have seen the continuation of violent crimes aimed at minorities by our own police, backed by a president that embraces white supremacy and allowing a pandemic to run it's course through the lungs of the very people he swore to protect.

updates.update_userinfo: For readers that want GREAT comic books!
updates.update_content:
Hey all!
Sometimes it's important to unplug, turn off the news and stimulate your brain in other ways. It doesn't mean you care any less, you just have to recover. In fact there's a great story about that in TGF :)
With that we wanted to make our comic book fans out there aware of two Kickstarter campaigns running right now that are from some of our very own creators featured in THE GOOD FIGHT!

updates.update_userinfo: NOW YOUR FRIENDS CAN ORDER THE BOOK TOO! & Delivery Update
updates.update_content:
Hello Goodfighters!
I've opened an etsy store where anyone can order a copy of THE GOOD FIGHT. You all got the cool extras, but here they can order the book. The great thing is all of the money collected from the etsy sales will go to the SPLC!
If you would like additional copies or have someone asking how to get it, show them this link:  https://etsy.me/2L1GGlj

Hello Goodfighters! Books were shipped from the fulfillment center last Thursday direct to our backers. I’ve already heard from some that they have received their package!
They are being sent media mail which claims 7-10 days, but I believe it’s much quicker in some areas. If a couple weeks go by and you don’t have your package please reach out to me and I will find out what’s going on and correct it.
For orders outside of the US, allow a little more time. They have been sent but I can’t say for certain how long it will take to travel.

Hello Goodfighters! The books have left the printer yesterday and are on their way to the fulfillment center! From there they will be packaged with the prints and bumper sticker, nicely boxed up and shipped directly to our physical backers. I hope you are as excited as I am, the book is almost in our hands!
Some people have asked when they will be able to order more books or get their first copy post-Kickstarter, hold tight as we are working on that. I’ll definitely be putting that info here on the Kickstarter page.

updates.update_userinfo: Your digital copy and print news!
updates.update_content:
It’s here! The digital pdf of THE GOOD FIGHT!
Below you will find links to the pdf book. We’ve included both a high resolution file and a lower resolution file just in case your device doesn’t work well with large files.
Better yet, the book is off to the printer! We are expecting a proof next week, then it should take 10-12 business days to print the books and send them to our fulfillment center. The FC will pack up the books, stickers and prints to send directly to you. If you haven’t filled out your survey that gives us your address, please do so asap! Just head to Kickstarter or find the email previously sent to you.

Hello Goodfighters!
We are nearing the end! We had to make a few revisions and I'm expecting to have the final pdf in my hands this week. As soon as we have that, we will send out digital copies for you to read! Or if you are a physical backer and choose to wait you can do that as well.
We also have all additional rewards in hand. They will be sent to our fulfillment center and grouped together with the books to be sent to you.

Hello Goodfighters! A quick reminder, we sent out surveys the other day. This is how we get your shipping address and name for the backer section of the book. Please fill that out ASAP, you’ll have until the 19th if you want your name in the book.
We’ve also been working hard on getting all of the other rewards in, today we received the mini prints that all physical backers will receive. They are beautiful card stock and vibrant!

Hello Good Fighters!
We have built one mighty community of comic book creators when putting our book together. We want to support to a couple of projects that are being created by THE GOOD FIGHT contributors and are currently on Kickstarter! After the 3 books we will talk about, there is an art spoiler for THE GOOD FIGHT! It will be easy to miss as you'll have to scroll all the way down, just in case you don't want to see it.

"Non-stop and full of energy, this book is irresistible!" - Mark Waid, writer (Captain America, Kingdom Come, Doctor Strange)

"Exciting, clever, quirky, and action-packed!  CW Cooke and Travis Hymel deliver full-blast fun and thrills. Cooke's script is fast-paced and original and Hymel's art is top-notch! Two thumbs way up!" - Brian Augustyn, writer and editor (Batman: Gotham By Gaslight, Flash, Archie 1941)

Hello! My name is CW Cooke and I've been working in independent comics since 2007. I've worked with companies like Big Dog Ink (Joan of Arc), Image Comics (Spread short story), Devil's Due (hit series Solitary with a soon to be released second volume which began as a Kickstarter), Action Lab (Stillwater), Pilot Studios (Always Punch Nazis vol 1 and more to come), Arcana, Viper, and Bluewater as well as in the self-published realm of comics.
My first series, Solitary (which many of you helped fund a few years back), has recently entered a development deal for film and television. Here's a link to see more about that and follow that progress as it happens: 
https://graphicpolicy.com/2018/10/04/nycc-2018-devils-due-comics-and-cw-cookes-solitary-gets-a-development-deal/
Co-created with artist Travis Hymel and with colors by Jeremy Kahn and letters and logo by Micah Myers, we're working hard to bring our newest idea, L.U.C.H.A., to life. And Agente needs your help! 
A HORROR WRESTLING EXTRAVAGANZA:
L.U.C.H.A. is the story of Agente, a luchador detective who spends his life solving low level crimes and murders, taking on any job that falls in his lap. He just so happens to get wrapped up in a murder campaign that involves vampires, wrestlers, and other notorious figures before the rug gets pulled out from under  him...and the readers!
L.U.C.H.A. is one of the most fun things I've worked on in comics. Born from a simple idea as part of the Kayfabe anthology (a wrestling comic anthology put together by comic creators and wrestling fans alike, with the emphasis on wrestling as real), this story about Agente took on a life of its own because of the incredible working chemistry Travis and I had and the unbelievably insane story we came up with. The first ten pages will rock your socks off and after that it will swerve and take your breath away.
Pin, available at $50 level
I've wanted to make a comic that was this insane for a long time, and I've found the perfect partners in crime. And we need your help because this beautiful work will require a lot to deliver the goods.
By pledging you're helping us see the series through to issue four. We're keeping our rewards focused around issue one, to keep this campaign simple, but we'll be sure to update you whenever new issues are available as well, and try to come up with some extra perks down the line to remember the backers who helped make this book's launch possible.
We have a lot of plans for stretch goals, but before we get there, hit that pledge button please! The rewards are at the bottom of this page.   
 WRITER: CW Cooke
ARTIST: Travis Hymel
COLORS: Jeremy Kahn
LETTERS/LOGO: Micah Myers
EDITS: Shawn Gabborin and Shawn Pryor
SPECIAL THANKS: Jay Huwer, Shawn Pryor, Jeremy Mohler, Kit Caoagas, Shawn Gabborin, Trevor Mueller, Steve Ekstrom, my wife, my wonderful friends, my team, and so many others that I'm probably forgetting that helped keep my mind at ease as I built this thing.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The first issue is completely drawn and in the process of being colored. We've begun work on issue two and plotted the rest of the first arc.

The only issues or setbacks that might come up at this point would be in relation to certain rewards and taking a bit of time to get them completed. The book is done, the colors are being completed, so getting it printed and delivered and all the rewards sent out is really the only challenge we face.

I am very open and honest. If something is taking time, I'm an easy person to find and I'm more than willing to admit to my mistakes and to make them right.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
A lot of you will have already received your copies by now, but I wanted to update anyway! 
The only copies to still be sent out, at this point, are some local folks, foreign folks, and y'all with original art levels that are being finished as we speak. And one variant cover situation that is being colored as we speak and is the bonus store variant for Elite Comics. 
Most everyone else will have their copies by now or by this week, marking a major milestone in this campaign. We have an updated digital copy which I will email out with the corrected credits page.

Because I'm a buffoon, there's proper credit missing in the opening. The incredible short story is both written and drawn by Travis Hymel. I believed I had fixed that mistake prior to printing but I apparently did not. 
He and Jeremy did some killer work in this issue so remember to tell them how great their work Is! More to come

Literally everything that can go wrong, has gone wrong. 
Fedex was no help. 
UPS was no help.
USPS has been a big help BUT we can only print 20 labels at a time and my bank has now declined me from printing more due to what probably appears to them to be fradulent charges.

All of the shipping is still in progress and should be completed soon. Because of the holiday you might notice a slight hiccup in the timeliness of the items, but everyone (EXCEPT the original art levels) should be receiving their items very soon.
Mailing and putting the packages together has been another incredibly difficult part only because having the right size packages to ship things in, getting them prepped and ready, and getting everything signed took a bit of time.

Call me crazy, but you would think that an apartment complex would want to NOT hold onto 6 boxes like this for a month, right? They had them in their office for a long time and after checking in with them a bunch of times, boom, there they were, hidden in a corner. 
Thank you all for your patience. So the books are here, so what's next?

The books should be to me from the printers, I'm hoping, this week or next. That has been the final hurdle now, is just getting the physical copies back. The commissions are being finished and everything else is done. So what's next? 
Now that Planet Comicon is in my rear view, I'm sending out the Digital Library Comics TODAY. So check your email for those if you paid $30 or more. Lots of cool stuff inside that library and lots of fun reading to be done.

The physical books are shipping to me this week! Once I receive them, I will be signing and putting packages together for all that I can at that time. Digital library rewards should finalize this week for everyone who put in for that level ($30 and up), and the art pieces for commissions are being worked on as well. 
Beyond that: issue 3 is almost finished art-wise and issue 4 is fully scripted. News will be forthcoming soon in regards to when the book will hit comic shops as well so keep your eyes open! And as always, thank you for your patience.

Digital Copies and Digital Rewards should be out this week!!!!!!!!
So what does that mean? 
It means we have everything but the physical books and the commission art. The shirts and pins and masks and everything else is in, so now we are just waiting on the physical books to come to me so I can get everything shipped out.

As an FYI, and this is totally my fault, we are running a bit behind. We have all of the items for the book except the comic and the shirts. Everything else has been received and is ready to go, just waiting on the book itself and the shirts. 
Again, this is my fault. Work laid a bunch of people off so my focus was off a bit because of that (I didn't lose my job, whether good or bad we shall see but the level of work has gotten insane), but I'm focusing on finishing everything as quickly as possible.

You should all receive your surveys for the LUCHA kickstarter so please make sure you check the emails associated with the funding and we can ensure we get everything to you in a timely fashion.
Work continues on finalizing variant covers and lettering files for the book as the other items are slowly arriving. 
Also, if anyone has any questions or concerns, please message. We are doing everything in our power to hit the January deadline to the best of our abilities.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
With a project such as this, delays can happen, that will not to be the case however with DOTHA. We have left an appropriate amount of time to go to print and to ship to our backers. Also, with the support of our amazing publisher A Wave Blue World, we have a certain level of consistency and credibility to go along with the project as well. 

Working in a project with a large group of creators can be challenging. Many of the creators have jobs, obligations or other gigs that pay significantly better. We allowed ourselves enough of a head start to deliver a book that is of a certain standard and within a designated time frame.

We have very good deadlines in place to ensure quality and completion before we go to print. We are well prepared to handle any and all issues that arise. I will be communicating with all backers frequently and will be completely honest through out this process of this project. We are all very excited to do this project and can not wait to deliver, what we believe is going to be, a great horror anthology.

updates.update_content:
As much as I would like to write a super formal update for you guys - i'll likely just type everything as if I were speaking to you all in person. 
Unfortunately, the project was unsuccessful on kickstarter. What that means for the project moving forward...I don't know. But that's not the purpose of this update. 
This is my second go at this thing. It's been a very large part of my life over the past year and a half. I could speak of all the work I have personally put into this, but I think that's not what this project was ever about. It's not about the efforts or passion of one person. Every single creator was just as responsible for how special and significant this book was. I couldn't be more grateful of having spent countless hours working along side creators I respect and admire. This is their book.

Hey everyone! We have a new cover to the project that I have posted online and would love to share with you all here too. I won't ramble too much - even though I am incredibly tempted. I will say my thanks to the incredible team that worked on this beautiful cover though. 
Adam Gorham, who is one of the greatest artists and overall nicest guys in comics. He calls me sweetie sometimes and I won't lie...I like it. If it wasn't for Adam's horrible taste in beer, and the fact he lives in a rival hockey province, i'm sure we would be best friends. Regardless, Adam is the greatest.

Thanks to you all for supporting our anthology and continuing to spread the word about the Kickstarter. We really appreciate it. As we approach the final week there's still a way to go, but I'm confident we can hit our target - so please continue to tweet and comment and share this campaign with your communities.
I thought I'd kick off this update with a question: what scares you?
It's a seemingly innocuous question but one we seldom analyze in any great detail. Fear is one of those emotions we typically go out of our way to avoid, and in our everyday lives we often avoid doing the things that scare us, except when we're certain the fear can be controlled (such as when watching a horror movie). When viewed this way, fear is a barrier to the unknown. While fear has a clear (and perhaps necessary) evolutionary origin, in some ways it constrains us.

I absolutely did not know Jed was going to say such kind words. Made me tear up a little. He’s the best, and that’s exactly why this book is so important to us. Just wanted to say though that I didn’t put him up to it. Emily did.
Kelly

Guest backer update; 
Ok, so I’ve been staring at a blank page for the better part of an hour wracking my brain trying to work out what I can write that could possibly get you to back DOTHA if you haven’t already. I mean I could go on about the insane quality of creators that Kelly has somehow managed to put together but honestly all you need to do is hop over the campaign page and scroll down. If you don’t see at least one name there you like then why are you even reading comic books.

Hey,
So, I’m a little late to the fact - but I realized I haven’t given a proper introduction of myself to you all. Simply, we can say I’m weird and I say weird things and happen to live in Canada - and that would be a quintessential explanation. “I like to think there’s more beneath though.” - likely said by Batman at some point.
I’m not going to go into childhood memories or what my favourite book is (Swamp Thing), but instead I think the best introduction is the “why?” Why did I get started in comics? Why is a project like DOTHA so important to me?

Hey Death of the Horror backers!
My name is Stephanie Cannon and I'm a comic writer and creator (It Came Out On a Wednesday, CORPUS, IF Anthology, InSymmetry Creations) with a story in the Death of the Horror Anthology titled "Hallowed". I was fortunate enough to work with the talented Val Halvorson, who brought the art in this story to life in ways that far surpassed what I had envisioned. Zakk Samm lettered the pages and title, and completely captured the creepy vibe I was hoping for.

Hey everyone,
Like all projects, Death of the Horror Anthology started as a simple idea and subsequently evolved into a passion project predicated on creating something with friends and peers. Friends and peers that have become an extension of family in many ways. Friends and peers that I was fortunate enough to collaborate on a short story with called OLD WOUNDS.
OLD WOUNDS is a subjective tale that, although references popular horror tropes, finds its own identity early on. It’s steeped with ambiguity and metaphors - but can also be however simple of a concept as YOU want. Reader interpretation will surely vary - and that was always the initial goal.

Hey!
SYFY editor Jeff Spry put together a very thoughtful and humbling article regarding our Kickstarter for Death of the Horror Anthology.
It’s such an honour to be featured on their site and I’m very grateful to Jeff for his time, encouraging words and for his love for the medium.

campaign.story:
Atlantis Wasn't Built for Tourists tells the story of Lucas Lewis, a drifter who stumbles upon a small town in Atlantis County, Oregon and its corrupt sheriff who uses the threat of monsters living in the surrounding countryside to maintain law and order. Lucas becomes determined to free the town from both the sheriff and the creatures in the woods while also coming to terms with his own supernatural heritage.
Mirroring H.P. Lovecraft's "Shadow Over Innsmouth," Atlantis Wasn't Built for Tourists is the tale of a town in thrall to a peculiar evil. However, unlike the earlier story, our villains are made, not predestined, and often hide behind the badge of authority.
A 96-page graphic novel, complete unto itself, Atlantis Wasn't Built for Tourists is written by Eric Palicki (Fake Empire, No Angel), illustrated by Wendell Cavalcanti (BlackAcre), colored by Mark Dale (GWAR: Orgasmaggedon), and featuring front and back cover art by Caspar Wijngaard (Angelic) and Natasha Alterici (Heathen), respectively.  
Cover art by Caspar Wijngaard
Back Cover Art by Natasha Alterici
The Kickstarter video features the song "All Fall Down" by Consuelo's Revenge.
 All backers will have their names printed in the "Thank You" section of the book! Digital and physical tiers are available, and all digital copies of Atlantis Wasn't Built for Tourists will be DRM-free. Physical copies will be autographed by the writer.
I'm happy to report that art and colors are complete, which allows us to run this campaign with a modest goal to pay for printing, shipping, and Kickstarter fees, with enough funds left over to pay our letterer.
Imminent Press is a collective of independent comic book creators from all over the world with one unanimous goal: We aim to entertain you with our eclectic array of stories. We believe that comics are for everyone everywhere and we aim to bring new talent into the industry both in print and digitally. We are here to 'Make Comics Dangerous Again'. Expect us.

updates.update_content: I just wanted to give everyone a head's up that the very last of the packages went out in the mail today. I know there were longer than expected delays for a few of the specialized reward tiers and, while some of those delays were outside my control, I am entirely to blame for not getting you your books in a more timely manner. In any case, I'm extremely proud of this book, and there's some exciting news coming soon about Atlantis Wasn't Built for Tourists. I hope you enjoy it, and I appreciate your support and patience while I finally put the book in your hands.

Hello again!
First, a small bit of housekeeping: new copies of FAKE EMPIRE are on the way -- FINALLY! -- so I'll be sending the last batch of reward packages this week. The better news is, the reason for the delay was that the book went out of print, and the publisher went back to press with a new printing featuring extra material. Backers of the book pack will be among the first to receive the deluxe edition.

I know this channel has been relatively silent over the past month, and that's entirely my fault. I know a few people have reached out, so I wanted to provide this update. There were a few hiccups with shipping, as the US Postal Service website doesn't allow users to buy media rate postage online, and individually labeling packages, taking them to the P.O., and having a clerk hand sort/weigh/stamp them is a timely affair, never mind that the post office is open the exact same times as I'm at my day job.
Thankfully, I've come up with a solution and ALL PACKAGES, domestic AND international,  will be in the mail by the end of the coming week. (Three cheers for endicia.com, which offers a cheaper, more user-friendly platform than stamps.com, and which is compatible with Mac).

The books have arrived and shipping will begin this week!
Additionally, I will be exhibiting this month in Artist Alley at both Emerald City Comic Con (in Seattle) and C2E2 (in Chicago). If you're attending either of these shows and would like to pick up your rewards (and I'll throw in a signed copy of No Angel #1 for your trouble) directly from me at either show, please get in touch. The best way to do so is to email me at epalicki@gmail.com.

So, yeah. 
The printed proof showed up at my door early last week -- delayed slightly by the weather -- and I couldn't be happier with how the interiors turned out. Unfortunately, we had to go back to the drawing board with the cover, as the printing process completely obscured the finer details of Caspar's cover (speaking of Caspar, you all are reading Peter Cannon: Thunderbolt, right?!)

First of all, thanks for your patience and continued support. It's appreciated. I know I've kept you waiting with this long overdue update.
I just uploaded the last of the art files to the printer, which means we're just about ten days out from having books in hand, and then I'll be sending them on to everyone. 
If you missed out on the campaign, the book will be making its debut at Emerald City Comic Con and at C2E2, by which time backers will already have their copies.

All,
I encountered a slight delay in getting the pages sized correctly for print, but I'm happy to say that we've solved the problem and physically printed books are now on order. I'll begin shipping as soon as they're in my hands.
If you're due the digital edition, links were sent out as part of the previous update. I am finishing up the annotated script, and I'll be sending that along as soon as it's complete and scanned in.

campaign.story:
STORY LINE
In a world where anything is possible, Dynamo has been able to do the impossible — as the strongest man in the world. One of the first of mankind to discover his super powers, Dynamo for years used his uncanny super strength to save lives and change the world. Dynamo was one of the first of the super powers to join, and the SFC, as it was called, became a house hold name for wrestling entertainment and with it Dynamo’s fame and legacy grew... However, it all seemed unreal for Dynamo. And underneath all of the bravado, Dynamo, the strongest man in the world, felt as if none of his life was actually his, that somehow it has all been meant for someone else, and that somehow, I’m some cruel way, he was living a lie...  
Years have gone by, and with the waning of time, countless heroes and villains have fought, inside the ring and outside. Now, as Dynamo has tired and nears time for retirement from the squared circle, he begins to have strange feelings and then visions of another life and of an unspeakable action that makes him question who he really is and has been for years. Dynamo is a story about what it truly means to be the world’s strongest man and the fight it takes to accept who you truly are.
I was excited when asked to write this series for Dynamo. I love everything that Marcel Dupree and Evoluzione Publishing is doing. They are fighting the good fight. I also loved that Dynamo is part of the SFC Universe, a world that is very diverse and full of interesting, dynamic characters.
As excited as I was to write Dynamo, I did have one hesitation. Pop culture is filled with white male protagonists. That’s always been the case. I grew up surrounded by them from Luke Skywalker to Indiana Jones. As a kid, I saw so many movies and read so many books where the protagonist was a white male, and the director / writer was also a white male. That’s how I learned to see the world – through the lens of a white male. With Dynamo, I wanted to do something different, something that sets him apart from the usual white male protagonist. 
That’s when I started thinking, what if Dynamo becomes woke and realizes that everything he is, all the success he’s had, came at the expense of someone else. Not just anyone else, though. It came at the expense of an African American wrestler.
This opened the door to write about racism, patriarchy, and white privilege at a time when our country so desperately needs to have this discussion and confront our own racism and white privilege once and for all. Suddenly, I had to write this series. Dynamo was a story that needed to be told. 
Your support will allow us to tell it. Thank you for your time and consideration. 
~Jennie

campaign.story:
ALL WE EVER WANTED: STORIES OF A BETTER WORLD is a gorgeous, full-color anthology packed with stories told against the backdrop of a brighter future and featuring some of comics' hottest talent of today and tomorrow!  Curated and edited by Matt Miner (GWAR: Orgasmageddon, Poser) & Eric Palicki (No Angel, Orphans), and published by A Wave Blue World, the book's loaded with 25+ stories meant to inspire us and restore the belief that a better world is possible.  You won't find any dystopian nightmares here. 

Think more Star Trek, less Mad Max, more Caprica, less Battlestar Galactica.  More "San Junipero" Black Mirror and less every other Black Mirror.  You get it.
cover art by Ariela Kristantina
Sample page from "Everything I Own" by Lela Gwenn, Tony Gregori, and Josh Jensen
Sample page from "It Looked Like Our Dreams" by Maria Fröhlich
Sample page from "Owning up to the Past" by James Maddox, Gavin Smith, and Nick Wentland
Sample page from "The Pilot" by Dean Trippe
Bookplate art by Marie Enger. Limited to 50 green and 25 orange. Signed by many creators (see tiers on right for details)
Everyone who backs the project will have the option to include their names in the "Thank You" section of the book.
The book has a publishing home at A Wave Blue World, who will cover pre-press and printing costs.
Special thanks to Clan of Xymox for letting us use their song "A Day" in the KS video: www.clanofxymox.com
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Between Eric Palicki, Matt Miner, and Tyler & Wendy Chin-Tanner, we have 12 successful Kickstarter projects that were funded and then fulfilled to backers. So while the biggest risk to most projects is flaky Kickstarter creators, that's not us.

We are incredibly comfortable with the Kickstarter platform and what it takes to deliver to our supporters and we have a long track record of success to prove it.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi Everyone,
Just want to let you know that due to the overwhelming response to ALL WE EVER WANTED, we've launched the campaign for the sequel, MAYBE SOMDAY.

Hey, everyone. Eric here.
I wanted to make one last-minute plea for anyone who’s enjoyed the work Matt and I have done, alone (No Angel, Fake Empire, Liberator, Poser, etc, etc) or together (All We Ever Wanted, This Nightmare Kills Fascists) to check out Matt’s new project, Death Trap.
Matt’s graciously invited me to contribute a backup story featuring the amoral circus performer/fish woman, Aerwyn, and my yarn is going to be just as bananas as what Chris and Matt are building in the central tale of a revenge-seeking woman and her haunted car.

updates.update_userinfo: Just launched on KS: DEATH TRAP! (and it's f'n wild fun!)
updates.update_content:
Hey All We Ever Wanted backers,
Matt Miner here, and I just launched DEATH TRAP on Kickstarter.  It's absolutely wild and fun and a bright spot in an otherwise dreary existence as of late.  I urge you to check it out and help us over goal!  You don't want to miss this!
Earlier today, I realized this book is entirely created by folks who were in All We Ever Wanted.  I'm writing, Chris Peterson (artist/writer of the "Una" story) is on art, Josh Jensen is on colors and Matt Krotzer on letters - it's like an All We Ever Wanted class reunion!

Hi Everyone,
Wanted to spread the good news that ALL WE EVER WANTED was nominated for a Ringo Award for best anthology.  So once again, a huge thanks goes out to all of you for believing in this book and helping make it happen!
If you're an industry pro, you can vote for the Ringo Awards right here.

Hey Gang,
Quick note to highlight a new Kickstarter I (Matt Miner) am contributing a story to.  This is a big one and is gonna be SO cool - a metric ton of talented people sharing 9-panel stories to help you nail a new skill.  Learn how to do all kinds of rad stuff from folks who have it down pat.

updates.update_content:
Hey y'all,
When we started making this book we all knew it was turning into something incredibly special.  Creators were connecting with the concept and giving us their best work, wanting to put out a positive and shining example of the kind of hope that comics could give, and when we got it all together and looked at the final book we knew it was something magical, something really unique and exciting in a landscape of otherwise dreary post-apocalyptic comics.  ALL WE EVER WANTED shines bright with dreams of a better world.

Hello Backers,
Just a quick update to let you know that our latest anthology project is now live!
DEAD BEATS KICKSTARTER PAGE
"Dead Beats" is a music themed horror anthology with a ton of talented creators involved. Just check out the cover:

Hello Backers,
Thank you all for your patience. At this point, pretty much everyone should have received their books. It took us a while to get through all the international shipping (those customs forms are only getting more complicated and I had to fill out most of them by hand).
The only shipments left are a couple of the book packs and a few of the sketch rewards. Sorry if that's you, we promise to get them out as soon as we can. If you didn't back for one of those reward tiers and you still don't have your book, please contact me or double-check that you're filled out your survey.

campaign.story:
This campaign just became a three-fer! Help us get to $5,600 and backers +$12 higher receive PDF copy of CROSSING #4!
Help us print the next two issues in this six-part series and bring CROSSING to Comic Con International in San Diego this July! New to the series? We included preview pages from all three issues below.
This is a campaign to fund TWO new issues in this series. CROSSING will be a six-issue mini-series, and we're here on Kickstarter to print and distribute Issues #2 and #3. Each comic is 24 story pages, full color, to be published digitally and in print. Production is nearly complete and it's almost time to hit print!
Despite some pretty mature, heavy-hitting themes (crime, suicide, railroad safety) the series is a comedy about two people who wouldn't like each other under normal circumstances--much less paranormal--but have to find a way to work together if they ever want to be free of each other. Both issues are now 100% complete, and a print run of 500 copies each is guaranteed when we hit 100% funding. Script for the entire series is complete and we'll be rolling straight into Issues #4 - 6 after we're funded. This series is happening, people, but we need you to help us get to the other side!
Enrica Jang (writer) is the writer and creator of AZTECA, Angel With a Bullet, The House of Montresor, and editor of the annual Red Stylo Presents series of anthologies. Her screenplay The Freshmen was made into a short film, Frienemies, winner of a CINE Golden Eagle in 2011.
Alex Cormack (artist) is an illustrator living in Tyngsboro MA with his wife, Ashley, and three cats Danger, Destruction, and Disaster. He was an independent animator before diving into comics. He has worked with many publishers such as ComixTribe, Bliss on Tap, Red Stylo Media as well as numerous freelance writers, and has been published by Image comics and IDW. For more info please look at his website www.AlexCormack.com
Mark Mullaney (logo, color, letters) is an Emmy-nominated animator and artist from Boston, Massachusetts. See more of his work at landofthedisinterested.tumblr.com. 
Logo design, regular cut and cap-sleeve available
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Crushing and debilitating lack of confidence by the series creator. Issue #1 was so well received, it's been like pulling teeth to get to a place where she felt like the next issues were ready. But F-that! This is an awesome series and we have to kick in now or forget the whole thing. This train is back on track!

As for any other challenges...art for these issues is complete, and we're using all funds to print the issue and send rewards--additional funds will be applied to production costs for the remainder of the series. ALL funds go toward production, whether printing or paying the talented artists who are giving this project an afterlife.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Welcome to the Kickstarter for the second volume of THE CREATORS!
As of May 22nd we hit our $6500 goal and are now aiming for our second stretch goal!
STRETCH GOAL #1: $6500: ACHIEVED! -- COVER UPGRADE + SPECIAL PINUP!
STRETCH GOAL #1: $8000:  SKETCHBOOK AND PINUP SECTION: --Over the years I have gotten to work with some incredible artists and some of them did some incredible pinups inspired by the creators universe. If we hit $8,000 I will add in a few of my favorites. On top of that I will compile all of my favorite sketches from the production of volume 2 and create a sketchbook section for the book.
STRETCH GOAL #3 - $10,000: UNLOCKED! -- GUEST COMICS!  If we manage to get this far I will be able to extend the book with comics written and drawn by guest creators that expand and flesh out The Creators universe! These take place in times and scenarios well outside what is covered in my narrative within the book so it gives a good global sense to the book.
(L) Nick Difabbio (C) Erin Laue (R) Jamie Noguchi
NEW For Backers Only...
When the idea for The Creators was new I did a lot of concept art but it was this drawing that spawned the overarching story and themes of the book.  The design for Kardunn changed a lot as I began the book but this is where it all started!
THE STORY OF THE CREATORS
The Creators is a science fiction graphic novel series about a small portion of the world's young population who suddenly develop the power to bring their imaginations to life through their drawings.  This power, fueled by adolescent emotion, is simultaneously awesome and extraordinarily dangerous as Creators are only limited by their imaginations. The series follows a group of young creators and their fantastic creations as they try an carve out their place in a world that hates and fears them. 
In 2016 I successfully kickstarted The Creators, Volume 1: Imagination Is Power which began the story of Maya and her creation, Kardunn as they were brought to the Creator Academy under the nefarious headmistress, Morgan Etain.
Now, two years later, I am back with the conclusion of this story arch and am proud to bring you The Creators, Volume 2: Strength in Unity which will complete the story arch I began 6 years ago!
 The $5000 I am trying to raise with this campaign will be used to fund the printing of the full color, print edition of Volume 2 of The Creators. It will include chapters 7 through 12 of the comic - over 200 pages - that I have been working on for the last few years. I have put together a few really exciting rewards for you to help me get to this goal…
stretch goals
Anything raised over the $5000 will be put towards some exciting stretch goals that will improve the print quality or extend and add content to the book
STRETCH GOAL #1: $6500: COVER UPGRADE + SPECIAL PINUP! If we can hit this first stretch goal I am going to upgrade the covers to have spot UV and make them all extra special! We got to do this for volume 1 and it really made the cover something special! In addition I will take my 5 year old daughter's drawing of Mr HugZ and color it in the style of The Creators and add it as a pinup in the back of the book.
(left) Amelia's Drawing of Mr HugZ - (center and right) Cover and Spot UV location (PINK)
 STRETCH GOAL #2 - $8000: SKETCHBOOK AND PINUPS. Over the years I have gotten to work with some incredible artists and some of them did some incredible pinups inspired by the creators universe.  If we hit $8,000 I will add in a few of my favorites.  On top of that I will compile all of my favorite sketches from the production of volume 2 and create a sketchbook section for the book.

If we manage to get this far I will be able to extend the book with comics written and drawn by guest creators that expand and flesh out The Creators universe!  These take place in times and scenarios well outside what is covered in my narrative within the book so it gives a good global sense to the book.

Risks and challenges
One of the biggest challenges when creating a comic of any kind is hitting a deadline. I am fortunate to have the entire book completely written, illustrated and designed so there are virtually no risks in completing the content in a timely fashion.

That leaves printing. I have made sure to research the printer that I will be using and have even met the team. Kraken print has a great reputation for producing quality books in a timely fashion. That said, there may be some delays with shipping that are out of my control. I will keep every backer updated as we progress so they know exactly what to expect and when to expect it!

campaign.story:
CUTE ANIMALS ON FIRE - The Super Art Fight Party Game of Drawing Destruction is the first ever home edition of SUPER ART FIGHT.
THE SHOW
Super Art Fight is a live improv comedy show that pits artists against each other on a giant canvas all while being hosted by two moderately funny(wish) commentators and kept in line by a big, scary ref. This live parody of professional wrestling asks artists to dress up as weird and amazing characters and draw funny responses to topics given to them by our famous WHEEL OF DEATH! Topics like: Kitty Twister, Giants with Baby Arms, Babe Lincoln, and Cute Animals on Fire. Hey…weird. Kind of like the title of this game! At the end of every match a winner is chosen by the audience by applause, hollers, screams. We have been putting this crazy show on for a decade and finally found a way to turn it into a game that you can take home and play without involving any of us, effectively making the live…show…useless.   
THE GAME
It’s simple really. You get a deck of cards, filled with carefully chosen topics from Super Art Fight’s WHEEL OF DEATH! You also get a REF card and some directions. To start: 
Assign someone to be the ref and put the REF card in front of them. Then have them turn over the first topic card and read it aloud. 
 Set a timer for 2 minutes on your phone to give everyone time to draw. Now I know what your thinking…You can’t draw. Well that doesn’t really matter! Use stick figures, label the drawing, hell, write something down if that is the only way you know how to communicate. Just come up with some sort of funny, clever, or unexpected response to the topic. 
At the end of 2 minutes, everyone stops and takes turns presenting their drawing to the ref. The ref then chooses the winning drawing based on ANY CRITERIA THEY CHOOSE (so y’know, pander to them) and then it’s on to round two. 
 Just pass the REF CARD clockwise and go again. 
BUT WAIT! There’s a twist! Some of the cards are COMBO cards. If one of these cards comes up, grab someone else’s drawing from a previous round and draw on that. You can change, cover or do anything you want to make this old drawing fit with the new topic. 
The game ends…well, whenever the hell you want. I mean, it’s a party game. We’re all winners here.
STRETCH GOALS
If we are lucky enough to pass our $2,000 goal then we want to make it worth your while to really push us over the edge so here are some stretch goals to really get you excited...
If we hit $4,000 - We will expand the deck with 8 new topics with 8 new illustrations, extending the fun for all!
If we hit $6,000 - We will design, print, and include stickers for EVERY backer who chooses a physical reward.  These will include a Super Art Fight Logo sticker and a few character stickers from our roster.
If we hit $8,000 - well...let's just go bigger...AGAIN!  That's right, another 8 topic cards will be added to the deck.
If we hit $10,000 - we'll tell you if we hit $8,000!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have spent the last year curating the perfect list of topics and play-testing the game in a variety of situations to make sure that the gameplay is perfect. 

Each card is illustrated and we are all but complete (approx 90% finished). We are on track to be 100% done before the end of this campaign.

The biggest risk is in the printing. We are using a print company that we have experience with but you never know exactly just how long it will take for a print run to be completed, shipped and then mailed to you. That said, we have experience running KS campaigns and have taken all of that into account to the best of our ability.

campaign.story:
DEADHORSE rides again!
We're excited to finally, finally get the next issue of DEADHORSE into your hands.  Well into your eyeballs anyway as this campaign is for a DIGITAL VERSION. What we're really trying to do here is get this beauty colored and that's where you come in. I'm hoping to raise $1560 to cover Marissa's fantastic color work on the next chapter, The Ballad of the Two Headed Dog #3, and also cover a very, very small print run.  
Should we exceed our goal and hit our $2800 stretch goal everyone who donates $5 or more gets a PDF of BALLAD OF THE TWO HEADED DOG #4 for free!  So while that entry price of $5 may seem steep for a 28 page comic (it really isn't if you look at what some publisher's are charging for digital), if we hit our stretch goal you'll end up getting two comics for that $5. Math fans have already figured out that means you'd only be paying $2.50 each!
So if this is a story you want more of please consider supporting Phil, Marissa, and myself as we near the ending of our unique little tale of keys, sleep walkers, and bird headed people. 
So what is DEADHORSE? 
Deadhorse is a comic book about a man with nothing who finds the key to everything. It is witten by me (Eric Grissom), drawn by Phil Sloan, and colored by Marissa Louise and David Halvorson. Phil and I started this comic way back in 2010 and it was the first comic I had ever written. Critics have been very kind to us and people seem to dig this weird world we've created. The first book and the first chapter of Ballad of the Two Headed Dog was colored by David Halvorson. With the release of our last issue, Ballad of the Two Headed Dog #2, Marissa Louise took over as colorist.
The story revolves around a reclusive man named William Pike who comes into possession of a strange key and finds himself the target of an evil industrialist. When William learns the key may solve the mystery behind his father's death, he embarks on a journey into the farthest reaches of Alaska in search of the truth. It's a strange little tale that is part comedy, part adventure, part mystery. I'm very proud of the work and I think if you give it a chance you'll dig it too.
STRETCH GOAL!
If we can fund the project, you'll receive a PDF of Ballad #3. If we hit our stretch goal you'll receive Ballad #4 as well.
The rewards are digital
I wanted to keep the cost of this campaign as low as we could which is why you'll see only digital rewards with the exception of the print tier.  That reward level will be super limited so if you need to have a print copy get on that right away. I may or may not ever print it again as a single issue so be sure to jump on that right away if you need it in your life.  Phil and I will both sign them.
Deadhorse Cover Gallery. Art by Phil Sloan.
We will be sending everyone PDF files as well as using ComiXology to fulfill the digital version of Ballad #3 and potentially all of the other digital titles as well.
But what if you want to read the older DEADHORSE in print? Order it here!
Who is making this thing?
Art/Covers by Phil Sloan
Phil is an artist who has done work for IDW's War Of The Undead and Weird NJ. Not much is known of him as he strongly adheres to his survivalist beliefs. But what is known is that he loves spending time with his family and staying off the grid.
Colors (Ballad of the Two Headed Dog #2, #3, #4) by Marissa Louise
Marissa Louise has a terrifying tongue twister for a last name, you’ll never see it. Fortunately, her work is much nicer and you’ll see a lot of that. She is an illustrator turned colorist whose work has appeared in MCSWEENEY’S LUCKY PEACH, DARK HORSE PRESENTS, many indie books and various galleries in New York & Portland, OR. Follow her on twitter @marissadraws.
Colors (Dead Birds and Ballad of the Two Headed Dog #1) by David Halvorson
David Halvorson is an author/Illustrator who works under the pen name Marcus Emerson. He is the creator of Diary of a 6th Grade Ninja, Recess Warriors, and The Super Life of Ben Braver. He also worked with Eric as the primary artist of the space adventure, Planet Gigantic.
Story/Letters/Design by Eric Grissom
Eric Grissom is a writer whose comic works include GREGORY SUICIDE for Dark Horse comics, PLANET GIGANTIC, and ANIMALS. He resides in River Plaza, New Jersey with his wife and three kids. You can follow Eric on EricGrissom.com or on Twitter at @egrissom.
Who did that kick ass song in the video?
The first part of the video uses the song "Swallowed by Shame" by Daniel Birch and appears courtesy of the Free Music Archive.
The song that kicks in halfway through is "Chem Trails" by Spider Bags and appears courtesy of Dan McGee.  It's from the album "Frozen Letter" on Merge Records.  Go buy it.  It's fantastic.
People dig it!
"This rollicking conspiracy adventure glides along thanks to cryptic but genuinely absorbing mysteries balanced with clever characterization"  -Publisher's Weekly
“a hilarious page-turner full of action, adventure, and mystery.” -Lonnie Nadler, Bloody Disgusting
"this is one of those rare comic books that remind the reader of why it is they read comic books. They read them for incredible experiences like one found in Deadhorse." -Dustin Cabeal, Comic Bastards
“Deadhorse is a monster of a book stitched together from a heap of conspiracies, a pile of strange jokes and a trunk full of adventure stories. Always zagging when you think it’s zigging, Grissom and Sloan’s madcap journey through the Alaska that’s not on the map is a trip worth taking yourself.” -Christopher Sebela, Cold War
“One of the most impressive things about this series is the way all the disparate elements come together.” -Michelle White, Multiversity

campaign.story:
Full Circle is a dance production, four years in the making, that will be presented at Dance Place in D.C. on February 17th and 18th, 2018. Through the perspective of a young person of color trying to join a new and intriguing community, It addresses cycles of violence recurring throughout American history since Congress’ abolishment of slavery in 1865. The work is influenced by Chris Law's upbringing as a black man during hip hop's explosion in the 1990s and it features an innovative blend of modern dance and hip hop movement. The piece evolved as Chris and Ama Law both became frustrated with the volume of police brutality being reported in the news. 
   Full Circle allows audiences to explore issues that are affecting American citizens. It is our intent that this production empowers both the youth and adults in our community to feel welcome to share their views regarding our heavy social and political climate. We are encouraging dialogue that will lead to a better future.
Photo: C. Stanley
   The concert is performed in the round to pay homage to hip hop's practice of the "cypher". The cypher is a performance circle in which there is an exchange between and among performers and observers. Performers have a responsibility to jump in and dialogue through dance, spoken word and other expressions of artistic ability. Full Circle invites you into the cypher, building a community where we not only have fun, but stay present for the harsh realities as well.
Photo: C. Stanley
   We feel it is important to present at Dance Place because it lives in a diverse neighborhood where it has supported the Brookland/Edgewood area and it's surrounding community since 1986. Even as the city continues to grow, thrive and build new establishments, Dance Place has continued to reinvigorate itself, maintaining a mission to support the youth in the community through dance education and youth programing. It will be very inspirational and important to put art in front of young audiences and bridge this discussion between generations.
Photo: C. Stanley
   In the current climate of division, wouldn't it feel great to enter a place where we can convene together?

Click “Manage your pledge,” select “Change your pledge,” add the appropriate amount, and you’re done. We’ll connect with you after the campaign to collect design choice and size.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
DC has a diverse dance scene filled with innovative thinkers from many disciplines. Sometimes presenters do not place the hip hop genre at a high value in comparison to ballet or modern dance productions. Please help us contribute to the growth of our voice, the voices of these young artists and artists of color so that our local artists can feel inspired to continue working.

It's important to compensate the people who are working hard along with us to make this production happen. Your contributions will support our collaborators who have worked hard to create designs for this project. You will make it possible to support our performers who provide both physical and mental inspiration, continuing to fuel this creative process. Lastly, part of your contribution will go directly to Dance Place, our co-presenters for this production and an important local business that provides access to the arts for all.

We have already made efforts to fundraise through hosting classes and reaching out to community organizations, but with a budget of $10,000 we need your help to make this valuable project a success. We are a young married couple with a growing family and a mission to create a more inclusive future for our children! We NEED your help during this campaign for our production to thrive this upcoming February!

campaign.story:
What It Is
Harry Houdini and Arthur Conan Doyle used to be fast friends, visiting one another and writing letters back and forth, until their differing views on the afterlife set them against one another on stages and newspapers across the globe. Years after their breakup, the two continue to battle about spiritualism, the belief that the living can communicate with the dead. Doyle, creator of the great detective Sherlock Holmes, believes in ghosts, mediums, even photos of fairies. Houdini spends his time debunking the seances and the frauds who run them. The two are at war, two ideological armies whose battle of words is about to become a battle to the death for the very fate of humankind.
Houdini — with his wife Bess and an entourage that includes bodyguards, operatives, agents provocateur and the creepy, aspiring writer HP Lovecraft — heads off in pursuit of Doyle in search of answers after an attempt on his life by Spiritualists is ascribed to the man of letters. 
Sir Arthur and his wife Jean, in league with crooked medium Margery Crandon, demonologist Damascus Boring and infamous occult madman Aleister Crowley, are busy racing to hasten a coming invasion of the dead by opening the "Gates of Hell" that hold the veil between our world and the next.
As Houdini tries to stop Doyle from ushering in a spiritual and literal apocalypse, The Death Defying becomes a battle of wills, words, faith, science, fisticuffs, handguns and magic that stretches from the windswept menace of Stull, Kansas to the small apocalypse of Tungaska, Russia. Beliefs will be tested, lives will be threatened and the scariest specter of all is whether or not any of this is real.
This Kickstarter is to fund production and printing of The Death Defying #1, the first in a series of four 30-page issues. It's an historical occult adventure and it's only made possible via this Kickstarter campaign.
The First Six Pages
          The Rewards
The Death Defying #1! Available as either print or digital. Over 30 pages of comics plus backmatter including essay from Terry Tyson, mentalist and magician.
The Variant Cover! Available only as a print reward, the variant cover provided by Tyler Crook, artist of Petrograd, Harrow County, Bad Blood and cover artist for The Dark and Bloody. Some examples of how good he is--
 Enamel Pins! Exclusive set of 3 spooooky pins including the Spirit Altar, the Spirit Box and the Crystal Ball. Pick one or buy all 3.
T-Shirts! It's a t-shirt. We're only making them for this campaign.
Script Consultation! Christopher Sebela reads and gives you notes on a script of your choice. Single issues only, no OGNs please. Good for forever, don't need to have a script ready yet.
Cameo Appearance! Impress your friends by being drawn into the first issue and waving it around as you brag "Hey, that's me in this comic which takes place in 1925. Now you have to admit I'm cool." They will have no choice but to admit that you are, in fact, very cool.
Commission! A 9 x 12 commission by series artist Gavin Guidry for you. Simple backgrounds and single figures, original drawing will be sent to you, suitable for framing.
Can't decide what you want? Back at any level and add prices + shipping from The Menu to add on any extras. 
  The Creators
Eisner-nominated writer Christopher Sebela (High Crimes, Heartthrob, Short  Blue Beetle, Injustice Ground Zero, We(l)come Back, I Live in A Clown Motel)
Artist Gavin Guidry (The Night Driver, Heartthrob)
Colorist Marissa Louise (Spell on Wheels, Escape from New York, Mystery Girl, Fresh Romance)
Letterer Micah Meyers (The Disasters, The Night Driver, Mercy Sparx)
The Death Defying is a creator-owned book, with all ownership and profits split between all four members of the team and cover credits for all. We're making this book because we believe in it and we think people will like it.
The Money
We are looking to raise $8,000 minimum to pay artist Gavin Guidry, colorist Marissa Louise & letterer Micah Meyers for their work on the book. At this minimum amount, they are working at reduced rates and I am writing and running/fulfilling the campaign for free.
There are no unnecessary costs in the mix, this is the absolute cheapest we can make this issue while still paying everyone a proper rate for their work. Here is how the money breaks down, percentage wise:
Why one issue & not the whole thing at once?
Two reasons: 1) The team is assembled and eager to work and it's hard to get a team together and have momentum, so we'd like to follow that momentum and get started right now rather than wait a few months. 2) I don't want to get crushed on taxes. I already owe taxes on the Short Order Crooks campaign and adding the amount that this book would cost for all 4 issues would throw my already confusing finances into deeper peril. We'll be back in January to fund the remaining 3 issues in a single campaign. 
Stretch Goals
Any extra money raised will go towards paying contributors full page rates and possibly a page rate for myself. Once that level is exceeded, money will be rolled forward to production costs for Issue #2.
But if you go nuts and get us past 10K, we'll think of something special to do for you.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
All of us are experienced in our respective fields in comics. We've hit deadlines for all kinds of publishers on all sorts of timetables and we've worked on personal projects with similar swiftness and focus. We know what we're doing. We've got everything set on our end. Our goal is to complete production on the issue before the end of the year and have books sent out to backers before the end of January.

This is my third Kickstarter and I do my best to be fully transparent as far as where money goes and how it is spent, down to the nickel. So far I have delivered 3 out of the 5 issues of SHORT ORDER CROOKS and we are on schedule to finish and deliver the entirety of the book before the end of the year, 6 months from when the book was funded.

This being comics and life being life, a delay or two might possibly pop up, but updates and explanations will be quickly provided via Kickstarter as to any changes in delivery dates of issues and/or rewards.

campaign.story:
We thought hard about the different stretch goals we could add and, in the end, thought what could be better than more comics centered around our central theme - raising awareness for the topics chosen by the creators!! Check out what, with your help, we can add to the entire book!
The 4th Monkey is a comic book anthology featuring stories to raise awareness about environmental and social issues. Brought to life by 20+ comic book creators, each team will be creating a story about something that is near and dear to their hearts... or just something that's been bothering them. The 100 page book will feature 8 short stories revolving around the following topics: Online Bullying. Poaching. Political Polarization. Mental Abuse. Ocean Pollution. Pesticides. Alcoholism. Suicide.
There are A LOT of problems in the world, and we can’t possibly tackle them all. The 4th Monkey is our attempt to do something about the ones pulled right out of the hearts of the contributing creators. Sure, you may feel stronger about some than you do others, but the quickest way to someone’s heart is through story. So, if you finish this book with even the slightest thirst for more knowledge, or were simply entertained, then I like to think that we did our job.
Myself and Co-Creator/Writer, Daniel Farrand, have personally funded much of the artwork you'll see on this page in order to bring you the best possible preview to the anthology and to show how dedicated we are to making this book a reality. With this Kickstarter we're looking to fund the completion of the artwork and a print run in order to get the book into the hands of backers and fellow creators.
Cover Art by Jose Johann Jaro - Logo by Kenneth Matthews
 
But... The 4th Monkey? What does that even mean?
Playing on the 3 Mystic Monkeys proverb, “See No Evil - Hear No Evil - Speak No Evil”, The 4th Monkey is one who is not blinded. It is aware and wants the world to take notice, before it's too late.
***The "yes, we know all primates aren't monkeys" disclaimer***
When the 3 Wise Monkeys proverb originated, there was no distinction between apes and monkeys - hence much of the past (and current) artwork done as chimps. Scroll down further - we even have gorillas!
We need to all come together... right now... over this Abbey Road inspired pin-up by Salomon Farias!
 
THE STORIES!
Due to the heavy subject matter of some of the stories, the tones range from serious, to sad, and even funny. There's action, drama, hijinks, and even super heroes. We're hoping that every story locks you in and takes you for a completely different ride from the next.

Now, without further ado, here's a 1 page preview from each of the current stories featured in The 4th Monkey. Every story is lettered by the great and powerul HDE.

New Limited Commission Rewards Added!
Sooo the artists working on this project are AMAZING! After speaking to most of the creators during our first week here on Kickstarter we've gotten an overwhelming response from the artists involved. Many of them want to donate a "Commission Reward" to the project!
So, with the below artists all able to do ONE physical commission each to help support the project and push us closer to our goal (aside from Ed Jimenez who will be doing 5 digital headshots - so get ready to upgrade your online avatar!) we're able to offer YOU commission rewards from these amazing artists at a VERY reduced rate.

We are asking for $7,500 in order to fund the completion of the artwork and a print run to get copies of the anthology into the hands of backers and the featured creators.
