campaign.story:
STRETCH GOAL: $7000  
This will allow us to double our print run (1000 copies) as well as include a free Dream Crasher bookmark with every physical reward. We are also open to any ideas you might have for extras we could include. Just send an email to stealingfirecomics@gmail.com.
This Project  
We are collecting the first four chapters of Dream Crasher into a single printed 130+ page Volume One. After successfully Kickstarting the print edition of Chapter 1 in March 2016, we went on to self-funded small print runs of Chapters 2 & 3. We will be digitally releasing Chapter 4 with this Kickstarter and later on comiXology. With Chapter 4, our story completes the first of three major arcs. In addition we are including the digital edition of Chapter 5 with every reward tier, which will be released this coming winter.
Dream Crasher is a story about survival and creating a new world from the ashes of the old. It was also inspired by a very real experience of grief. Beneath its dystopian exterior, Dream Crasher is about finding the last bit of light in a world that's gone dark and protecting it with every fiber of our being. Even when the powers that be are stacked against us. Even when the cause seems hopeless.
Dream Crasher Volume One [Not Final Cover]
The Story
Following a bizarre cataclysmic event, a group of children struggle to survive in the world filled with angry ghosts, beasts made from human parts, and interdimensional parasites.
Excerpt from #4: Dearest, the Shadows
Our story opens with Amalie: a girl who lives alone with a strange beast she calls Creature. She doesn't know what Creature is or where he came from, but she knows that he has her Papa's eyes. The two have been working together since The Long Winter started, but everything changes one day when Creature brings home something that Amalie hasn't seen in a long time: a living human boy.
Excerpt from #1: Creature's Keeper
Praise for Dream Crasher:
"Like a nightmare dipped in a candy shell"
- Ben Beaury, GeeksOUT
“Dream Crasher is a truly unique piece of art.”
- Comicbooked.com
“The start of a fascinating new horror series.”
- PlayNicePlayNow (PN2)
“When it comes down to the action sequences… there’s truly no bounds to Olsen’s work.”
- For the Love of Indie
Excerpt from #2: The Land Vomits Ghosts
Primary Rewards
Primary Reward Tiers
*Signed Copies are price higher primarily due to the fact that Daniel and Reed live on opposite sides of the country (Brooklyn and Seattle, respectively). It's a little bit tricky to coordinate and usually means shipping those signed books twice.
--
Convention Exclusives: You need to find our table at Rose City Comic Con or Baltimore Comic Con in order to collect the full reward for this. Just show us your confirmation email.
Convention Exclusive Rewards
Unique Proofs and Original Art Rewards: As these are all unique, there is only one available for each reward level. All original artwork can be signed upon request. See below for details on the original painting commissions.
Unique Rewards - Proofs & Original Art
FOR ORIGINAL PAINTING COMMISSIONS - There is no limit on the number of backers. Commissions can be any size up to 11x17 on heavy weight paper. Your choice of Watercolor, Acrylic, or simply pen and ink. Any questions, just message us: stealingfirecomics@gmail.com.
For a large scale preview of the posters and original art, please scroll down to the Posters & Original Art section.
Our Story:
We (Daniel and Reed) have been friends since High School, and first had the idea to make Dream Crasher back in 2010. It took years of careful planning and perseverance to complete the first chapter, which was published digitally in June 2015. Despite numerous personal and creative setbacks along the way, we have created something we are incredibly proud of. We have been sharing our story with the world one convention at a time. This next step will allow us to enter the graphic novel market while we continue publishing 2 chapters a year until we're finished.
Reed and Dan at Saratoga Comic Con
In My Own Words: Daniel
In the summer of 2011, Reed and I were on track for releasing Chapter 1 in early 2012. The first chapter was drawn and painted and the second chapter had been started. We still hadn’t thought about lettering, logos, or print budgets - but we had momentum. Then everything came to a screeching halt when my boyfriend died.  
The unexpected trauma, the weight of the grief, and the subsequent depression and healing all took their toll in various ways. It was more than 6 months before I was able to return to the project again, and it would be another year before I finished the next chapter. This was in no small part because I gained a whole new perspective on what I was making happen to Amalie.   I was following Kurt Vonnegut’s sixth rule to a T. I was being a sadist and making awful things happen to my main character, but I hadn’t given a second thought to how it was affecting her. I hadn’t thought about how she processed the world around her, or who she was because of it. Through my own grief, I understood her on a whole new level. In many ways, Amalie is a representation of how strong I wish I could be. She’s a survivor, but she makes it look easier than I know it to be.
Dan working on the Chapter 1 Lettering
 While Dream Crasher is a bleak dystopian tale on it's surface, I began to think of this new world less like a graveyard and more like fertile soil. It’s not a story about the world that’s been destroyed. It’s about the new world taking root in its place. It’s about the children who have an opportunity to shape it. Beyond the horror of the present, there is hope. There is a future worth fighting for.  
Ultimately Reed and I made the decision to completely redo the artwork for Chapter 1. It set us even further back, but I can confidently say that we have a better comic because of it. Reed’s patience, understanding, and empathy throughout this project has been instrumental in my sticking with it. There were plenty of opportunities to give up quietly and walk away, and yet we stuck with it. I can’t thank him enough for that. We’re still pushing on, and I believe now more than ever we will see it through to the end.  
Excerpt from #4: Dearest, the Shadows
In My Own Words: Reed  The Dream Crasher story, and Chapter 1 in particular for me, personally represent that relentless monastic fortitude that I have continuously needed to be happy and achieve what I have so far in my life. It is about recognizing the excuses for not drawing after a long day of biking to work and packing CSA boxes with your best friend, but knowing that an excuse does not ink a page, and that I can always sleep later. I hope you enjoy what we have here, it is just the tip of one colossal nightmarish iceberg.
Reed working on the Chapter 1 Prototype
 Our Budget
Goal: $4500
This will cover a full print run of 500 copies plus the production costs of making the book (lettering the fourth chapter,* book design, copyediting, and commissioning original art) and shipping rewards to our backers.
*Lettering costs for Chapter 1-3 were covered by our first Kickstarter.
Creature tours the New York City subway.
Stretch Goal: $7000
This will allow us to double our print run (1000 copies) as well as include a free Dream Crasher bookmark with every physical reward.
We will unveil further stretch goals upon making this one, but the possibilities include: funding the production of Volume 2, original sketch cards for backers $35 and higher, Stealing Fire t-shirts, and even a hardcover edition. We may even ask you (backers and potential backers) what you would most like to see. But in the meantime we'll try not to get too far ahead of ourselves.
Excerpt from #3 Welcome Home

Stealing Fire Comics
Stealing Fire Comics
Stealing Fire is a name derived from the myth of Prometheus and his act of bringing fire to humankind. It is a metaphor for taking what is needed but not given; for challenging the power dynamics of our present and envisioning new ways forward. It's about eating from the tree of knowledge even though it is forbidden; accepting that banishment from paradise is more honorable than ignorance. We're writing with pictures and drawing with words to rattle the cage of a complacent world.
The imprint Stealing Fire Comics was created to launch Dream Crasher in 2015. It was always intended to be a vehicle for multiple creative endeavors, and 2018 will be a year for such things. The first of these was Soulless Golem (Stealing Fire #1), which is available now in our gumroad store. 
Excerpt from Soulless Golem
Souless Golem is the first of an annual zine series (Stealing Fire #1, if you will). The Soulless Golem drawings began after white supremacist Richard Spencer gave a speech likening non white humans to soulless golems. Drawing on Judaic mysticism and witchcraft, as means of us collectively conjuring a force (golem in this case) to fight back against oppression. The drawings are in direct respond to the Trump administration and the rise of hate as mainstream.

Risks and challenges
This is our second Kickstarter. All of the artwork has been completed for the story. All that's left to be done is the book design itself, which we already have scheduled.

We are doing a print run of 500 (1000 if we hit our stretch goal). By doing a small print run we are able to work within a more reasonable budget, but run the risk of the full amount being a bit small after rewards are distributed.

We are also shipping heavier books this year. We have less rewards than last time, so the process should be a lot simpler after we send the surveys out. Getting everything packaged and weather proofed while being economical can be a challenge in itself, but we are prepared and already have most of the materials.

Although the book is longer, the parts are almost the same as our last Kickstarter, and we were successful. There are stil plenty of challenges, but we have a road map and past experience to guide us.

This is just a quick update to let you all know that:
All physical rewards have shipped. 
All digital rewards have been sent out - with the exception of those of you getting a digital copy of Chapter 5 - that will be out in December.
If your copy does not arrive in the next few weeks, please send an email to and we will get a new copy in the mail.

Dear All,
Here's a west coast update from Reed:
This past weekend I tabled a small press expo at the Fantagraphics Bookstore in Georgetown, Seattle. The free drinks, music, grilling, and a very real heat wave made for an eventful day. I tabled with My buddy D.W. whom I met last year at this event. It was a great way to celebrate our friend anniversary. This was also the first comic event where I brought everything via bicycle. Weather depending, it is my goal to cycle to Jet City Comic Con in Tacoma this Fall.

...and that means your rewards will be gathered, packaged, and sent within the next few weeks. The first batch will go to Seattle, where Reed will sign a whole bunch, and then ship them to New York. I'm already gathering the surveys and figuring out the packaging and posting. If you haven't filled out the survey yet... now is your last chance.
This process has taken longer than anticipated, and so I'd like to thank each one of you for your continued patience. The extra time we took was spent getting Dream Crasher Volume One to be the best we could possibly make it. The book will include a beautiful design by Sean Sass, a wonderful Forward written by the talented , and an Afterward that tells the origin of Amalie's name. There were a lot of unplanned setbacks and learning experiences in putting it all together, but the book came out better for it. I can't wait for you all to have them.

Dear All,                                                                                                                                Many seasons have passed through these correspondents. As Spring arrives, it feels like a holiday in my corner of Seattle. All the good things seem to often come a once. Much like riding up a mountain, I am feeling the joy of delayed gratification. I am holding a demo copy of DC Vol One in my hands. 
   Feeling the mass of this book in my palms us like a deep exhale. We are running through it to catch any last minute adjustments. Daniels has been doing most of the work.  We are so close to shipping rewards time. Thank you all for sticking it through with us. Assembling this book has been a mountain of work. I would like to take this moment to deeply thank and congratulate our book designer and my friend, Sean Sass. He has been so patient with us at making all the changes needed. This book looks SO good!!! Along with the book Daniel's friend made a kick-ass Dream Crasher engraving which makes us look so pro!

campaign.story:
Far in the future, in 3084… Years of intergalactic war have ravaged the starscape…
But peace has finally come. The inhabitants of distant planets and moons are finally free to roam the stars again. Only one destination location in the galaxy still stands...
Welcome to THE STRIP!
THE STRIP is a futuristic travel mag, full of speculative stories of “The Vegas that Was or Could Be!” Intergalactic travelers flock to the ruins of the once-great VEGAS to learn about the ancient culture that lived there, and each story is a special stop on the tour that re-imagines the original city of sin. The tour guides “educated guesses” are a real hoot, and each story is a flashback or historical re-enactment. Part drunk history, part whacked out re-interpretation to please the alien rocket-set.
THE STRIP, A Twisted Vegas Anthology, will be a collection of 100+ pages of weird and warped comics, inspired by the original city of sin, Las Vegas! It is the sixth entry in the Red Stylo Presents anthology series.
Last year, we hit the jackpot with the Harvey Award-nominated The 27 Club. As a follow-up, we’re letting it ride with The Strip! Strange tales from Las Vegas are the theme, in the form of 8-page comics.  Creators were asked to draw inspiration from the music, mob, casinos, luck–whatever visions Vegas conjured for them!
#VegasTwisted
Once betting closed, we emerged with eleven short stories that painted a wonderfully warped vision of Las Vegas.  The pieces inspired us to turn THE STRIP into a trippy travelogue filled with "What ifs?" and "WTFs?!"  Stops along the way include stages where magic is more than an illusion, a slightly off-kilter vision of the future, and the deserts around Vegas where something hungry lurks.  The book will be a full-color trade paperback and deluxe digital package. Even tourists from off-planet are flocking to our casinos, so we hope you'll join us on this strange ride!
  James McGee, editor/heart-throb behind The Strip
The Strip marks James McGee's first time behind the editor's desk for the Red Stylo Presents anthology series.  James joined Red Stylo as the writer of "Star Crossed" in the Shakespeare Shaken anthology.  He went on to stage a hostile takeover under the guise of  the evil "Snidley McGee." These days, his alter egos are kinder and gentler, but still snappy dressers. His work has also appeared in Unfashioned Creatures, The 27 Club, This Mutant Life and Fireside Fiction.  James lives in West Virginia with his wife, Laura, and an ever-growing army of cats.

Risks and challenges
Making comics is always a gamble, so we're asking you to roll the dice on THE STRIP! The $5000 we’re raising goes toward the actual cost of printing and shipping the book, as well as fulfilling rewards..

Production on THE STRIP is well underway, and will conclude in August. Red Stylo has a proven track record of delivering comic anthologies (just check out our back-catalog!), and we have collaborated with this printer in the past. The quality of their product is OUTSTANDING, and the print order will be placed within days of funding.

While our print order is being run, Red Stylo’s team will prep rewards for shipping, including individual stories and PDFs. Our goal amount covers the cost of printing and shipping books to Red Stylo's warehouse only, but we have chosen rewards and shipping options within our regular production budget for an anthology and the cost of these items has been considered and accounted for.

All rewards will be delivered in November 2017, which makes this book a phenomenal gift idea for the holidays.

This is Red Stylo's sixth anthology, and we have an experienced production team. All of our cards are on the table, and we're convinced we have a winning hand!

The release party for THE STRIP will be held at New York Comic Con in October, where it will be Red Stylo’s featured title.

updates.update_userinfo: Love to Vegas + Status of The Strip
updates.update_content:
It is hard to find the words.
Shortly after hearing the news of the horrendous attack in Las Vegas, Red Stylo released a short statement. Since that time, we have been radio-silent on all things THE STRIP. Enrica and I started planning this anthology over a year ago, and the goal has always been to debut the book this weekend at New York Comic Con. There is obviously no way we could have predicted this tragedy, but the reality remains: how do you promote and sell a Vegas-inspired book in the wake of such horror? We have spent the past few days gathering our thoughts, and deciding how to proceed.

updates.update_userinfo: Statement regarding "Treat Me Mean and Cruel"
updates.update_content:
Aaaaand breathe!
We made it! Thank you all again for your pledges and support over this crazy month. There were some low times and uncertainty along the way, but everyone—from you, to the creators, to editorial—put it all on the line and made this a reality.

This is our final updated before the campaign ends.  It is also update 21!  How apropos! We look to be standing tall, but anything can happen in the final minutes of our campaign.  That's why we are going to keep fighting until the final bell! 
How's that for a transition into our very last story sneak peek?  "The Champ" by Scott Bachmann and Matthew Sparks rounds out our twisted lineup.  You can view this and all of our videos in our Facebook playlist.

Three hours left!  We have met our goal and are looking good, but anything could still happen.  Let you're friends and family know this is their last chance to pre-order copies of The Strip!
Obviously, we want you to grab the entire anthology, filled with 11 Vegas Twisted tales.  But if a particular story tickles your fancy, you can grab it individually for just $2.  Check out all of the story previews in our Facebook playlist, and take a look below as we spotlight "Fold" by David Booher, Pedro Mendes and Sara King.

updates.update_userinfo: The End Is Nigh! Check out "Fold"
updates.update_content:
So, did you hear? The Strip is fully funded!!!!  All of you are amazing, and we cannot thank you enough for the love you continue showing Red Stylo Media.
But we can't go to the pay window just yet!  The campaign runs until 2:00pm today, and we have to let it ride until then.  The bad news is that some backers could still cancel their pledges, or there could be problems with payment--it happens.  So, the more we earn between now and then, the easier we will breathe if there is a funding issue.

updates.update_userinfo: Fully funded! But we keep rolling with "The Forgotten Dead"
updates.update_content:
Whoa! Less than $200 left. You guys are going “all in” for the final hours, and we cannot thank you enough. But we ARE down to the final hours, and not quite there yet, so make sure to keep banging the drum to get the word out about this campaign!
It takes a lot of people to make a comic happen.  We have picked up a few new names since the campaign launched, bringing the total creators to over twenty!  So, I wanted to give them a special shout-out here.

campaign.story:
*NOTE* You can ADD ON to any reward that doesn't have this already:
8PAGECOMICS DIGITAL SUBSCRIPTION + $8
Launching December (a $16 value). Be part of the first wave! Creator owned, familiar names plus new talent! Just increase your reward by $8. You will get a confirmation in your survey.
Before I started writing POISON IVY, RED SONJA, WONDER WOMAN and other characters for publishers like DC and Marvel, there was GIRLS NIGHT OUT, three issues of multi-genre short stories I self-published.  This is a project to remaster and collect them in trade paperback format, with a minimum of 100 (one hundred!) beautiful color pages. 
Stories include:
by Craig Yeung, colors Juri H-C
GIRLS NIGHT OUT with Craig Yeung (Runaways, Green Arrow), colors Juri H-C.  The relationship between two women - Jackie, an employee of a nursing home and Rosie, a resident with dementia. 
CAPTAIN, MY CAPTAIN with Eisner award winning artist Janet Lee (Return of the Dapper Men) A mutiny in space goes awry.
SAVING ABBY with Cabbral My very first story ever! In a future where the world is vegan by necessity, New York City is a dangerous slum, and taxi drivers are also mercenaries...
art by Sean Von Gorman
BIG CITY with Sean Von Gorman (Toe Tag Riot, Pawn Shop) A story in tweets, with new pages!
pencils by Larry Hama, inks by Craig Yeung, colors by Trish Mulvihill
THE DATE with Larry Hama (GI Joe, Wolverine) colors by Eisner award winning Trish Mulvihill (100 Bullets, Batman, Wonder Woman) - A young man frantically rushes to meet his date.
Written for a wide audience so there's no language, nudity, or gore. You won't find these stories anywhere else. 
THIS IS A LIMITED EDITION RUN (no more than 500- each copy will be numbered and signed) so don't miss out!
This interview with Comics Beat gives a good overview of the content and process of Girls Night Out from my last kickstarter http://www.comicsbeat.com/amy-chu-kickstarts-a-third-volume-of-girls-night-out-interview/
 And here are some of the rewards:
ULTIMATE RED SONJA PACK: BLOODY RED SONJA POP!
"You’ve never read a Sonja tale like this! Chu has crafted a saga for the ages. I cannot get enough of this Red Sonja. Overall grade: A+" - SciFiPulse
  LOUIE CHIN THORS SKETCH COVER!
Rad sketch cover by my friend Louie. Check out his other work here-
  I LOVE COFFEE GIFT PACK! 
$65 bundle includes the book, my favorite coffee, plus swag!:
Death Wish Coffeeee!!
  ULTIMATE KISS FAN GIFT PACK
All ten (10) issues of my KISS run with the limited double signed Sean Von Gorman variant #1, a set of the NYCC limited edition Goni Montes collectible cards, and the GIRLS NIGHT OUT GOLD EDITION book + PDF! 
"Amy is doing stuff no KISS comic has done before and it’s amazing because of that." "fun and entertaining" "accessible by everyone, Kiss fan or not" - Outright Geekery 
"Happily impressed" - Geeks of Doom
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Like most creatives in the comics business I'm a freelancer, and lucky to have enough work to be employed full time. However that can change at any moment, which may have the effect of either speeding up or slowing down this project. If either of these situations occur, you'll all get an update. Timely fulfillment is one of the biggest challenges of any kickstarter, but this ain't my first rodeo. I've successfully run many projects in the past, so even in this chaotic world, you will get your book if it kills me! Most of the book is already done- it's just a question of how nitpicky I want to get in the editing and relettering process.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

I'm writing to you from a very unglamorous hotel room in Pittsburgh where I'm a guest at the decidedly unglamorous 3 Rivers Comic Con. I mean this as a compliment- too many cons these days are $100 affairs all about celebrities, pop culture and nothing to do with comics. This show is put up by an actual comic book store featuring - gasp!- real comics and comic book creators. One of them is the incredibly nice Bill Messner-Loebs, who I just commissioned to do a Dejah Thoris sketch cover. campaign.story:
PLAY

Holocaust survivor Asriel Strip used his brother’s diary to make an incredible connection to his family’s history of escaping Nazi persecution. Watch this video to learn about the importance of preserving diaries, the focus of the Museum’s first-ever Kickstarter campaign. 
We’re thrilled by the response to this Kickstarter campaign to raise funds for cataloging and digitizing over 200 Holocaust diaries and translating and transcribing three of them. 
After reaching our $250,000 goal we’re excited to announce a new stretch goal: An additional $50,000 to translate and transcribe 10 more diaries. Back this project today to help Save Their Stories!
PLAY

This is no ordinary map.
US Holocaust Memorial Collection, gift of the family of Joseph Strip
It’s a deeply personal illustration of one family’s harrowing escape and survival during the Holocaust. It’s included in a diary—one of over 200 diaries the United States Holocaust Memorial Museum has in its collections waiting to be cataloged, translated and published online.  
We’re in a race against time to do this specialized, expensive and time-consuming work, and we urgently need your help.  
We know first-person accounts are powerful. Most people are familiar with the diary of Anne Frank, and her personal account is often the first introduction that many have to the devastating history of the Holocaust. But it’s not the only diary of its kind.  
Each of the diaries in our collection has an important story to tell, of suffering and strength, persecution and perseverance. Written by people young and old, from diverse backgrounds and countries, they bring to life a broad spectrum of individuals’ experiences during the Holocaust. Now, in the face of growing Holocaust denial, we must bring more stories to light before we lose the firsthand memories of survivors and witnesses who can shed light on the context of these diaries and other priceless artifacts in the Museum’s collection.  
As the survivor generation passes, it is our responsibility to make sure their voices live on so that their experiences will not be forgotten. You can be a part of preserving history: Back this project and Save Their Stories.
For this project, we'll catalog, preserve, and make available online over 200 Holocaust diaries in the Museum’s collection -- for the first time ever. The handwritten pages and notes are in 17 different languages and will need to be transcribed and translated into English. While we would love to raise enough funds to complete the translation of every diary, reaching our project goal will enable us to translate into English three diaries written by Jewish refugees who fled their homes to escape the Holocaust:  
The diary of Joseph Strip, a young boy who wrote about his family’s harrowing experience over the grid-lined pages of his math notebook. 
The papers of Lucien Dreyfus, a journalist and schoolteacher from Strasbourg, France, who was deported to Auschwitz in 1943. His collection includes letters to his daughter, son-in-law, and granddaughter who escaped to the United States in 1942.
The diary of Hans Vogel, who fled Paris with his family while his father was interned, which contains hand-drawn and colored maps of their journey. 
Each of these three diaries will be published in its entirety online so that people everywhere can view the original pages and read the translations. Like Anne Frank’s personal record, these stories expose the truth of Holocaust history -- so that ever more researchers, authors, teachers, students can learn from them and help fulfill the promise of Never Again. 
Here is our estimated timeline for this project:  
Summer/Fall 2018: Cataloging complete for all 200+ diaries 
Winter 2018: Digitization complete for all 200+ diaries 
Spring 2019: Collections for all 200+ diaries published online at ushmm.org  
Summer 2019: Translations and transcriptions for 3 feature diaries added to ushmm.org collections listings
The Museum has collected millions of pages of historic documents containing details on the individual experiences of Holocaust victims and survivors. Although we are committed to making our entire collection available online, the sheer size of it makes this a lengthy, expensive project. 
Each additional first-person account or piece of evidence made available on the Museum’s website--which is visited by millions of people every year--has the potential to reveal a new aspect of Holocaust history or highlight its relevance to the world today.
These three are just some of the many accounts we hope to bring to the public:  
Joseph Strip (formerly “Stripounsky”)
US Holocaust Memorial Museum Collection, gift of the family of Joseph Strip
Joseph Stripounsky awoke early on the morning of May 10, 1940, to the sounds of aircraft and gunfire. The Germans had invaded his town of Antwerp, Belgium. He was just 17.  
Joseph fled with his parents and younger brother, leaving almost everything they owned behind. He carried with him a math textbook and two math notebooks, one of which became his diary.  
They joined thousands of others heading south through France, making a slow and arduous journey with very little food or money. In France, they spent a year trying to get farther away from the ever-encroaching Nazis. They managed to secure American visas through Joseph’s father’s employer and finally landed in New York in May 1941—just six weeks before Joseph’s 18th birthday, when he would have been legally required to stay in France.  
Joseph tells the story of his family’s harrowing exodus through everyday details and extraordinary sketches.
Lucien Dreyfus
US Holocaust Memorial Museum, Gift of Monique Allen
Lucien Dreyfus was a dedicated journalist and professor of modern languages in Strasbourg, France. In 1940, anti-Jewish legislation was passed in France, and he was dismissed from his teaching position because of his faith. 
As persecution against Jews intensified, he fled his town and sought safety in southern France. Refuge did not last long. In October 1943, he and his wife were arrested and just one month later, they were deported to Auschwitz and murdered. 
Lucien had kept a diary since 1925, but his writing became more frequent during World War II, recording the realities of day-to-day life, the experiences of his students, and what he knew about Jewish persecution in other parts of Europe. 
His diaries also contain deeply personal messages he wrote to his daughter, son-in-law, and granddaughter who were able to escape France in 1942 and eventually made it to the United States. Lucien knew he might never see them again, but continued to write with the hope that they would receive his diaries. Miraculously, they did years later. 
Hans Vogel
US Holocaust Memorial Museum Collection, gift of Eva Vogel
At the age of seven, Hans Yakov Vogel fled Germany with his parents and elder brother in 1936, settling in Paris where they remained until the outbreak of war. His father was separated from the family and interned by the French as an enemy alien at Lisieux, and later at Gurs in the south of France. In May 1940, just 24 hours before the invading German forces reached Paris, the rest of the Vogel family fled south. They traveled among a stream of other refugees, mostly by foot, as the Luftwaffe shot machine guns at them.  
Through the help of friends, the Vogels were reunited and settled in Oloron-Sainte-Marie in the unoccupied zone near the Spanish border. They remained there from June 1940 until April 1941, when they received papers from the United States Consulate allowing them to immigrate. They arrived in New York via Lisbon on the steamer Nyassa in August 1941. Two years later, Hans Vogel died at the age of 16 from an illness.  
Hans kept an extraordinary diary of their flight, including photos and hand-drawn and colored maps tracing the family's journey from Germany through France and eventual immigration to the United States.
Your pledge doesn’t just get you access to behind-the-scenes updates on the work (and often the discoveries made) during the process of cataloging, translating, and publishing these stories. We're also offering fantastic rewards, exclusive to this Kickstarter project. Backers can receive rewards such as a "Save Their Stories" tote bag, limited edition watercolor prints from Holocaust survivor Simon Jeruchim, a "Save Their Stories" journal, exclusive behind-the-scenes tours at the Museum and its collection and conservation center (not open to the public), and much more.  
Jeruchim Watercolor Print
Your pledge is tax deductible! The amount of your contribution that is deductible for federal income tax purposes is limited to the difference between your pledge minus the fair market value of the reward. If our project is completed and the goal is met, you will be asked to fill out a survey so that we can send you your reward. USHMM is unable to recognize your gift unless the informational survey is completed.  
Please allow an additional 4–6 weeks for your reward to ship internationally. Note: we are not responsible for international custom fees.  
Some of the rewards are experiences (tours, events, lectures) offered at a specific time and place. USHMM is not responsible for any backer’s travel or costs to participate in such experiences. Further, if a cause beyond USHMM’s control requires rescheduling or cancellation of an experience, USHMM is not responsible for any additional travel or costs a backer may incur in order to participate at the new time. USHMM cannot guarantee that experiences occurring on dates yet to be announced, or that must be rescheduled, will occur on a date that is convenient for all backers.  
A living memorial to the Holocaust, the United States Holocaust Memorial Museum is located on the National Mall in Washington, DC, and inspires citizens and leaders worldwide to confront hatred, prevent genocide, and promote human dignity.  
Since its dedication in 1993, the Museum has welcomed more than 41 million visitors, including 99 heads of state and more than ten million school-age children. Its website, the world’s leading online authority on the Holocaust, is available in 16 languages and was visited in 2016 by more than 19 million people.  
All photos unless otherwise noted: US Holocaust Memorial Museum
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Challenges: No matter the outcome of this Kickstarter project, the United States Holocaust Memorial Museum will remain committed to its mission of rescuing Holocaust evidence, confronting hatred, and preventing genocide.

And, the Museum will continue to work to find funding for Save Their Stories—but the more than 200 diaries featured in this project will not be made accessible until the financing is secured. Without Kickstarter funding, there is no immediate date for being able to do this work and bring these first-person testimonies to light for students, teachers, scholars, and those wanting to learn more about the Holocaust and preserve the memory of its victims and survivors.

Risks concerning rewards: As always with manufacturing a product, it’s possible to come across production delays. We are confident that with successful funding, the Museum will be able to deliver our tangible and experiential rewards within the times stated for each. However, our rewards that feature live events are subject to change, given availability and circumstances outside of our control.

Should any changes be made to availability of rewards and events, the Museum will communicate these to backers as soon as possible.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Reflections on final stages of the Kickstarter campaign
updates.update_content:
Dear backers,
Thanks to your support through our Save Their Stories campaign, the United States Holocaust Memorial Museum continues to make great progress since launching this campaign two years ago. To date, we’ve cataloged, digitized, and made available 207 collections with diaries that were written by Holocaust victims, survivors, and witnesses, and more are being processed. To view these diaries, search “Kickstarter” in the Museum’s Collections search.
As the project’s processing archivist, I'm responsible for managing and cataloging each diary collection. Assessing the diaries, I have been struck by the variety of their content, even beyond the fact that they are written in 17 languages by people of all ages. Some writers made daily entries. Others kept lists, recorded recipes, or wrote poems. Some diarists were very visual, including drawings, maps, photographs, and newspaper clippings.

We are so grateful to all 5,610 of you for your incredible support of our first-ever Kickstarter campaign. Thanks to you, over 200 diaries of Holocaust victims and survivors will be catalogued, digitized, and shared with the world—and over a dozen of them will be fully transcribed and translated.

So close to the stretch goal 
As backers of our project, you have already ensured that the memories of over 200 Holocaust survivors will be preserved and shared for generations to come. Thank you so very much. Now we are just under $5,000 away from our stretch goal of $50,000 more. There are just 35 hours left to meet this new goal so we can transcribe and translate another 10 diaries, including those of Ruth Mueller and Inge Fischer Engel - more about them below!

Goat courtesy of Kelly Williams
THE BOOK
This Nightmare Kills Fascists is a 176-page black and white horror comics anthology filled with stories reflecting on the state of international politics in 2017. Editors Matt Miner and Eric Palicki envisioned a collection of stories giving contributors a chance to interpret the unease surrounding the current state of the world through the dark lens of horror.
And we asked some of our talented friends to come and play in our sandbox.
Ben Bishop's Cover Art for THIS NIGHTMARE KILLS FASCISTS
    THE BOOK IS FUNDED! 
We are now rolling out stretch goals, including digital comics bundles featuring additional creator-owned work from the TNKF contributors!
Stretch Goals Announced!

Example art by Michael Wernke.

All script review packages include a standard softcover copy of This Nightmare Kills Fascists. Limited quantities are available.
Donors at this level will have their comics script of up to 24 sequential pages reviewed by their choice of writers Matt Miner, Eric Palicki, Katy Rex, Forrest Helvie, Ryan Ferrier or Erica Schultz, subject to availability.
The reviewer will join you for a 30 minute Skype call to discuss your project.
Have a comics script reviewed by Erica Schultz, Ryan Ferrier, Matt Miner, Katy Rex, Forrest Helvie, or this idiot on the right.
THE ADD-ONS
Want to add a la carte books, stickers or the digital production diary to your pledge? Adjust your pledge by the amount specified in the table below and send me a message so I can add a backer note. 
Please, the ADDITIONAL BOOK add-ons are for those already pledging to a reward tier that includes the physical book ($25 and above).
Any extra shipping costs are factored into the amounts. 
THE FUNDING
Most of the funds will be set aside to cover production costs and shipping. However, a small portion of the funding goal is intended to provide a substantially reduced page rate to the creators who've decided to join Matt and me on this crazy campaign. Stretch goals are coming and are designed to help us give something more both to you, our generous donors, and to the writers and artists who've come aboard to help us realize this...er, this nightmare.
THE THANK YOU
Thanks to The Gothsicles for use of their song "Unbekannt in Deutschland" in our campaign video. Lean more about the new album at this link.
And, if you've read this far, thank you for considering a pledge to help make this nightmare a reality.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The greatest challenge when assembling an anthology is collecting work on time from the creators, especially when many of them are contributing their work to this project at a significantly reduced page rate and have to juggle this alongside their better paying jobs in order to keep the lights on. In order to mitigate the risk of late or missing stories, we've given the contributors ample lead time to deliver their work. We hope to deliver the book ahead of schedule, but our campaign is designed with a long lead to keep from shipping the books late.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
This was not their future. 
The GOLGOTHA mission planned to mark mankind's first colonization of another world. They expected to wake up from cryosleep to find a place untouched by civilization. 
A crash-landing revealed the truth: While they slept, mankind advanced, and the second colonial mission arrived before they did. 
The surviving crew of the Golgotha, and its single military member, Cpt. Michael Lawton, were now relics of the past...in a future that had no need for them.
     THE CREATIVE TEAM

updates.update_content:
Hey all,
Thanks to all of you for backing this project, means a lot. I wrote this up on my Facebook feed https://www.facebook.com/Selfloathingnarcissist but here is a nice teaser about the story itself:
How would you like to leave everything behind and start over on a new world? Make that mental leap and resolve yourself that everyone you knew on earth would be dead by the time you arrived? You're excited for this new chance and the opportunity to help shape this new world. 88 years in cryosleep you arrive to discover that faster transit was engineered a year after you left and an entire colony already exists that's been here for thirty years...and they have no need for you and don't even want you here. And the grandson you never knew runs the colony and he hates you. This is Michael Lawton's story. Welcome to Golgotha.

campaign.story:
Float is an autobiography and it’s also a tragic love story about anxiety.
Sneak Peek Preview of the Soundtrack just added:
Float Title Song by Victor Guest.
Thank you everyone! We have crossed $10,000 and unlocked a new Float stretch goal. The Float prestige format hardcover edition will be now be printed exclusively for our Kickstarter backers. This edition of the book will not be available anywhere else.
WHO GETS THE HARDCOVER?
Float backers at $25 and up will now receive the hardcover edition of the book.
Early Bird reward package backers will also receive the hardcover upgrade.
CAN I GET THE HARDCOVER IF MY REWARD LEVEL IS UNDER $25?
If you're a "Just Float" reward level backer and you'd like to get the hardcover simply add $10 to your pledge amount or upgrade to any reward level $25 or higher.
When you upgrade, you will also receive all stretch goals unlocked including Float signed & sketched by Howie plus the signed album on CD.
Like 40 million others, I suffer from anxiety. This book details its effects on my life, my loves and my career. It’s the most personal story I’ve ever told but I hope that many of you will be able to relate to it. I’m hoping it helps you because making it has helped me. It has given me a brand new perspective on my illness.
It’s not a subject of shame. It’s a symbol of strength.
We don’t have to let anxiety drown us. We can float.
Float is told from the perspective of three characters which act as symbolic stand ins for my personality. Their tales all converge with a confrontation of the glass ceiling overhead.
 In its discussion of anxiety, this graphic memoir also reinterprets the glass ceiling. While the term is generally associated with women and minorities in their careers, it easily applies to those who deal with mental illness in their profession, and the stigma it carries. In the book, I have illustrated the ceiling as a physical threat.
We are now unlocking some amazing stretch goals on our way to the Float hardcover edition!
    I am excited to present this book to the public, as it is a departure from my previous work and a personal testimony of mental illness. I am an award-winning graduate of Pratt Institute and a freelance illustrator. My first graphic novel, Mr. Scootles, was published in 2008 by Alterna Comics. In April of 2009, my series Tara Normal launched as a popular weekly webcomic. It was awarded the 2009 WRCA Reader’s Choice Award for Best New Comic and appeared in TAPS Paramagazine, the official publication of the show Ghost Hunters on SyFy. I won the 2016 Spacie Award for Best Independent Comic Artist. In addition to illustration work for clients such as CBS Radio, T-Mobile, and two holiday themed pieces for the official Walking Dead website, I have also illustrated stories in the comic book collections Nightmare World, Tales of Mr. Rhee and Love Stories (To Die For) written by Dirk Manning and published by Devil's Due Entertainment. 
During this exciting new art project, I’ve collaborated with my friend, musician Victor Guest. Victor is a brilliant artist and working with him to expand the dimensions and scope of this project has been a dream come true. He’s creating a soundtrack to accompany this book. It will allow readers to experience Float in a unique way.
As part of this art project, my wife Shelley has created YourGlassCeiling.com. The website gives people the chance to really see into my life and how it's shaped this project. We're even giving people the chance to share their personal experiences on the Breakthrough Moments section of the site.
You can also view full pages of artwork from Float at this link: http://yourglassceiling.com/category/making-of/the-art-of-floating/
With your help, Float will become a unique visual and audio artistic presentation. 
All of our rewards are Kickstarter exclusives and will not be available anywhere else. campaign.story:
Rockwell Granger isn't exactly a bad guy. On the wrong side of 40 after turfing out of the military, he’s drifted from town to town and a series of dead-end kitchen jobs and quasi-legal freelance work. But his longtime dream of owning his own restaurant has finally come true, back in his hometown of Portland. Rock should be happier than ever, but the reality of his dream has a nasty habit of dragging him down. His customers are uncultured savages, he's not making enough money to pay back his loan sharks and they’re forcing him to do something morally iffy or they'll take his truck. And possibly his thumbs. 
 Harper Marbury isn’t exactly a thief. She works half a dozen side hustles to pay her rent at the Split Apple Co-Op Loft where she shares overcrowded floorspace with dozens of spare changers, young families, traveling musicians, burnouts and scam artists. Developing a love of cooking by throwing the random ingredients found in the Co-Op’s fridge every day together to feed her roommates, Harper’s been nurturing a dream of what she could do in a real kitchen, with real ingredients. When she breaks into Rock’s truck, mostly it’s to get out of the rain, but when he doesn’t show up, she opens up for business. Just to try it out. Just to see what it's like to cook in a real kitchen, with real ingredients.
When Rock busts Harper, he hires her on instead of kicking her to the curb, inducting her into the arcane rituals of food cart society, a land where every cart collective is a gang vying for territory and rivalries are resolved with food truck duels rolling down the middle of Hawthorne with baseball bats. While Harper learns the ropes, Rock begins his job for the Bardems, searching for the identity of a rogue food truck operator who’s invading the Bardem’s territories. Together with Harper, as his conscience and helping hand, they’ll navigate a world of secret menus, food pirates, culinary femme fatales, curmudgeonly dads, shadowy figures, creeps, foodies and 5 star ratings, trying to uncover the secret before the Bardems burn Rock’s world down.
SHORT ORDER CROOKS is a 5-issue, full-color comic that’s equal parts comedy, crime story and cooking comic. The first issue is due out in June 2017.  We have future arcs we would like to do to tell the complete story, but we need your help to fund this first arc and help us find an audience for our weird little book.
The Creators 
Eisner-nominated writer Christopher Sebela (High Crimes, Heartthrob, Injustice Ground Zero, We(l)come Back, I Live in A Clown Motel) 
Artist George Kambadais (Grave Lilies, The Double Life of Miranda Turner) 
Colorist Lesley Atlansky (Kid Sherlock, Team Spirit, Baroque Pop Anthology, High Crimes)
Short Order Crooks was initially created with Kelly Sue DeConnick (Bitch Planet, Pretty Deadly) back in 2010. After many years of other work getting in the way, Kelly Sue giving me her blessing to carry on without her and publishers reacting in mild confusion at the pitch, it is a comic that can only happen if we do it ourselves. We're asking for your support. Which is where Kickstarter comes in...
The Kickstarter
All money raised will go towards paying artist George Kambadais and colorist Lesley Atlansky's page rates for all five issues (120 pages) of SHORT ORDER CROOKS and to give backers some unique rewards. Since this is 100% creator-owned, there's no publisher's financing propping us up. The 15 pages we've done so far have been made on faith and spare time. Our Kickstarter goal is the bare minimum needed to bridge the gap that allows George and Lesley to be paid enough to commit to working on pages full time and to get copies of all five issues in the hands of readers. If you've liked any of our previous work or you support indie, creator-owned books or if you're looking for a comic that is a little off the normal path, we have a book (and some rewards) for you.
The Rewards
DIGITAL COPIES
- We'll send you a link to pdf/cbr files of each issue as we complete them.
PRINT COPIES- The print issues of SHORT ORDER CROOKS will only be available during this campaign as part of a Kickstarter-based print run. All copies will be signed by writer Christopher Sebela and numbered and mailed out upon completion of the issue.
THE SECRET MENU
- A digital pdf/cbr with almost 100 pages of behind-the-scenes process and artwork of issue #1. The Secret Menu will include the full script, as well as George’s inks and Lesley’s colors without lettering. Concept and sketch art, the original series pitch, character descriptions, a digital copy of issue 1 with notes and commentary and more. Almost all this material is exclusive to the Secret Menu. Perfect for completists or anyone interested in digging deeper into the comics creative process.
VARIANT COVERS- Each issue will be released with a variant, with cover art provided by a different artist every month. Our amazing roster of artists includes Claire Roe, Brian Level, Jonathan Brandon Sawyer, Robert Wilson IV and Chris Visions. These variants will never be made available again except as possible bonus material in whatever collected edition we come up with.
BOOKMARKS
- Cardstock, nice as heck, perfect for a large comic or a cookbook.
SHORT ORDER COOKS PRINT
- A two sided cardstock print, 6x9, by series artist and co-creator George Kambadais. Sometimes you're a Rock, sometimes you're a Harper.
ENAMEL PINS
- Everyone loves them, you want them, we're going to make them. These pins are still being fine-tuned, but they will look like this. Except smaller:
RETAILER PACKS
- For retailers only. 3 or 5 issue packs of Issue #1 or all 5 issues, with a retailer-exclusive cover. We'll thank your store in the back of the book.
PAINTINGS OF YOUR FAVORITE FOOD
Artist Kelly Williams will paint your favorite food in watercolors, 9x12. Your food will look like this:
SHIRTS
- 2 kinds to choose from, the Rock-o's Taco's shirt by George Kambadais or the Short Order Crooks logo by designer Dylan Todd.
DUMBSTRONAUT SPECIAL
- Get signed print copies of the runaway smash zines I LIVED IN A CLOWN MOTEL and POOL DISASTER. Or get them as digital copies, expanded with new content not available in the print versions, as well as the Kickstarter prose book I LIVE IN A CLOWN MOTEL.
FULL DUMBSTRONAUT- Sign up for the Full Dumbstronaut package and get the Clown Motel and Pool Disaster zines, the Clown Motel prose book and be among the first to get a pdf/cbr copy of my upcoming zine COFFEESHOP. DOG.
COMICS
- Get signed copies of books by writer Christopher Sebela such as Heartthrob, We(l)come Back v1 & 2, Demonic, Dead Letters, High Crimes or Injustice Ground Zero. Can be personalized for future gift giving.
CAMEO
- Your likeness will be used for one of the many people who populate the Crooksiverse. Will try to get you a line if I can, but no guarantees.
ART COMMISSIONS
- Series artist and co-creator George Kambadais will draw a commission for you and only for you. Make your friends jealous.
SCRIPT CONSULTATIONS
- Series writer and co-creator Christopher Sebela will work with you on a script or pitch of your choosing. Will provide notes, suggestions, have skype calls if you want to talk things out more directly. No OGN scripts. Don't have a script to go over now? Don't worry, this reward doesn't expire.
THE BIG NIGHT
- Get all 5 issues, regular and variants, the bookmark, the enamel pin, the print, the Secret Menu digital insider, a shirt and get thanked in the book.
THE IDIOT'S SPECIAL
- Since my last Kickstarter was about the Clown Motel and people keep bringing it up, I'm offering this as a rare chance to be an idiot and have the king idiot at your side. I will stay in your room or we can go separate. No weirdos. No murderers.
IF YOU WANT TO BUNDLE SOMETHING WITH ANOTHER REWARD LEVEL, PLEASE MESSAGE US AND WE WILL MAKE IT HAPPEN.
SOME FINE PRINT
Due to ordering requirements possibly leaving us with leftover stock, that stock will be sold after the campaign with preference given to retailers and then backers, all profits made going back into the book.
Print versions of Issue 1 will go out within a month of the campaign's completion, while we await the money to reach us and begin making orders. The remaining 4 issues will be coming out every 4-5 weeks with an eye towards completion around October or November of 2017. Updates will be provided on Kickstarter on a regular (no less than monthly) basis. 
The Money
We are looking to raise $16,000 minimum to pay artist George Kambadais and colorist Lesley Atlansky for their work on the book. At this minimum we raise, they are working at reduced rates and I am writing and lettering the book for zero money. If we can reach our stretch goal of $24,000, everyone will get paid their full page rate. 
There are no unnecessary costs in the mix, this is the absolute cheapest we can make a 5-issue comic series for while still paying everyone a proper rate for their work. Here is how the money breaks down. It's pretty simple.
  The Stretch Goals
Stretch goals are where campaigns get into trouble. We're doing our best to avoid that by not promising anything crazy. To be completely transparent, we would love to go above the goal not so we can get gold edges on our pages or embed holograms into the pdfs, but so that both George and Lesley can be paid their full working rates and I, hopefully, can be paid some compensation for writing, lettering and running the campaign. So we're trying to make this fun, but also not something that we actually have to pay a ton of money to make happen. In that spirit...
$18,000 - George, Lesley and I will record a director's commentary for all five issues, where we talk over each other and maybe bring up an interesting factoid every now and then. Listen to us slowly get tired of each other since we all spend most of our time working quietly by ourselves. Everyone who has given at the $5 and up levels will get mp3s of this to listen to as you read along. George and Lesley will get paid more.
$20,000 - Everyone who gives at the $5 and up level will receive a pdf book of recipes from famous comic book creators. Eat like the stars! George and Lesley will get paid more. I will get a small payment.
$22,000 - An illustrator will be hired to fancy up the comic creator's cookbook.George and Lesley will get their complete page rates. I will get a little more money.
$24,000 - Wow, we totally don't have to worry about anything at this point. Thank you. That's very nice of you. We will hug you at a con. The entire creative team will be properly compensated for their time, which hardly ever happens.
Future Stretch Goals
Any money raised beyond the 24k stretch goal will go strictly to paying the creators and put towards production of the 2nd arc of SHORT ORDER CROOKS. Rewards at this level and above will mostly be digital, perhaps with some slightly nicer paper stock for the print issues.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
All three of us are experienced in our respective fields in comics. We've hit deadlines for all kinds of publishers on time and we've worked on personal projects with similar swiftness and focus. We know what we're doing. We've got everything set on our end. The first issue is almost completed and will be done and ready to deliver within a week or two of the campaign wraps. We're doing our best to hit the ground running and have all five issues to you by October or November of this year.

This being comics and life being life, delays of a month or two might possibly be in the cards down the road, but updates and explanations will be quickly provided via Kickstarter as to any changes in delivery dates of issues and/or rewards.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
FINAL TWO DAYS! 
Hey everybody! We are over $9k and as a thank you we now have a free bookmark for all physical backers and stickers designed by Julian available. If you want to add the stickers to your order (physical backers only please), add $8 to your pledge and you will receive six 3" vinyl stickers. There are 5 designs pictured below and a sixth surprise design will be sent out to you! 
We still have 40 hours to go and we are $1000 away from our next goal, a pin designed by Julian. 
  Pin Designed by Julian Adkins 
UNLOCKED: 
Stickers designed by Julian Adkins offered in new rewards tiers
Free bookmark designed by Paul Rigg for all physical backers
  At $8500 this illustration will be printed as a 5x7 mini print and FREE for every backer at a physical level. This will be a limited print exclusively for the kickstarter. Thanks to Chris Lewis Lee for the beautiful illustration.
Galahad and the Far-Off Horizon is a 130 page collection of five stories, set in a fantastical world of witches, golems, and magical creatures. I've had the pleasure of working with some of my favorite artists over the past two years in bringing these stories to fruition, and - with your help - we'll be all set to take this anthology to print.
I owe many thanks to Chan Chau, Julian Adkins, John Adkins, Maria Frantz, Julie Godwin and Devin Kraft for helping make this project a reality. Their hard work and dedication can be seen in every single page of this book. Each of them brings a unique art style to the book, and it's fascinating to see their different interpretations of the character designs. I have linked their names to their previous work, so you can have and idea of what to expect in the anthology.
Below is a small preview of what they've created for Galahad and the Far-Off Horizon. As our campaign progresses, we will showcase each artist and what they've brought to the project.
   The beautiful wrap-around cover was painted by Julian Adkins, and Emily Osborne designed the vibrant endpapers. 
    The Garden of Galahad is a story about love and dedication. Galahad, an enchanted suit of armor, carries out the wishes of its master until the young witch Brynne interrupts its peaceful routine. Over hills, by seasides and past the ruins of old castles, the pair embark on the journey of a lifetime. Julian Adkins beautifully illustrates these pages with flatting assists by John Adkins. This story is 49 pages long and introduces the world in which all the following stories are set. Click here for a preview of the first ten pages.
   The four short stories, illustrated by Chan, Devin, Maria, and Julie, explore the backgrounds of key characters before The Garden of Galahad and help flesh out the world they live in. 
The Witches Laugh (8 pages) introduces us to a powerful coven.
Broken Keep (14 pages) looks back at the early life of Galahad's creator, Lance.
Tougher Than The Hills (26 pages) uncovers a mistake Brynne made in her youth.
When Magic Was Free (14 pages) details the tragic beginning of the series antagonist.
Along with the five stories that comprise the anthology, there are companion illustrations and a character gallery featuring artwork from some amazing folks. I'll be posting a few of these as the campaign rolls on. 
Digital and printed versions of Galahad and the Far-Off Horizon, as well as several different digital bundles are available now. 
There's also some extra goodies to choose from - postcards and posters - if you'd like even more of Galahad and the Far-Off Horizon in your life.
The wonderful Meredith McClaren has donated 20 hardcover copies of Hinges Book 1: Clockwork City. This is beautiful book collects the first chapter of Meredith's webcomic and each copy is signed and sketched.Grab one while you can! We are so very greatful for Meredith's donation and her support of our project.
As a thank you for your support in this project I am making two mini comics I've written, Adventures in Nate's Perilous Challenge illustrated by Jack Gross and Mother Made us to Die illustrated by Marek Jarocki available to all physical backers at $5 for the pair. You can click through on the titles and see a preview. Just add $5 to your pledge with a physical reward and both of these comics are yours!
We also have two original art tiers from Christa Dippel and Kristeen Parmeter and one digital commission from Julian Adkins, so be quick to jump on those if you're interested. These are available for international shipping as soon as the campaign launches.  
  As you can see, most of the Kickstarter funds will be dedicated to printing, with a couple thousand going to Kickstarter fees and shipping out rewards. We are not relying on funding to pay the artists; they have been compensated prior to the campaign. However, if the Kickstarter is funded beyond all of the stretch goals (i.e. past $20,000), a portion of the excess funds will be divided among the creators.
   Thank you so much for reading all the way through this. I appreciate your support and I cannot wait to have these print copies in my hand and in the mail to you.

Funds raised from this campaign will be used for packaging and production of our first official batch. Thank you for your support!
We started our journey with the purpose of offering a better pet food – one that’s nutritious and also reflects our ethical values as animal lovers.
It’s easy to forget where the food in our pets’ bowls comes from, and we believe the humane treatment of animals should extend to those that make up your pet’s diet.
Each Purpose Dog Food formula is made of real, locally sourced ingredients. It's a healthy diet based on what dogs eat in the wild. 
Purpose Treats for Dogs & Cats contain just one ingredient: a free-range or grass-fed protein sourced from American family farm. 
At Purpose, we believe you shouldn’t have to worry about what’s in your pet’s bowl or how the ingredients got there. 
  Purpose is 100% committed to providing the highest quality and healthiest freeze-dried dog food products and treats for dogs and cats. 
  Freeze-drying is an innovative process that locks in the nutritional value, taste, color and freshness of each ingredient, allowing your pet to enjoy the same great taste as regular raw food without safety issues.
Because the process removes moisture, it doesn't have to be kept frozen. Very convenient!
  PLAY

  Our food and treats are passionately prepared using humanely raised and human-grade, antibiotic-free and steroid-free meats, poultry, organic produce, minerals and vitamins in a human-grade food production facility.
There is no denying it! Feeding solely freeze-dried food to pets over 40 lb. can be expensive. That's why we suggest using our products as a topper or mixer with kibble if your dog is over 40 lb. This will dramatically increase the nutrition of the meal. 
Purpose Dog Food and Purpose Treats for Dogs & Cats are manufactured under the supervision of a USDA inspector who oversees and matches package claims.
We source vegetables, fruit and meats from suppliers who have passed an extensive vendor program required by the USDA and our manufacturing kitchen is USDA inspected and approved.
With Purpose, you are not only feeding your dog or cat top quality pet food and treats but you are are also supporting humane farm animal practices and American family farms. 
        Purpose Dog Foods are formulated to meet the nutritional levels established by the AAFCO Dog Food Nutrient Profiles for All Life Stages.
                     At Purpose, we believe in giving back to our communities. Since we are based in Queens, New York, backers have the option of donating Purpose products to the following local New York City animal rescues. 
Or, specify a rescue of your choice and we'll ship them your donated products! 
Rescue Dogs Rock NYC
Waggytail Rescue
  Know someone who might like our freeze-dried diets or want to support our mission? 
Share the campaign with your friends and family so that they can also get this special deal.
 
Thank you very much for your support.

campaign.story:
Neck Beard: Hillbilly For Hire issue #1 cover
THE STORY
Neck Beard follows the exploits of redneck monster-hunter Donny “Neck Beard” Cooper, Hillbilly For Hire, a man who has dedicated his life to hunting and killing all types of supernatural critters. The host of an exceptionally popular Youtube channel, Neck Beard travels the world putting the hurt on all creatures great and small.
Aided and abetted by his cameraman Buck, Neck Beard tackles all manner of paranormal monsters, from werewolves to zombies to vampires. Nothing is out of bounds for Neck Beard, Hillbilly For Hire!
WHY YOU SHOULD CARE
Neck Beard is a brand new 4-issue mini-series from creators Mark Bertolini, Joe Koziarski, Ellie Wright, and Micah Myers. At its core the project is a lighthearted take on monsters and rednecks, with a strong pulp fiction influence. Neck Beard will feature classic monsters, as well as brand new supernatural threats, all dealt with by a man who is intent on amassing a record-setting number of Youtube followers.
Think HELLBOY meets DUCK DYNASTY (with less judgment) and you’re on the right track!
THE PLAN
The Neck Beard team is already knee-deep in the production of this comic, but creating comics is not free. Using the funds from this Kickstarter, we will finish the debut 22-page issue of Neck Beard and keep the ball rolling from there. We will pitch the comic to publishers, but the backup plan is self-publishing and getting the series into the hands of fans and retailers.
THE TEAM
Mark Bertolini is a multi-time published comic book writer, and is the creator of books such as Scum of the Earth (Action Lab Danger Zone), Breakneck (215 Ink), and Knowledge (Markosia). Mark is a pulp fiction fan and tireless creator who wants nothing more than to bring his stories to life with the help of his collaborators! He can be found on Twitter @mark_bertolini, and at his blog: https://markbertolini.wordpress.com/
Joe Koziarski broke into comics penciling Speed Racer and The Twilight Zone for Now Comics. He’s continued to contribute to indie comics over the years including Z for Keystone Graphics, and more recently, The Ballad of Brigid of Atlanta for Creative Impulse and The Midnight Stranger for Will Lill comics. His work can be found at Koziarski.Deviantart.com
Ellie Wright is a colorist and animator. She has worked on a number of independent publications including comics from Affinity Press as well as being commissioned for a number of coloring and animation projects, she is a great lover of all things creative especially comics! All of her work can be found at elliemariemultimedia.com
Micah Myers is a freelance comic book letterer. He has lettered comics for multiple companies such as Action Lab, Zenescope, Alterna, 215 Ink, and Devil's Due Entertainment. He is the letterer of Elasticator (Scout Comics), Mercy Sparx (Devil's Due), and Adventures in Crime (Action Lab). He has also ventured into the world of writing, and is currently working on a supervillain team book called The Disasters for Loophole Comics.

campaign.story:
1st Stretch Goal Reached!!
Holy smokes - we've not only reached our initial funding goal, but just crested our 1st stretch goal as well! Which means that we've got enough to finance our film's opening sequence, in addition to the visual effects.
Huge thanks to our generous backers!
Anything else we can raise before the doors close will give us more flexibility in how we can achieve our ambitious workload. In the extremely unlikely scenario that we raise 60K, we will make training materials based on our visual effects work, release all of our Blender assets creative commons (BY-NC) after the film's release, and ship every backer who pledged $100 or more an extra print - of a full resolution frame from the film.
Thank you for getting us to this incredible milestone!
--Colin & the SKYWATCH team
----------------------
THE FILM
In the near future, a pair of mischievous friends hack into the infrastructure of a drone delivery system. As they reroute orders zipping through the sky, they set off a chaotic series of events and soon find themselves on the run from forces they can barely see.
SKYWATCH is an original sci-fi short that I’ve been working on for the past couple years. This project is designed to stand alone as a fun and gripping piece of entertainment, but is also intended to serve as a proof of concept for a mid-range live-action feature. Our goal is to build a world, set a tone, and introduce characters that could form the foundation of a compelling feature film. 
This has been a passion project for me and my core team. Throughout the process, we have relied heavily on the generosity of friends and volunteers. Now, we’re in postproduction - with over 150 visual effects shots to execute. We’ve got a good head start, but we need your help to complete the remaining shots. 
This Kickstarter campaign will fund the visual effects and remaining production to get this project across the finish line. When the short is finished, we will be releasing it for free online - for the world to watch!
THE TEAM
Our two young leads are rising stars Uriah Shelton (The Glades, Warrior’s Gate, Girl Meets World) and Zach Callison (Steven Universe, Mr. Peabody & Sherman), who deliver excellent performances. 
Our talented leads Uriah Shelton & Zach Callison
Our core creative team has made up of longtime friends and collaborators: myself (writer/director Colin Levy) producer Andre Danylevich, VFX Supervisor Sandro Blattner, and DP Adam Habib. The short was production designed by Julie Chen, Morgan Johnson is supervising the sound, and Jasper Blunk is composing the score. The talented Mike Sundy is co-authoring the feature screenplay, based on the short.
PREVIOUS WORK
Before dedicating myself to SKYWATCH, I worked at Pixar Animation Studios as a Camera & Staging Artist, working on several features including INSIDE OUT and FINDING DORY, and serving as the Camera DP for the animated theatrical short LAVA.
  I also have directed several short films in the past, including THE SECRET NUMBER, which was successfully funded on Kickstarter, and the animated short SINTEL, which has over 4.5M views on YouTube - and was made entirely with the Open Source software Blender.
Visit my PORTFOLIO SITE for more.
WORLD & THEMES
SKYWATCH takes place in a future defined by immediacy and convenience. In the world of our short film, you can order anything - anytime, anywhere - and have it delivered into your home in minutes. A physical pipeline now exists in every home, building and skyscraper - pneumatic tubes that funnel products right to your fingertips. But at what cost? Our short explores themes of voyeurism and surveillance, privacy, identity, and control. In some ways, we’re telling a cautionary tale about the sacrifices we make in the name of convenience - in a future where corporations have immense power and control over how and what we consume.
THE VISUAL EFFECTS
Our VFX team has high standards. Our lofty aim is for SKYWATCH to be visually indistinguishable from a Hollywood blockbuster. Of course, working without the resources of a studio has meant making sacrifices – in our case, time. Our small but dedicated international team started modeling, shading and rigging our assets in early 2015. Now, our key assets are complete - and it’s time for the animation, lighting and compositing of shot work. We’ve made it through two of our six sequences, but we still have over 150 shots to complete.
We chose to use the Open Source 3D software Blender for the CG work in this project. Even after using Pixar’s Presto for years, Blender remains my favorite tool for 3D. Partially due to the thriving community of artists and potential collaborators, we have developed a Blender-centric pipeline that also includes Nuke and Houdini - and we’ve been very pleased with the results.
STRETCH GOALS
Raising $35K is literally the bare minimum we need to be able to bring on freelance VFX artists to finish the film. This figure doesn't include the additional photography that we still need for our film’s opening, nor any funds for the final tasks of music/color/sound design. For a variety of reasons, it would be phenomenal to have a bit more wiggle room in the budget. 
We know it's a longshot, but better to be overambitious, right? Here are our Kickstarter STRETCH GOALS:
$45,000 - PRODUCTION: In addition to sound, music and color, we will be able to finance production for our film's "cold open.” Although it was in our original shooting script, we’ve simply not had the bandwidth to tackle it - which I think is a daggone shame! This stretch goal would pay for actors, food, crew, and the same high end film gear that was used for principal photography. Help me make my original vision a reality!
If we reach this stretch goal we will make some of our HERO ASSETS available to our backers in .blend format. Play with the rigs, examine our node trees, or create your own animations!
$60,000 - VFX VENDOR: At this level, instead of hiring individual freelancers for visual effects, which requires a huge amount of coordination and overhead, we can consider working with a small studio or VFX vendor. Which would be awesome! With these additional resources, we could get the work done in less time - and perhaps achieve a couple additional dream shots while we’re at it.
If we hit this stretch goal, we will make training materials based on our visual effects work, release all of our Blender assets creative commons (BY-NC) after the film's release, and ship every backer who pledged $100 or more an extra print - of a full resolution frame from the film.
$100,000 - IDEAL BUDGET: To be honest, even 60K is chump change for most VFX vendors. With this stretch goal, we would assuredly be able to find a suitable studio, and could accomplish all our goals for VFX and remaining production without sacrificing quality - or asking people to work for free. And while I’m dreaming, I'd love to develop a website and produce a fictional TV commercial for our near-future drone delivery service, which I feel could be a great companion piece for the short!
THE REWARDS
We’re excited to finally share a glimpse of the film with the world! If you like what you see, we hope you consider backing the project. 
We have some nifty rewards - but you'll notice that a lot of 'em are digital. For this campaign, I’d like to really focus on putting as many dollars on the screen as possible - and make sure we can deliver our rewards in a timely fashion. Thank you!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
SKYWATCH is an ambitious project and while we are confident in our abilities and our track record, we have a lot of work ahead of us! As with every film project we've done, there will be bumps in the road - challenges and unforeseen circumstances that will affect how we move ahead. But in bringing the project to this point, we have already had our fair share - and have gotten pretty good at rolling with the punches!

It's probably worth saying that there has been an incredible amount of sweat, blood, time and money invested in this project already - so there's no way we're *not* going to get it done.

Perhaps a more relevant concern is the Kickstarter rewards themselves - that takes a lot of work too! I learned that lesson the hard way on my previous campaign for my film The Secret Number. (So. many. postertubes.) This time around, I won't be doing it all myself - and the workload will be decidedly sane: we have been careful to select rewards that we know that we can fulfill responsibly and in a timely manner once the film is completed. 

Thank you for taking a chance on us!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
