updates.update_content:
Hi Kickstarter,
I know I left the last post on a bit of a cliffhanger: "What happened with Skywatch??"
I'm guessing many of you probably already know the answer-- because a couple days later, the cat leapt out of the bag in the form of a press release of sorts, out on the greater internet. Somehow it made it into all the major entertainment industry trade publications!

Hey Kickstarter,
With everything going on in the world, it feels like years have passed since we released Skywatch online. These months have been a whirlwind – for a whole slew of reasons. The beginnings of COVID-19 felt like a dystopic sci-fi movie... and that was just the beginning of the 2020 rollercoaster. My relationship with social media has been challenged a bit too; against the backdrop of Hugely Important Things, it feels a bit solipsistic to be demanding space on the internet for my dinky lil short film.

Today's the big day! 
So proud to finally share SKYWATCH with you – and the entire internet.
Huge, huge thanks to each and every one of you for helping us get to this point. I'm so proud of what we managed to pull off.
Now. Dim the lights, crank the volume...and ENJOY the full film!

Hi all!
The short film releases to the world in just 24 HOURS!! Really could use your help spreading the YouTube link far and wide. I'll be updating everyone at this time – 8am PST – tomorrow. :)
In the meantime! Wanted to post about the "NexPort Commercial." As you may (or may not) recall, our big "Stretch Goal" back in 2017 was to shoot a new opening for the short film.

updates.update_userinfo: Introducing NexPort: The Future of Home Delivery
updates.update_content:
Howdy all! Only FOUR DAYS to go before the big Online Release.
Four days!!
You and I have some catching up to do, but first: just wanted to say how excited I am that we're finally, finally here. I've never worked on something as long as I've worked on Skywatch... and I hope to keep it that way! 😛

The time has finally come to share SKYWATCH with the world!
In just two weeks, we'll be releasing the short online. (Can you believe it?? I couldn't sleep last night I was so excited.)
So mark your calendars! The big day is Wednesday, December 4th, 2019.
Our talented friend Bailey Kalesti produced this fantastic Teaser Poster:

Hey all,
Good news! Things are starting to get real. First: Skywatch is screening THIS MONTH at the Austin Film Festival! That's right, we're finally having our WORLD PREMIERE. AFF is an awesome festival (one of the very few I've actually attended before!), and hopefully it's the first of many.
So: I'll be in Austin, TX for the two screenings, on Oct. 25th & 28th. If any backers are in the area or want to come out and see it on the big screen, please reach out! I have tickets!

campaign.story:
UPDATES:
2/1 - New stretch goals added!
 BAROQUE POP is an eighty-page comic anthology produced by Mario Candelaria and is being released by Red Stylo Press. Inspired by the music of Lana Del Rey, Baroque Pop is a carefully curated selection of short form comics and illustrations celebrating love, loss, success, and change by comic creators who came together after finding mutual solace and inspiration in her music.
Cover by Jim Towe
 Baroque Pop is both an homage to Lana as well as a testament to the imagery and symbolism this modern day muse draws out of artists and writers. Her melodies invoke a sense of longing and wonder and endless hope. Mixed with instrumental tracks that feel cinematic in scope, her tunes practically invite the imagination to run wild painting tiny pictures with the emotions released in every bar, in every hook, until each album resembles a mosaic reflecting our deepest desires and secrets with each subsequent listening
In keeping with the music theme, the book itself will be printed at 7x7 inches to physically resemble a 45 RPM record cover.
Since production on the anthology is close to being wrapped, this campaign is to help fund a modest printing run so we will be able to start shipping out the books right away.
The book features seven short stories by:
♢ Chuck Harrison & Luke Marrone
♢ Daniel Charles & Ashley St. Lawrence (with Scott Ewen)
♢ Jennie Wood & Chris Goodwin
♢ Enrica Jang & Jan Velazquez
♢ Mario Candelaria & Katarzyna Witerscheim
♢ Michael Lynch & Mira Mortal
♢ Eric Palicki & Daniel Earls
And five portraits by:
♢ Jim Towe
♢ Adam Ferris (feat. Lesley Atlansky)
♢ John Keaveney
♢ Hoyt Silva
♢ Fabian Lelay (feat Lesley Atlansky)
We are coming to Kickstarter because this is a small creator owned passion project that was put together entirely by fans of Lana. While we have high hopes, anthologies are still a very niche market that many mainstream publishers will not take a chance on unless there are big rewards in it for them. This is a book by the fans for the fans and we have known this from the project's conception.
Putting this anthology together ourselves means we have direct control of how the final product looks. A painstakingly large level of detail has gone into designing this book. From the beginning we set out to distinguish ourselves from other anthologies. From the 7x7 square shape of the book to the higher quality paper to the perfect gold foil on the cover, everything was designed to put quality over quantity and that expense is reflected below in the goal.
Since the book has been completed it will still be released if we do not make our goal, but it will remain in a digital format until the collective can raise the funds to produce a modest print run -- and given this age of pirating, that would likely take a while. This is a passion project and it needs passionate support.
Goal breakdown.

*No Guarantee that your book will get picked up, as it's a CRAZY industry, but I'll do everything in my power to get your book noticed and give it the best opportunity.

campaign.story:
CARELS RING by SHANNON LENTZ
An old man trapped on a suicidal, planet sized super-computer, escapes and goes searching for his unknown grandchild.
CAYRELS RING - Issue One "Rend it"
Cayrels Ring is a 40 page, full color comic book that builds a new galaxy, featuring many worlds and many people. The first story arc, "Rend It", is told in eight chapters with each chapter being illustrated by a different artist.
I’ve called this unique process the STACKS UNIVERSE as it takes multiple short stories, illustrated by different artists, stacking them up to make a single cohesive story. 
"Rend It" follows many narratives including that of Jamitch, a scientist trapped on a planet sized supercomputer gone suicidal. Jamitch manages to escape and goes searching for his unknown grandchild. The fallout of his actions and the fate of the suicidal supercomputer is far reaching.
This first story in CAYRELS RING sets the table for a wealth of stories about those who live and die in this far away Ring Galaxy. 
Here is a sneak peak at the first chapter with art by Alchemichael and colors by Cassie Kelly.
Cayrels Ring is the brainchild of writer Shannon W. Lentz. He has gathered up some of the top indie comic book talent to collaborate and bring life to this complex galaxy.
BRANDON GRAHAM
Brandon Graham is an artist and writer known for his amazing books including KING CITY, Escalator, Walrus, MULTIPLE WARHEADS, and the Extreme relaunch of PROPHET, which he writes and sometimes draws. He also is the co-curator of the comics anthology/magazine Island also published by Image Comics.
Multiple Warheads by Brandon Graham
SIMON ROY
Simon's work can be seen in the pages of PROPHET(Image Comics) where he helped create some of the best, most mind bending  science fiction recently seen in the North American comic scene. He recently wrapped up working on his book HABITAT, also published by Image comics.
Habitat by Simon Roy
FAREL DALRYMPLE
Farel Dalrymple created an amazing book called THE WRENCHIES, from First Second Books. Farel’s Eisner nominated webcomic, IT WILL ALL HURT is available in three comics book issues from Study Group Comics. Delusional, (Adhouse, 2013) is a collection of personal work, comic short stories, illustrations, and sketches. Farel was also the artist on Omega the Unknown (Marvel Comics 2010), with writer Jonathan Lethem. His creator owned comic book, Pop Gun Wars which has recently been featured in ISLAND (Image comics). He also did some amazing work in PROPHET (see below).
Spread by Farel Dalrymple from the pages of PROPHET #29.
ALCHEMICHAEL
Alchemichael has been making a name for himself through his fantastic Tumblr feed as well as his work on HEART OF WEIRDNESS. You'll see his work featured onthis months cover of ISLAND Magazine. Alchemichael's art is also seen above in the first Chapter of Cayrels Ring.
Heart of Weirdness by Alchemichael and Seth Jacob
AARON CONLEY
Aaron is the artist and co-creator of SABERTOOTH SWORDMAN (Second edition coming out next month) from Dark Horse Comics and the 2014 winner of the prestigious Russ Manning Promising Newcomer Award.  His work can be found in the Marvel comics Rocket Raccoon & Groot #4 and Secret Wars: Battleworld #3 as well as several other amazing books.
SABERTOOTH SWORDSMAN by Aaron Conley and Damon Gentry
GRIM WILKINS
Grim Wilkins has been drawing and self-publishing comics for the better part of a decade. He is known for his creatively composed comics pages and surprisingly whimsical characters. His work can currently be seen in the pages of PROPHET (Image Comics) and Speculative Relationships 2, as well as Little Nemo: Dream Another Dream (Locust Moon Press), in various Spectrum annuals and CFSL Artbooks, and in his old self-published comics like Love Story in the Woods and Ellipses. You might know him from his two successful Kickstarters for MIRENDA.
Mirenda by Grim Wilkins
 FILYA BRATUKHIN 
Mysterious young super artist out of Russia. I seriously know little about this man other than he is one talented dude. Filya makes Darrows hands ache simply by looking at his work. Check-out his Tumblr. I'm sure you'll be seeing his work in other books soon.
FILYA BRATUKHIN
 AARON PETOVELLO
Aaron writes and draws a web comic about the first World War. 
Pro Patria Mori by AARON PETOVELLO
 CASSIE KELLY
The book will be colored by Cassie Kelly. An artist and colorist whose color work has appeared in Cluster (Boom Studios) and Invader Zim (Oni).
MOON
A digital copy of CAYRELS RING. 
ASTEROID
A print copy of the 40 page book along with a digital copy too. A big thank you in the book too.
SETI - VANCOUVER TRANSMISSION 
This reward level is aimed at Vancouver, BC backers who don't want to pay for shipping. We are offering local pick-up and along with your copy of CAYRELS RING being signed by the local Vancouver team working on the project. That includes Shannon Lentz, Brandon Graham, Simon Roy, Alchemichael and Aaron Petovello.
If your local and want the Lanz print or the Postcard panels, be sure to add $11 to your pledge for the postcards and $14 for the print. You will be able to chose them as add-ons when the campaign closes but you must have pledged the extra amount.
ASTEROID BELT
This one is for the retailers. You'll get 4 copies of the book for half the cover price. A digital copy for yourself too and a big thank you in the book.
NEBULA
Along with everything in the ASTEROID level, you'll get a limited edition 8.5 x11 inch print by artist SANDRA LANZ.
Exclusive Print by Sandra Lanz (design may change)
QUASAR
Along with everything in the ASTEROID level, you'll a get a set of 8 CAYRELS RING POSTCARD PANELS. 
Each artist will choose their favourite panel to be turned into a beautiful postcard. 
COMET
Everything in the ASTEROID level plus two character portraits by CASSIE KELLY. These prints will be 5 x 7, limited to 20 each and will be numbered and signed by Kelly.
PULSAR
You'll get both the print and postcard set. Along with everything from the ASTEROID level.
THE GALAXY
Along with everything in the ASTEROID level, you can snag up the one-of-a-kind watercolour painting depicting CAYRELS RING. 
This painting will be featured in every issue of the comic, letting the reader know where the action is taking place.
The Galaxy, painted by Shannon Lentz
NEUTRON STARS
This is your chance to get an original piece of art by BRANDON GRAHAM, SIMON ROY, FAREL DALRYMPLE, AARON CONLEY, ALCHEMICHAEL, AARON PETOVELLO and CASSIE KELLY.
Also available as a reward is the SANDRA LANZ's original art of the exclusive Cayrels Ring print.
Sandra Lanz's Original art used for the exclusive print
These rewards are limited to only one for each artist. Once they are claimed, that's it!
You'll of course get everything included in the ASTEROID level.
We have only one stretch goal with this campaign. A higher page rate for all the artists involved.

“Built to” (working title) is a site-specific dance project that combines the worlds of sustainability and the performing arts. This collaborative project between LEAFHouse and Chelsea Boyd Brown & Collaborators explores the idea of sustainable structures in our relationships, our anatomy, our houses, and our planet. During “Built to,” audience members will be led on an experience around and through LEAFHouse. Come watch dancers near and far, hear local music, add plants to the green wall, and taste local foods. This is an immersive event for all audiences! 
Performances are Saturday, May 13th, 2017 at 5pm and 7pm. Tickets must be purchased in advance, as audience sizes are limited. Ticket information coming spring 2017.

campaign.story:
Welcome to our 30th Anniversary Season!
As Merce Cunningham would say, "And we begin... again."
JERUSALEM, ISRAEL, January 2017: We begin our newest collaboration with Zvi Sahar, the brilliant Israeli artistic director of PuppetCinema. His performance of "Salt of the Earth" last spring blew us away with his artistry, sublime imagery and lighting Orson Welles would savor. Stay tuned for this remarkable journey that will take us deeper into where we long to be....
ESSEN, GERMANY, June 2017: Deep in the heart of Pina Bausch land, we have been invited to create a site-specific dance with PWDT and Folkwang Tanz Studio, the resident professional dance company of Folkwang University that used to be directed by Pina herself. Over three weeks, we will be rehearsing in the stunningly cool SANAA building and on the grounds of one of the region's most significant and beautiful coal and iron foundries.
BATES DANCE FESTIVAL, August 2017: In July we will return to the Bates Dance Festival for a performance and classes, celebrating the legacy of the one and only director Laura Faure. Not only has Laura supported our work for over twenty years, but has nurtured a utopian dance community for thousands of people throughout the world.
And since our last Kickstarter:
CUBA, February 2016: Thanks to your support, we began 2016 with a PWDT tour to Cuba, where we performed, taught workshops, and began collaborating on a site-specific performance installation in a gorgeous 16th century fort in Old Havana. We are hoping to return in 2018 to premiere the work in celebration of its designation as a UNESCO world heritage site.
SENEGAL, June 2016: In June we spent a week at the iconic Ecole des Sables, created by the visionary mother of African contemporary dance, Germaine Acogny. A dream come true for Patrik – this was the school he had hoped to attend at the very beginning of his dance career. Throughout the week, we were immersed in classes, performances, and discussions with emerging dance artists from 14 African countries, and started a beautiful friendship with Germaine.
JOE'S PUB, NYC, September 2016: We previewed our new solos this past fall at the Dance Now Festival – Patrik's "...and still doing", inspired by a dream he had of Yoko Ono, and Sara's "The Beginning of Forgiveness." Deborah Jowitt wrote: ..."the effect is one of both confinement and wildness... rueful, witty, heart-twisting."
WASHINGTON, DC, October 2016: We premiered a new site dance for the Dance Place Gala honoring directors Carla Perlo and Deborah Riley who will be retiring this year – what an honor to be invited to celebrate these remarkable women!
Throughout these 30 years – thanks to you – we have been able to tour with our company throughout Europe, Latin Armerica, and Asia, from NYC to Beijing to Kyoto, from Lincoln Center to the Kennedy Center, from the London Dance Umbrella to the International Dance Festival in New Delhi, from working with at risk girls and Somali immigrants in Lewiston, Maine to collaborating with martial artists, bakers, musicians, planners and remarkable dance artists thought the world.
Please support our newest collaborations in Israel and Germany!
We need your help to raise $10,000 to make these invitations a reality. We have already secured $30,000 from grants and commissions, and now look to you.
We are so grateful for your belief in our work, and for your generous help throughout these years.
With kansha, that untranslatable Japanese word that is a mixture of appreciation and awe.
Sara & Patrik
